loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou S.  est membre de banc villageois de Mbousnack depuis 7 ans. Son activité est  la vente de céréales. Elle veut acheter du mil, du niébé et des arachides pour renforcer son commerce et améliorer ses conditions de vie.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Astou S. has been a member of the Mbousnack village bank for seven years. Her business is the sale of grain. She wants to buy millet, black-eyed peas and peanuts to bolster her business and improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan, to be reimbursed after six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of millet, black-eyed peas and peanuts

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est membre  de ce groupement depuis 7 ans. Elle mène une activité de vente de céréales locales comme le mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Son objectif est de participer beaucoup plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou S. has been a member of this association for seven years. She runs a business selling locally-grown plants like millet, peanuts and beans. Her goal is to take a much larger part in improving her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of millet, peanuts and beans

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 24-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Hasan has owned a stationary shop since 1999. Hasan requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Hasan has requested a loan. 
Hasan is special because he has competitive prices. His clients are friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Hasan decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah N. is the mother of three children and she is able pay for their education with money she saved from her last loan. She is 44 years old and has been in the business of farming and selling what she grows for eight years. She also sells goods for other farmers in the area. A few things she sells are matooke, cassava, maize and beans. She now owns a home that she built from the proceeds of her previous loans and she also has cows for milk. She and the other members of her loan group are excited to further grow their businesses and they are grateful for your support.

loans.use: To invest in farming

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Madame Astou B. est une femme mariée qui a l’âge de 32 ans, elle habite au quartier Cité Lamy de Thiès. Elle faisait le petit commerce de parfums depuis 3 ans. Elle a démarré son activité avec ses propres fonds et elle a décidé d’intégrer l’IMCEC pour renforcer son activité et est à son premier prêt. Avec ce crédit, elle va acheter du parfum et d’encens.  Elle espère avoir un bénéfice de 75000CFA ($150) avec lequel elle  peut rembourser les intérêts du prêt et le reste elle l’investit dans son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Astou B. is a married woman who is 32 years old. She lives in the Cité Lamy district of Thiès. She has had a small business selling perfumes for three years. She started her business with her own funds. She decided to join IMCEC to bolster her business, and is now on her first loan. With this loan, she's going to buy some perfumes and incense. She hopes to obtain a profit of 750,000 francs CFA with which she can make loan interest payments and invest the rest in her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes and incense

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 56-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Khalil has owned a printing factory for fifteen years. Khalil requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his factory. This is the first time that Khalil has requested a loan. 
Khalil is special because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing the machines for his work because he didn’t have enough cash. Khalil decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his factory.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his factory.

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en: N. Robinah is the leader of the Matale loaning group. She is married and helps cater to four dependents. Robinah has a bar business where she sells cold drinks such as sodas, mineral water, wines, beers and local brew (malwa and tonto). She now has a banana plantation with food that she sells and uses for home business consumption. She says she is taking the loan in order to expand and restock because the profits from her business go towards her family.  Robinah needs to buy more drinks for her bar so that she can sell more because her loyal customers will drink all that she stocks. She is grateful for her loans and her loaning group because they are cooperative and advise each other through their businesses.

loans.use: Buying more drinks for her bar.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife. Ali has been working at furniture making for ten years. He requested a loan of 1300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase wood for his business. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. 
Ali is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulty. He decided on doing his business because he took after his father work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass has owned a butcher shop since 2006. He is a 53-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Abass has requested a loan of $2000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and tools for his shop. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his shop as well as his financiA. situation. Abass knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have start-up capitA.. He decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and tools for a butcher shop

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en:
Ebrahim has owned a clothing shop since 2006. When he first started his shop, the 2006 war broke out which forced him to close his shop for a while. He lost some of his merchandise and he had to redo the décor and purchase new merchandise. He has passed through some hard times and faced a critical financial situation since he put all his savings into the shop.

Ebrahim's clients can be anybody. Ebrahim chose this business because he wanted to work independently. He is 50-years old and lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Ebrahim has requested a loan of $3000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. In the future, he plans on expanding his shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a clothing shop

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en: K. Moses is a young hard working man who has run a salon business for six years. He began working at a young age after he dropped out of school for financial reasons. He has been working longer hours in order to make his children’s lives easier and more bearable in the future. With his previous loan, he was able to purchase a chair and a shaving machine and with this is why he needs to buy others, plus combs, spirits, and fumes for his customers.

loans.use: Buying fumes, spirits, combs and others for his barber shop.

loans.name: Ndiaga

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndiaga Y. est un tailleur qui habite  au quartier Cité Lamy de Thiès, il est marié et a l’âge de 38 ans. Tailleur de profession depuis très jeune, il a fait 6 ans en Mauritanie et Gambie. Après il a ouvert son atelier au marché Khelcom de Thiès et maintenant il a décidé de mener une activité parallèle d’où l’objet de son prêt au niveau de l’IMCEC. L’activité consiste à acheter un cheval et une charrette  pour son oncle.  Les charrettes sont un type de transport qui marche bien à Thiès. Les bénéfices seront partagés et seront destinés à rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndiaga Y. is a tailor who lives in the Cité Lamy district of Thiès. He is married and is 38 years old. As a professional tailor since he was very young, he spent six years in Mauritania and in Gambia. Afterward, he opened his own workshop at the Khelcom marketplace of Thiès. Now he's decided to run another business concurrently, which is the plan for his loan from IMCEC. This business involves buying a horse and a cart for his uncle. Carts are a type of transportation that works nicely in Thiès. The profits will be shared and set aside for repaying the loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a horse and cart

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 38 year old woman who lives with her husband in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. She has owned a clothing shop for four years.

Manal requested a loan of $800 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.

Manal’s clients can be anybody from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulty. She decided on starting her business because of her financial need. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 21 year old woman who lives with her husband in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Fatima has owned a mobile phone shop since 2007.

She requested a loan of 1000 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop and to start selling mobile phone recharge cards. This is the first time that Fatima has requested a loan.

Her clients can be anybody from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulty. Fatima decided on starting her business because of her financial need. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop and to start selling mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en: Oksana is married with two daughters. She owns a business that sells food. Her monthly income is 4,000 UAH. Oksana has been in this business for 5 years. Her small store is located in a village close to Drogobych city. She provides people who live in the village with food as well as make some income for herself. Oksana would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to increase the assortment. This would bring her more income and help to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to increse the assortment

loans.name: Rabii

texts.en: Rabii is a thirty-four year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their five children. He has owned a shoe shop for three years. He originally decided to establish his shop because of his financial need, but he didn’t have the startup capital.  Rabii requests a loan of $1500 from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. His clients can be anybody from his region.  In the future, Rabii plans to further develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Zouher

texts.en:
Zouher is a fifty-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Zouher has owned a home product shop since 2002. He requested a loan of $1200 from Al Majmoua, one of Kiva's field partners, in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve both his business and his financial situation. Zouher's shop is well-known because he has a wide variety of products. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had only a small amount of capital. He decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a fifty-year-old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. Sonia has owned an accessory shop since 1982. She also sells beauty products. She requested a loan of $1000 from one of Kiva's field partners, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that Sonia has requested a loan. 
Sonia is exemplary in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. They are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, it was a success. Sonia decided to open her business because of her financial need. In the future, she plans to maximize her business by selling clothes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Souhail

texts.en:
Souhail is a forty-nine-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Souhail owns a grocery store. He requested a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua, a Kiva field partner, in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his work and his financial situation. Souhail is exceptional in his work because he has a big variety of products. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had no difficulty. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Tuulituka Group

texts.en: Josephine is a 47 year old woman with 6 kids.  Her kids range from ages 11 to 15. Her youngest child is currently in a private primary school and her oldest child is a teacher.  Josephine also cares for 4 additional children, two grandchildren and one niece and one nephew. Josephine has been supporting her family with her pharmacy. She has been running her pharmacy with the help of one other person, for about 10 years now. She says that her success comes from her ability to connect with customers. Josephine is requesting a loan of 2 million USH.  This loan will help her to restock medicines in her shop, buy more food and medicine. pay school fees for her children, and generally help her family. Josephine dreams that some day at her pharmacy she will have all the medicines that her customers could ever ask for. For her family, she dreams that all her children to finish school and get good jobs.

loans.use: To restock medicines, and pay school fees.

loans.name: Nagah

texts.en:
Nagah is a fifty-year-old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband. She has been selling accessories and Brazilian gold from her house since 2002. She requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua, one of Kiva's field partners, in order to purchase merchandise for her business. This is the first time that Najah has requested a loan. 
Najah is well-known in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, all went well. In the future, she plans to build up her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 44 year old woman who lives with her husband and their five children in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Mona has been working as a seamstress for twenty years.

She requested a loan of 500 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her sewing. This is the first time that Mona has requested a loan.

Mona is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had to face the competition. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by opening a shop.

loans.use: To purchase thread for her sewing

loans.name: Magid

texts.en:
Magid has owned a grocery store since 1993. He is a 37-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. He has requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Magid has requested a loan.

Magid carries a great variety of products. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a grocery store

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 44 year old man who lives with his wife and their child in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. He has worked as a car painter for four years.

Maher requested a loan of 1000 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Maher has requested a loan.

Maher is speciA. because he has competitive prices. His clients are friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Maher decided on starting his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: Madame Magatte M. est une femme mariée  qui a l’âge moyenne de 49 ans, elle habite au quartier hersent de Thiès. Elle est commerçante de céréales locales, huile de palme et poissons sècs. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis sept ans avec ses propres fonds, et elle maîtrise bien ce secteur. Pour renforcer son activité elle a décidé d’intégrer l’IMCEC, et est à son premier prêt. Elle réalise un bon chiffre d’affaire qui lui permet de bien rembourser le crédit  du , et de participer à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Ms. Magatte M. is a married woman who is about 49 years old. She lives in the Hersent district of Thiès. She is a merchant of local grains, palm oil, and dried fish. She started this business seven years ago with her own funds. She has a very good command of this business sector. To bolster her business, she decided to join IMCEC, and she is now on her first loan. She has good sales figures that enable her to repay the loan and to help cover day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local grains, palm oil, and dried fish

loans.name: Mahasen

texts.en:
Mahasen has owned a shoe store for five years. Mahasen is a 44-year old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. She has requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Mahasen has requested a loan.

Her clients can be anybody from her region. She has not faced difficulties since she first started her business. Mahasen chose this business because of financial need. In the future, she plans on expanding her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a shoe store

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil has been selling birds for four years. Khalil is a 43-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their six children. Khalil has requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase birds and bird food. This is the first time that Khalil has requested a loan.

Khalil has the only business of this type in his region. His clients are friends and neighbors. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his business. Khalil decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase birds and bird food

loans.name: Kvetoslava

texts.en:
Kvetoslava lives with her daughter in Mukachevo city. She has owned her own business for the past six years. Kvetoslava is an honest person, and treats her clients with respect. She offers a wide range of products at an affordable and manageable price. Her customers are always satisfied with their experience.

Kvetoslava is requesting a loan to increase her inventory range. She hopes to increase sales and expand her business further with this loan.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph owns a men's clothing shop. He is 42-years old and lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife. Joseph has requested a loan of $1500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase clothes for his shop. Joseph has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always repaid on time.

Joseph's previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his business. Joseph decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his shop.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for a shop

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal has owned a clothing and shoe shop for a year. She is a 43-year old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Jamal has requested a loan of $1500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that Jamal has requested a loan.

Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists. She hasn't faced any difficulties since she first started her business. Jamal started this business because of financial need. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: Topurchase merchandise for a clothing and shoe shop

loans.name: Housein

texts.en:
Housein is a 27 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon. Housein has been working as a car repairer since 1996.  Housein requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. Housein has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.
His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Housein decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding a shop.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his garage.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad has owned a faux bijoux shop since 1997. Emad is a 37-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Emad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. Emad has been a microcredit client for nine years now and has always repaid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his business. Emad decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his shop.

loans.use: Houssam will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Houssam has owned a tire shop for seven years. He requested a loan of $1,500 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tires for his store. This is the first time that Houssam has requested a loan.

Houssam is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulty. Houssam decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Houssam will use the loan to purchase tires for his store

loans.name: Hsien

texts.en:
Hsien has been working as a furniture repairman for twenty years. He is a 38-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Hsien has requested a loan of $1500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his shop. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. His clients can be anybody from his region. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his business. Hsien chose this business out of financial need. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for a furniture repair shop

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan has been producing agrifood products since 2007. Hassan is a 59-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Hassan has requested a loan of $1000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan.

Hassan is known for the good quality of his products. His clients are friends, neighbors and people from his region. He has not faced any difficulties since he first started his business. Hassan decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares has been working as a car repairman since 1996. Fares is a 47-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Fares has requested a loan of $2500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his business. Fares decided on this business because he wanted to use his experience and he also wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on improving his shop.

loans.use: To purchase tools for a garage

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is married and has two children. She sells threads for knitting and sewing and she has been in this business for 11 years. Originally her friends helped her to start this business and choose type of goods, but now Elena runs her own business. These goods are extremely unique, and the competition is very low, but the demand is rather large. Elena's goal in business is to develop it even further and have more clients. She hopes to receive more profit and improve her living conditions. Her family lives in a small two rooms apartment that needs some repairs.

loans.use: to increase the inventories

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol has owned a grocery store for four years. Carol is a 36-year old divorced woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her child. She has requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Carol has requested a loan.

Carol sells a great variety of products. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and people from her region. She has not faced difficulties since she first started this business. In the future, she plans on improving her business and increasing her income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a grocery store

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 21 años, a su corta edad se siente en la responsabilidad de apoyar con los gastos familiares, ella vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más quiere es ayudarles a tener una vida tranquila. Para ella, su juventud no ha sido un impedimento para querer salir adelante, lleva 5 años trabajando en su tienda de abarrotes y lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus clientes, de esta manera hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Bertha pudo poner su bodega gracias al apoyo de sus padres, quienes no dudaron en invertir todo sus ahorros, con tal de ver a su hija feliz y forjando su propio futuro. Bertha espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad sus productos, ya que lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo, es que debido al espacio reducido de su tienda no puede atender a muchas personas a la vez, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para mejor la vida que actualmente lleva. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se siente muy confiada de poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causar problemas en su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida, ya que es la socia más joven y alegre. Bertha planea invertir los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados en incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene actualmente en su tienda, de esta manera espera aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Bertha is 21 years old. At her young age, she feels responsible for helping out with the family expenses. She lives in her parents’ house, and what she wants the most is to help them have a peaceful life. For Bertha, her youth has not impeded her from getting ahead in life. She has been working in her own general store for 5 years, and what she likes most about her business is having conversations with her customers because it makes her long work days more enjoyable. Bertha was able to set up her general store thanks to her parents, who did not think twice about investing their life savings so that their daughter can be happy and form her own future. Bertha hopes to have a bigger store in which she can sell her products with ease. What she most dislikes is that because of her small shop, she cannot serve too many customers at a time. Even so, she she knows that she has to work hard in order to improve her current living conditions. This is her first loan with MFP. She feels very confident that she will be able to make her payments on time because she does not want to cause any problems at her microfinance institute, where she is dearly loved for being the youngest and most cheerful member. Bertha plans to invest 800.00 PEN in increasing her store’s inventory so that she can boost her income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Eva's Group

texts.en: N. Eva is the chairperson of Bwavumpologoma group in Mukono. She is a hard working and devoted lady with a grocery business where sells fresh produce and other items like passion fruits, onions, tomatoes, green pepper. She is happy that her stall is strategically positioned for easy access to many customers. The loans she has been getting have helped her expand her business, but she would like to continue her inventory expansion to include new products, such as Irish potatoes and charcoal.

loans.use: Purchasing additional products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Cinforiana

texts.es: Cinforiana de 43 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en una pequeña casa, la cual ella misma construyó con sus propias manos, lo que más quiere, es brindarle a sus 2 queridos hijos Luz de 22 y Dennis de 17 años, unos buenos estudios, para que en el futuro puedan salir adelante por sí solos. Los 15 años que Cinforiana viene realizando la crianza de ganado, le han servido para forjarse una vida digna, realiza esta actividad desde que tenia 15 años y actualmente se ha convertido en una de las ganaderas más reconocidas, debido a las grandes reses que lleva a vender a la ciudad de Juliaca. Cinforiana es natural del distrito de Taraco (Distrito de la Provincia de Huancane) y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es criar su ganado, ya que sabe que mientras mejor los cuide, mejores pagos le darán por sus reses, pero lo más difícil para ella, es transportarlo al lugar de la venta, puesto que es una actividad que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo. Para el futuro desea tener una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le pueda generar otros ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es el primer préstamo de Cinforiana con MFP, se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida debido a la alegría que le pone a las reuniones. Invertirá los setecientos nuevos que solicita en comprar una vaca, la cual le costara alrededor de tres mil nuevos soles, para ello está dispuesta a poner dinero de sus ahorros, con tal de aumentar el número de sus reses que tiene.
texts.en:
Cinforiana is 43 years old, and is the mother of a beautiful family. She lives in a small house that she built with her own hands. What she wants most is to provide her 2 beloved children Luz (22 years old) and Dennis (17 years old) with a good education so that they can make it on their own in the future. Cinforiana has raised cattle for 15 years now, and this activity has allowed her to make a decent living. She has been involved in this line of work since she was 15 years old, and she is now one of the most famous livestock farmers in her area because of the large animals she takes to sell in the city of Juliaca. Cinforiana is from the Taraco district (a district in the province of Huancane). What she likes most about her work is raising her cattle, since she knows that the more she looks after her animals, the better the price she’ll get for them. However, it’s quite difficult for her to transport them to market, since that’s a task that requires much time and effort. In the future she would like to have a grocery store, which would allow her to generate additional income and improve her family’s quality of life. This is Cinforiana’s first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she understands the responsibility of making payments on time, since she doesn’t want to cause any problems with her colleagues at the communal bank, where she is well liked because of the joy she brings to meetings. She will invest the 700 soles she is requesting in purchasing a cow. The cow will cost her around 3000 soles, and Cinforiana is planning to supplement the loan with money from her savings to pay for it. Her hope is to increase the number of animals she has.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy B. is 45 years old. She is divorced with four children. Currently, all her children are working and independent. Right now, her concentration is focusing on improving her business. Mercy lives at Akim Wenchi, a suburb of Akim Oda, in the eastern region of Ghana.

Mercy trades in the sale of bush meats, and fresh and dried fish. She has been in business for the last 5 years now in the community market where she lives. Also, she trades part to the surrounding communities during their market days. She take stock from the hunters who supply her with the tasty bush meats like grass cutter, deer etc. but for the fresh fish, she takes stocks from the river Volta in Ghana. She is currently facing financial challenges to buy more bush meats and fish. She requests a loan support to restock her business. She would be grateful for your support. Mercy belongs to a village bank called ‘wonderful Jesus’.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of bush meats, fresh and dried fish.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith es una joven muy alegre, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de sacar a delante su negocio, tiene 21 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea dar una buena vejez. La pequeña tienda de Edith es una de las más visitadas, ya que su carisma y buena trato han hecho que la prefieran antes que a las otras, ella es muy perseverante en su trabajo, se levanta muy temprano, para atender a mucho más personas en el día. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que al mismo tiempo puede ocuparse de las labores de su hogar, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. Para más adelante quiere tener una tienda más grande y completa, con la cual pueda incrementar sus ingresos y así tener una vida mejor. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de la oportunidad brindada, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados incrementará la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su tienda.
texts.en:
Edith is a cheerful young woman, who is enterprising and really wants her business to succeed. She is 21 years old and she lives in the same house with her parents, to whom she would like to provide a good old age. Edith's small store is one of the most visited since her charisma and good treatment have made it preferred above all others. She is very persistent in her work. She gets up very early in order to fit more customers into the day. What she likes best about her work is that she can also keep up with her household chores at the same time. She's been doing this for the last four years, though she regrets having to remain in the store all day long and not being able to go out and about. In the future she would like to have a larger, more complete store with which she would be able to increase her earnings and so have a better life. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she is very pleased with the opportunity which it presents. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time so as not to be detrimental to the other members of her communal bank, where she is very well liked. With the 1,000 New Sols requested, she would like to increase the amount of merchandise she has in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida M. is 30 years old. She is divorced and mother of five children. She says with the help of God all her children will be able to attend school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits and babies products like napkins, feeding bottles etc. in her neighborhood. She lives at Akim Wenchi in the eastern region of Ghana. With her five years business experience Vida has been very supportive to her family. Vida is a single parent and because of that, all the family responsibilities rest on her shoulders.

Fortunately her business is positioned at a strategic location within the town where she lives. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. Vida belongs to a village bank called ‘wonderful Jesus’.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar etc.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene 26 años y vive en su propia casa, con sus 4 hijos; Raúl de 10, Miriam de 7, Yudith de 5 y Freddy de 1 año, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La crianza de ganado es una actividad que ha ido aprendiendo a lo largo de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió este trabajo de sus padres, quienes se esforzaron mucho para darle una buena vida. Lleva a vender su ganado a la feria dominical del distrito de Huancané, donde consigue unos buenos precios, ya que sus reses son las más grandes y fuertes de toda la feria, debido a los buenos cuidados que ella les brinda. Tiene 6 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es alimentar a sus animales, espera más adelante poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos, lo más difícil para Josefa es trasladar su ganado hasta la feria, ya que le es muy cansado y demoroso, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de alcanzar sus metas. Este es el primer préstamo de Josefa con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, aunque para ello tenga que ahorrar poco a poco, en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por las demás socias. Con los 800 soles solicitados planea comprar una ternera, la cual le costará aproximadamente 700 soles, el resto del dinero lo invertirá en comprar forraje para su ganado.
texts.en:
Josefa is a very hardworking, 26-six-year-old woman, who lives with her 4 children (Raúl 10, Miriam 7, Yudith 5, and Freddy 1) in their own home. Her children are what motivate her. She has been learning to raise cattle her whole life. She learned this work from her parents, who worked hard to give her a good life, when she was a small girl. She brings her cattle to the Sunday fair in the Huancané neighborhood, where she gets a good price since her livestock are the biggest and strongest at the fair due to the good care she gives them. She's been doing this for 6 years and what she likes most is feeding her animals. In the future, she hopes to be able to increase the number of cattle she has and in this way improve her income. The most difficult thing for Josefa is transferring her cattle to the fair because it's very tiring and slow. But she knows that she has to do it and is happy to work hard, hoping to reach her goals. This is Josefa's first loan with MFP and she's aware of the responsibility she has to pay it on time, even though she will have to save bit by bit to do it. She is an active and supportive member of her communal bank which is why she is so respected by the rest. With the 800 soles requested, she plans to buy a calf, which will cost about 700 soles. The rest of the money will be invested in buying fodder for her cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una ternera

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Comenzo el negocio hace cuatro años, haciendo trabajos sobre pedido
desD. entonces poco a poco se ha vuelto un negocio para la familia.
su familia es su esposa, que trabaja D. secretaria y un hijo que es estudiante.

Tenia trabajo en una carpintería y mueblería, pero se quedo sin el. 
y tuvo que hacer trabajos en su casa para poder mantener a su familia. 

Cuenta solo con un empleado, que le ayuda cuando tiene muchos pedidos.

solicita el apoyo que ayudara a surtir el material que necesita.
texts.en:
Enrique started his business four years ago, doing jobs on request which, little by little, has come to be a business for the family. His family is his wife, who works as a secretary, and his son who is a student.

He had work in a carpentry and furniture shop, but he is no longer with them and he had to do jobs from his house to be able to support his family. He has one employee who helps him when he has many orders.

He asks for a loan which will help him stock material that he needs.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials such as wood and paint

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 46 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a sus 2 hijos; Ronald de 11 y Maria de 6 años. Lo que más desea es darle una buena vida a su familia, aunque para eso tenga que trabajar mucho. Juana tiene un puesto de venta de golosinas en el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable, lleva realizando esta actividad 4 años y lo que más le gusta es ver el rostro de felicidad que ponen los niños cuando tienen una de sus golosinas en la mano, ya que siempre le gustaron los niños. Juana espera poder tener en el futuro una tienda grande donde pueda vender sus golosinas y también otros productos, para ello sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro y sin descanso, lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer todo el día bajo el ardiente sol, ya que el calor hace que se canse más rápido y no pueda vender sus golosinas con la tranquilidad que desea. Este es el tercer préstamo de Juana con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas, para implementar mejor su puesto y así ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is 46 years old, a very cheerful woman, and lives in a rented room with her two children: Ronald is 11 and Maria is 6. What she desires more than anything is to give a good life to her family, even though she has to work very much for it.

Juana has a stand where she sells candy in the Santa Barbara market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She is very happy with her business which is very profitable. She has been running this business for four years and what she likes the most is to see the happy faces on the children when they have one of her candies in their hand, she always enjoys the children. Juana hopes in the future to be able to have a large store where she can sell candy and also other products, for which she knows she has to work very hard and without rest. The most difficult part of her job is to remain all day under the burning sun, now that the heat makes her tire more quickly and she cannot sell her candy with the calmness that she desires.

This is Juana’s third loan with MFP, which she knows she must pay on time and she is committed to do so. She is very responsible in her communal bank, always thinking of how they can fulfill the commitments that the members enter into. With the 1000 PEN she is asking for she will buy more candy, setup her stand better, and thereby offer a better variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric M. is thirty-three years old and married with two children. He lives with his wife and the children. Currently one child is in school and the other is still breastfeeding. Eric is a local manufacturer of soap. He combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to make his soap. He is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds. He wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. He hopes to raise his income to support his children's education. He belongs to the village bank called Nkwagyedom, which means 'savior of the many'.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making soap.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es una mujer de 54 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Hugo de 43 años y sus 2 hijas; Soledad de 18 y Ana de 13. La vida de Margarita ha sido muy difícil, siempre ha trabajado mucho para llevar el dinero a su hogar, actualmente se encuentra en el negocio de la venta de golosinas, actividad que le es muy rentable gracias a la cantidad de clientes que tiene, puesto que ella es una vendedora muy alegre y trata muy bien a las personas que se acercan a comprar una golosina. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta a quienes siempre hace reír mucho, pero lo que menos le gusta es que tiene que permanecer todo el día en su puesto aguantando el sol ardiente que la acompaña. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y espera  tener en el futuro una tienda donde pueda atender a sus clientes con mayor tranquilidad. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que lleguen su grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más golosinas para incrementar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Margarita, 54, lives in her own house with her family: her husband, Hugo is 43; daughter, Soledad is 18; and daughter Ana, is 13. Margarita’s life has been very difficult. She has always worked a lot to bring money home. She sells sweets; a profitable activity for her, thanks to her numerous customers. She is a happy sales person, and she treats the people who come to buy a sweet very well. What she likes best about her work is talking with her neighboring vendors; she always makes them laugh a lot. What she likes least is staying all day at her stall and enduring the burning sun. She has been doing this for 5 years, and she hopes in the future to have a store where she can take care of her customers with more tranquility. This is her third loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. In her community bank she is always well informed about the agreements made in her group. With the loan she will buy more sweets to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer de 31 años, vive con su pequeño hijo de manera independiente en la casa de sus padres, y lo que más desea es salir adelante para poder brindarles una vejez tranquila a sus progenitores. Para Maria su tienda de abarrotes es un negocio muy rentable, ya que son varios los clientes que concurren a su tienda a comprar lo que necesitan, trabaja desde muy temprano y se queda prácticamente todo el día dentro de su negocio, puesto que sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizar las tareas del hogar al mismo tiempo que atiende su negocio, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir a la calle. Para más adelante espera mejorar su tienda y convertirla en una de las más grandes de su barrio y así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el segundo préstamo de Maria con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más activas. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old, financially independent, and lives with her young son in her parents' home. More than anything, she wants to get ahead economically so that she can provide her parents a peaceful old age.

For five years, Maria has had a small grocery store. Her store is very profitable, as she has many regular customers who come to her to purchase what they need. She works from the very early morning hours and stays at the store almost all day, as she knows she must work hard to achieve her goals. What she likes most about her job is that she can accomplish household tasks at the same time that she tends the store. What she likes least is that she has to stay in the store all day and cannot go outside. In the future, Maria would like to make improvements to her store and to develop it into one of the biggest in her neighborhood. In this way, she will be able to increase her income.

This is Maria's second loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she understands the importance of making her payments on time, as she would like to be eligible for more loans in the future. She is one of the most active members of her community bank. She will invest the 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles from this loan in the purchase of more merchandise to improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more mercandise

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is thirty-nine years old. She is married with five children who are currently in school. Her husband works with a sanitation agency called Zoom lion waste management. She is a food vendor and has served food like rice and stew for eight years now. Because of the tasty meals she prepares, she has attracted lots of customers who buy from her stand, so the demand is very high. Therefore she asks for loan support to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, meats and other ingredients to increase her food production and flavor. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to help her husband support the family and to finance her children’s education. Florence belongs to the village bank called Nkwagyedom which means 'savior of the many'.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts, rice, vegetables, meat and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es: A sus 51 años, Micaela ha luchado mucho para sobresalir en la vida, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Alipio de 48 años y sus 4 hijos; Guido de 18, David de 16, Hilbert de 24 y Gladys de 26, a los que desea, con todas sus fuerzas, tengan un futuro más prometedor. Micaela tiene 10 años trabajando en la crianza de ganado, se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para sacar a pastar a sus animales, los cuales cría con mucho cariño y dedicación, ya que sabe que de la buena crianza depende la ganancia que obtendrá por venderlos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es caminar por los inmensos verdes campos por donde pastea a su ganado. Micaela espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y así aumentar sus ingresos, lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que llevar las reses hasta Huancane, que es donde vende su ganado, aun así ella está dispuesta a trabajar duro con tal de mejorar su vida. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone a las reuniones. Con los 500 soles solicitados planea incrementar el monto necesario para poder comprar un toro, el cual le costará al rededor de 3000 mil soles.
texts.en:
Micaela, 51 years old, has worked very hard to excel in life, and she believes that those who have dreams and pursue them with all their energy will have a more promising future. She lives in her own home with her husband Alipio, 48, and her four children, Guido, 18, David, 16, Hilbert, 24, and Gladys, 26.

For ten years, Micaela has worked raising cattle. She gets up at five in the morning to let her animals out to pasture, and what she likes most about her work is walking in the vast green fields where her animals graze. She raises her animals with much care and dedication, and she knows that this effort results in better prices when she sells them. Micaela hopes to increase the number of animals she has and thereby increase her income. Although she is willing to work hard to improve her life, what she likes least about her work is having to take her cattle all the way to Huancane in order to sell them.

This is Micaela's first loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is committed to being on-time with her repayment. She feels a responsibility to the other members of her community bank, where she is very respected due to the level of organization she brings to their meetings.

She will use this loan for 500 Peruvian nuevos soles as a down payment on a bull, which will cost about 3,000 nuevos soles.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret S. is thirty-five years old and married with five children. Her husband works with the electric company of Ghana in his community branch. Currently all her children are in school in the community in which they live. 

She is a trader and sells kerosene to the members of her community. She buys her stock of kerosene from Akim Oda, which is one of the big towns in the eastern region. She also sells pastries that she prepares by herself. She mostly sells the pastries through hawking in the surrounding towns. Margaret has been in this field for the last twelve years. 

She says the prices of commodities in the market increased significantly after the December election. This has retarded her business growth, so she is appealing for your loan support to upgrade her inventory. With the loan she can buy more gallons of kerosene as well as ingredients in bulk for her pastries, like flour, margarine, sugar, etc. Margaret belongs to the village bank called Nkwagyedom which means 'savior of the multitude or many'.

loans.use: To buy gallons of kerosene, and flour, margarine, sugar, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 27 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y su querida hija Mereida de 4 años, quien es el motivo fundamental de todos sus esfuerzos. Sin dejarse vencer por el inclemente clima, Nancy sale muy temprano en compañía de su esposo para recolectar la leche de vaca de los ganaderos de su zona, luego de haber terminado con esta tarea, comienza a preparar los sabrosos quesos que llevará a vender al día siguiente a los mercados de Juliaca y Huancane. A Nancy le gusta mucho elaborar queso, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil es conseguir la cantidad de leche necesaria para preparar los 30 quesos que produce diariamente. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda muy grande en la ciudad de Juliaca donde pueda vender sus deliciosos quesos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y espera no fallar en los pagos de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida y solidaria. Nancy planea invertir los 1000 soles solicitados en incrementar su capital de trabajo para comprar más leche y mejorar los implementos con los que prepara sus quesos.
texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her beloved 4-year-old daughter Mereida, who is the motivating force behind all of Nancy's efforts. Despite harsh weather conditions, Nancy and her husband go out very early in the morning to collect milk from the ranchers in their area. After this task, they set to work preparing flavorful cheeses to be sold the following day in the markets of Juliaca and Huancane.

Nancy really enjoys making cheese, and has done this work for seven years. The hardest part of her job is collecting enough milk every day to produce thirty blocks of cheese. In the future, she would like to have a large store in Juliaca where she could sell her delicious cheese.

This is Nancy's first loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she plans to be punctual with its repayment. She is known as a very trustworthy and loyal member of her community bank. Nancy will use the 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles from this loan as working capital to purchase more milk and better tools for cheese making.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk

loans.name: Aishitu

texts.en: Aishitu S. is thirty-one years old and married with two children. She is resourceful and supportive towards her family. Currently, both of her children are in school. She lives in a community called Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. Akim Wenchi and its environs support a mining business and a palm nuts fruits plantation. This has created jobs for many young people in the community. Her husband is a driver. Aishitu operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like cooked rice balls and “Waakye”. Waakye is prepared from rice and beans and is enjoyed by many Ghanians as breakfast, lunch and supper. Aishitu has been in this business for the past twelve years while also taking care of the family. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her production expenditures. This has affected production quality adversely. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business and to scale up production while also maintaining quality. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She belongs to a village bank called Nkwagyedom which means 'savior of the multitude or many'.

loans.use: To buy maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga es una madre amorosa de 32 años, vive en la casa que le cedieron sus padres, junto a sus 3 hijos; Liliana de 8, Jean de 6 y Adolfo de 5 años, a quienes quiere dar buenos estudios. Olga tiene una pequeña tienda en su barrio, la cual es muy concurrida por sus clientes, debido a que es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática, que siempre les brinda una atención muy cordial. A Olga le gusta conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y espera en el futuro convertir su tienda en una de las más grandes, para así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades, sabe que el camino hasta sus metas es muy largo y sacrificado, pero Olga está dispuesta a afrontarlo, con la única finalidad de darles una mejor vida a sus hijos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y al igual como hizo en sus primeros créditos, desea pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que sabe que si no lo hace meterá en problemas a su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada por lo responsable que es. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su tienda.
texts.en:
Olga is a loving mother who is 32 years old. She lives in the house she inherited from her parents together with her 3 children: Liliana, age 8, Jean, age 6 and Adolfo who is 5 years old, to whom she wants to give good educations. Olga has a small store in her neighborhood, which is very popular with her customers as she is a very happy and charismatic saleswoman who always provides them with cordial service. Olga likes to speak with her customers and find out what is happening in the neighborhood. She has been involved in this activity for 2 years and in the future hopes to turn her business into one of the biggest to be able to improve her earnings. What she likes least about her work is that she has to remain in her store all day long and is not able to go out to do other activities. She knows that the path to her goals is very long and will require sacrifice, but Olga is prepared to confront it with the only goal of providing a better life for her children. This is her fourth loan with MFP and just like she did with her first loans she wishes to make her payments on time as she knows that if she does not do it she will have problems with her communal bank where she is respected for how responsible she is. With the two thousand five hundred nuevos soles requested she will buy more products to increase the amount of merchandise that she has in her store. .

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: Petronila es una joven muy alegre de 26 años, vive en la casa de su padre, a quien quiere dar una vejez tranquila y lo que más desea es salir adelante. Para Petronila la crianza de ganado es una actividad que viene de familia, desde muy pequeña  aprendió a realizar esta labor, actualmente realiza este trabajo y es muy buena haciéndolo, su ganado es muy solicitado en las ferias de Huancane y Juliaca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pastar a sus animales y permanecer al aire libre, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es llevar a sus animales hasta las distintas ferias para venderlos. Para el futuro espera incrementar el número de ganado que tiene para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el primer préstamo de Petronila con MFP y se siente feliz de la oportunidad brindada, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario. Con los 1000 soles solicitados comprará una vaca para incrementar su ganado, para ello está dispuesta a poner dinero de sus ahorros si es necesario incrementar el monto.
texts.en:
Petronila is a very happy young woman who is 26 years old. She lives in her father's house, who she wants to give a tranquil old age. What she wants most is to get ahead in life. For Petronila, livestock husbandry is an activity that comes from her family as she learned how to do it from a young age. She currently carries out this work and is very good at doing it. Her livestock is very sought after in the Huancane and Juliaca markets. What she most likes about her work is to graze her animals and to be outside in the fresh air. She has been doing this activity for 15 years and the most difficult part for her is to take her animals to the different markets to sell them. In the future she hopes to increase her number of heads of livestock to improve her income. This is Petronila’s first loan with MFP and she feels happy about the opportunity it provides. In her communal bank she is a much loved member as she always helps in everything required. With the 1000 soles requested she will buy a cow to increase her livestock and for this she is prepared to contribute money from her savings if it is necessary to increase the amount.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 20 años, es una joven con muchos deseos de superación, vive en la casa de sus padres y tiene muchos deseos de sobre salir en la vida. Desde muy niña se dedico a la crianza de ganado, esa siempre fue la activad de su familia, ahora ella tiene su propio ganado y los alimenta muy bien, porque sabe que del buen estado de sus reses dependerán las ganancias que obtendrá por su venta. Rosa lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es alimentar a sus animales, puesto que siente que les da el cariño que se merecen, pero lo más difícil es tener que llevar su ganado hasta las ferias de las ciudades de Huancane y Juliaca, que es donde vende sus reses. Para el futuro espera poder incrementar el ganado que tiene actualmente, para así tener unos mejores ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos de todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los 500 soles que solicita comprará más forraje (pasto) para alimentar mejor a sus animales.
texts.en:
Rosa, 20, is a young woman with a great desire to overcome her circumstances. She lives in her parents' home and greatly desires to get ahead in life. She has raised livestock since she was small, which was always the business of her family. Now she has her own livestock that she feeds well, because she knows that her earnings from their sale depend on the well being of her animals. She has been doing this for 4 years, and what she enjoys the most is feeding the animals, feeling that she is giving them the care they deserve; the most difficult part is having to take her stock to the markets in the cities of Huancane and Jeliaca, which is where she sells her herds. For the future, she hopes to be able to increase her current herd in order to increase her income. This is her first loan through MFP, and she knows that she has to fulfill each payment on time. She is a happy and supportive member of her communal bank. With the $175 that she is requesting, she will buy more fodder (grass) to better feed her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her livestock

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina es una mujer que siempre quiso salir adelante, tiene 61 años y vive en su propia casa junto a su querida hija Norma D. 19 años, quien es el motivo D. todos sus sacrificios. El campo le ha dado a Sabina los recursos necesarios para mantener a su familia, se dedica a la crianza D. ganado desD. que tenía 10 años, actividad que aprendió D. sus padres. Actualmente sus reses están muy bien cuidadas y alimentadas, es por eso que en la feria D. Huancane y Juliaca, que es donD. lleva a vender su ganado, sus reses son las más solicitadas por los compradores. Para Sabina lo más difícil D. su trabajo es tener que llevar su ganado hasta las ferias dominicales, puesto que le es muy agotador, lleva 20 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta es pastar a sus animales. Para el futuro espera incrementar el número D. reses que tiene, para mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una D. las socias más responsables. Con los 1000 soles solicitados planea comprar un toro, el cual le costará alrededor D. 3000 soles, para ello está dispuesta a poner dinero D. sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Sabina is a woman who always wanted to get ahead. She is 61 and lives in her own house next to her beloved daughter Norma, 19, who is the motivation for all her sacrifices. The countrysiD. has given Sabina the resources necessary to support her family, she has raised livestock since she was 10 years old, which she learned from her parents. Currently her cattle are very well cared for and fed, so that in the markets of Huancane and Juliaca, which is where she takes them to sell, her cattle are the most sought-after by the purchasers. The most difficult part of her work is having to take her livestock to the Sunday markets, since it is very exhausting. She has been doing this business for 20 years, and what she enjoys the most is grazing her animals. For the future, she hopes to increase the number of cattle that she has, in order to increase her income. This is her first loan through MFP, and she is ready to make her payments on time, since she wants access to more loans later. She is one of the most responsible members of her communal bank. With the $325 she is requesting, she plans to buy a bull that will cost around $975, for which she will also use money from her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Wilber Javier

texts.es: Wilber Javier C. A. tiene la edad de 26 años, su estado civil es soltero. Wilber tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. El se dedica a la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio ofreciendo la venta de productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y frijoles. Ya que su negocio fue una herencia de su abuelo. Por lo que el principal negocio de Wilber es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ofreciéndoles lo que ellos solicitan. Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, bisutería y leche en bolsa. El deseo de Wilber es convertir su negocio en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Wilber Javier C. A. is 26 and single. He has 2 children, both in school. His business is a local store, which he has had for more than 6 years. Since he inherited his business from his grandfather, he started selling basic products such as rice, sugar, oil and beans. Now Wilber's primary business is satisfying the needs of his clients, giving them what they want. So he comes to Foundation Leon 2000 so that the contributing organizations can give him the help he needs. He is requesting working capital to buy basic grains, candies, carbonated and non-carbonated soft drinks, costume jewelry, and containers of milk. Wilber's ambition is to become a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Vidal es padre soltero, tiene 41 años y vive junto a sus 4 hijos; Félix de 16, Leandra de 14, David de 13 y Erika de 8 años, quienes son el motivo fundamental de todos sus esfuerzos. Los días de Vidal comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su inseparable motocarro sale en busca de clientes que deseen ser transportados hasta su destino, sus servicios son muy solicitados por los vecinos de su barrio, ya que en cualquier urgencia que tienen, él siempre está presente para transportarlos. Lleva 4 años en este trabajo y lo que más le gusta es conversar con otros mototaxistas mientras espera a que alguien tome sus servicios, ya que esto hace más ameno su día. Vidal espera más adelante comprar otro motocarro para alquilarlo y así generarse nuevos ingresos, lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene que trabajar todo el día y no puede ver continuamente a sus hijos a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios. Este es el tercer préstamo de Vidal con MFP, es muy conciente de que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, para no perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en arreglar las fallas mecánicas que últimamente está sufriendo su motocarro.
texts.en:
Vidal, 41, is a single father living with his 4 children who are the fundamental motivation for all his efforts: Felix, 16; Leandra, 14; David, 13; and Erika, 8. Vidal's day begins very early in the morning, when with his inseparable three-wheeler, he goes out searching for clients wishing to be transported to their destination. His services are very sought-after around his neighborhood, since no matter how rushed they are, he is always there to carry them. He has been doing this work for 4 years, and what he most enjoys is conversing with the other moto-taxi drivers while they are waiting for somebody to use their service, making his day pass more pleasantly. Vidal hopes in the future to buy another three-wheeler to rent out and thus generate additional income. What he likes least about his work is that he has to work all day long and is not able to watch over his children all the time, to whom he greatly desires to give a good education. This is the third loan Vidal has taken through MFP, he is very aware that he has to make every payment on time in order not to be detrimental to the other members of his communal bank, where he is very beloved because of the responsibility he demonstrates. The $175 he is requesting will be invested in repairing the mechanical problems his three-wheeler has recently been suffering.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of his three-wheeler

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 34 años, vive con su pequeño hijo en la casa de un familiar. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, específicamente el cuy, también vende productos alimenticios por medio de los viajes que realiza cada quincena a otras ciudades. Día a día cuida su granja de animales, porque de ello depende la venta que realizará, pues su negocio abastece a los clientes que solicitan para realizar grandes banquetes a base de cuy, entonces ella misma los vende listos para cocinar, pero a un costo adicional. Sus expectativas para el futuro son de tener más cuyes para incrementar sus ventas. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada por el trabajo en su banco comunal porque han superado problemas y ahora tienen muchos ánimos de seguir adelante. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de truchas (pescado de río) para vender en otras ciudades, así como incrementar la cantidad de cuyes que cría.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, lives with her young son in the home of a relative. For 2 years she has been raising small animals, specifically guinea pigs; she also sells nutritious foods while on her bi-weekly trips to other cities. She takes care of her livestock farm every day, since her business supplies clients she solicits in order to put on large guinea-pig banquets. She also sells them ready to cook, but at additional charge. Her expectations for the future are to have more guinea pigs in order to increase her sales. This is the second time that she has taken a loan through MFP, and she works very enthusiastically with her communal bank because they have overcome problems and now they are very encouraged to keep getting ahead. The money she is requesting is for the purchase of trout (a river fish) to sell in other cities, as well as to increase the number of guinea pigs that she raises.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of trout to sell

loans.name: Juana Yamileth

texts.es: Juana Yamileth T. E. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Juana tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica de Yamileth es la venta de ropa de cosméticos. Hace más de 4 años, la ubicación de su negocio en el mercado central de León en donde a diario obtiene clientes, por lo que dio inicio por cuenta propia para obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su vivienda. Por lo que su propósito es de aumentar su negocio con nuevos productos ya que sus clientes siempre buscan cosas nuevas. El financiamiento que solicita por medio de Fundación León 2000 es para capital de trabajo como pantalones, carteras, pinturas de labio, camisas y pantalones. El sueño de Yamileth es de obtener su propia casa, ya que la situación esta mas difícil y esta luchando para que sus hijos tengan donde vivir el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Juana Yamileth T. E. is 36 and married. Doña Juana has 2 children. Her business is selling clothing and cosmetics. Her business has been in the central market of León for more than 4 years where she has clients every day, which has given her the start to make her own income to cover her household expenses. Her proposal is to enlarge her business with new products since her clients are always looking for something new. The financing that she is requesting through Fundación León 2000 is for working capital to buy pants, handbags, lipsticks, and shirts. Yamileth's dream is to own her own home, since her situation is very difficult and she is fighting for her children to have a place to live as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Protazio's Group

texts.en: Protazio Z. is one of the executive members of Kasenyanku group in Mpigi. He is a very hard-working man and has sixteen children, eleven of whom are in school. The rest are still young. Protazio has a shop that sells new clothes like gomesi (a puff-sleeved dress) for ladies, trousers for men and women, shirts, dresses and skirts. It is due to his hard work and determination that he was able to set up this shop, having worked in daily markets with no store of his own from which to sell his own goods. He is grateful to his customers for his business and to Pearl Microfinance, a Kiva field partner, for without them, he would be badly off.  He is again asking for a loan to purchase additional inventory. His dream of having many shops selling the same goods still prevails.
