loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 47 años, vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años trabaja vendiendo animales, tanto su carne como su lana; dependiendo del tipo de animal trata de sacarle el mayor provecho, para obtener mayores ganancias. Adicionalmente, por las mañanas, vende golosinas durante los momentos de refrigerio en el cafetín de una escuela privada cercana a su casa, esto permite que Elizabeth tenga más ganancias para cubrir los gastos educativos de sus 5 hijos. Ocasionalmente la ayudan sus hijos mayores, ya que su esposo trabaja lejos, sin embargo la misma forma de trabajo ha hecho de que se adecue a las exigencias físicas. Para más adelante desea tener un terreno adecuado para criar a sus animales y ya no en el patio de su casa. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias más comprometidas con su banco comunal, es muy dinámica e impulsa la responsabilidad de su grupo, es por ello que asume el cargo de tesorera. El dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de más ovejas de raza, las cuales están valorizadas en 180 soles cada una. También adquirirá más dulces para la venta en su cafetín.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 47, lives with her husband and 5 children in their own home. For 3 years she has been selling livestock, both for meat and for wool; depending on the type of animal, she tries to get the greatest benefit in order to have the best possible earnings. In addition, in the morning she sells candies during snack time in the cafeteria of a private school near her house, which permits Elizabeth to have additional income to cover the educational expenses of her 5 children. Occasionally her older children help her, since her husband works far away; nevertheless, this type of work has been able to cover the financial needs. In the future she would like to have enough land to raise her animals, rather than on the patio of her house. This is her second loan through MFP. She is one of the most engaged members of her communal bank, being very dynamic and driven by responsibility to her group, which is why she has assumed the position of treasurer. The money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more purebred sheep, which are valued at 180 soles each. She will also acquire more candies to sell in her cafeteria.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es: Emperatriz tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y calzado, se inició en este negocio  con poca mercadería y hoy ha visto acrecentar su capital de trabajo. La atención que ofrece en su negocio es todo el día, para ello siempre cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, Emperatriz  busca  las nuevas tendencias y moda en las prendas de vestir que vende, ya que generalmente quienes compran su ropa son jóvenes. Los mese que tiene mayores ventas es en los meses de junio y julio, es por ello que con esas ganancias está analizando la posibilidad de tener una boutique en una zona céntrica de su ciudad. Es la segunda vez que Emperatriz tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal que le ha enseñado muchas cosas, como trabajar en equipo. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de más mercadería en prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. For seven years, she has been selling clothing and footwear. She started off with very little merchandise, but now she is turning a profit. Emperatriz is always attending to her business, and with the support of her kids, she is constantly on the lookout for new fashion trends; most of her customers are young people. Her sales are highest during June and July, and she has considered opening a boutique in the center of her city. This is Emperatriz' second loan with MFP, and she's very happy to be part of this community bank, where she has learned a great deal, including the value of teamwork. With her loan money, Emperatriz plans to acquire more merchandise and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise

loans.name: Catherine Birungi 's Group

texts.en: Catherine is twenty-five years old and married with one nine-year-old child. She rents a one-room house with her family. She doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water. She always gets three meals a day. Catherine has a stall, and that is how she makes a living. She rents her stall at $9.25 a month and gets about twenty customers a day. She buys her produce from Nakawa market and works seven days a week. She has worked at this business for three years now. Prior to this she was frying edibles. This is her seventh loan since she joined MCDT, a Kiva field partner, and has been with them for four years, working with the same group members. Catherine wants to use this loan to buy boxes of tomatoes and also to start buying directly from farmers. She hopes to build a house from her savings.

loans.use: To buy boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa  de sus padres. Desde hace 19 años se dedica a la venta de papa, ella tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra principalmente este producto, su esfuerzo más grande es la época de cosecha durante los tres primeros meses del año. Su esposo siempre está con ella y ambos trabajan para la manutención de los hijos que tienen. Hasta el momento, Irene considera rentable su negocio, porque ella vende lo que produce y tiene mayores márgenes de ganancia, sin intermediarios. Paralelo a eso, su esposo tiene un motocarro que le sirve para transportar su mercadería, así como para ofrecer servicio de transporte a sus vecinos. Es la segunda vez que Irene tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está con muchos ánimos de continuar forjando un trabajo en unidad con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando lo podrá invertir en la compra de sacos de papa, abono para su próxima siembra y el mantenimiento de su motocarro.
texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old and lives in her parents' house with her husband and their four children. For 19 years, Irene has been selling potatoes, which she grows on her own land. Because she plants her own crops, most of her work takes place during the first three months of the year. Her husband is always by her side; they work together and care for their children together, too. Irene believes that her business is profitable these days because she sells what she produces, without any middle-man. Her husband also maintains a small vehicle, which he uses to transport merchandise and courier items for their neighbors. This is Irene's second loan with MFP, and she is excited to continue building relationships with other members of her community bank. With this loan, Irene will buy more potato sacks and fertilizer for the next planting season. Some of the money will also go toward vehicle maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer, vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling candy

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Joven María Elena M. H. tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña María tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es importante resaltar que su negocio inicio por la necesidad de no poseer un empleo, ya que tenia que alimentar a su familia. Y con los financiamientos ha podido salir adelante. Los propósitos de María Elena son de tener los recursos necesarios para la inversión de su negocio. María decide realizar un financiamiento con Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas que ayudan con esta causa y comprar productos como golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y jugos. Los sueños de María es de ofertar un mejor servicio a sus clientes para que le permita mejorar y aumentar clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Elena M. H. is 44 years old and married. Maria has two kids, and both are in school. She has been running a grocery store for six years. It all started because she didn't have a job and needed to feed her family. Maria believes that with a loan, her business can get a little further ahead; she wants to have all the resources necessary for investing in her store. Maria decided to seek out a loan with the Leon Foundation 2000 (and its affiliated organizations), which will help her purchase products such as candy, soda, bread and juice. She hopes to offer better service, which will improve and increase her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 29 años, vive con su pequeña hija en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a realizar confecciones de diversos tipos de prendas de vestir, así como alfombras y  cobertores para sillones, viene desarrollando esta actividad desde hace más de 3 años. Empezar este negocio no fue fácil porque necesitaba adquirir clientes, para lo cual empezó trabajando de manera dependiente como secretaria de una institución donde aprovechaba en ofrecer sus servicios de costura. Hoy se dedica a este trabajo a tiempo completo, y su principal herramienta de trabajo es su máquina de coser, por el momento, su taller está en un pequeño espacio en su casa, pero está buscando la manera de construir su propio taller. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta porque ha visto el ejemplo de un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales de construcción para que pueda edificar un taller de confecciones y tener mayor comodidad para elaborar sus prendas.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 29 years old and lives with her young daughter in her parents' house. She makes many types of clothing, as well as carpets and blankets for furniture. Luzmila has been in business for three years, but it wasn't easy at first; she needed to find a number of clients. Luzmila first worked as a secretary in a company where she could also offer sewing services. These days, she makes clothing and blankets full-time, and she mostly uses a sewing machine. For now, she works from a small area in her parents' home, but she wants to build her own workshop. Luzmila is very happy to be taking a second loan with MFP; this community bank has set a great example of solidarity. With her loan money, Luzmila plans to buy construction materials for her workshop, where she will be able to produce clothing, carpets and blankets more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: building materials for a new workshop

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela tiene 26 años, vive en casa de su padre con su pequeño hijo. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de papa, primero cosecha el producto que compra, directamente de las tierras de cultivo, luego vende en la feria comercial de la zona en donde vive, y los fines de semana, ofrece en otros lugares más alejados. De esta manera obtiene los ingresos necesarios para los gastos de su hogar. Esta es la segunda vez que Mariela tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta de estar nuevamente con su banco comunal porque seguirá trabajando con mucha responsabilidad para el bienestar de todos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de más papa al por mayor, comprará 15 sacos de papa, cada saco de 100 kilos está valorizado aproximadamente en 120 soles.
texts.en:
Mariela is 26 years old and lives in her father's house with her young son. For two years now, she has been selling potatoes. She buys directly from farmers, sells at local markets, and sells elsewhere on weekends. This is how she looks after household expenses. This loan is Mariela's second with MFP, and she's very happy to be working with a community bank that takes responsibility for people's welfare. Mariela will use her loan money to buy more wholesale potatoes: 15 sacks, 100 kilograms each, worth about 120 Soles.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: merchandise

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LA AMISTAD”,  Está conformado por 14 miembros, todos ellos naturales del Cusco, y este banco se encuentra ubicado en el local principal de la Organización de bancos comunales ARARIWA.

Los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades, un porcentaje mayor tiene transporte público destinado a cubrir rutas dentro de la ciudad del Cusco, para lo cual solicitan el préstamo en razón de que necesitan comprar un seguro de vida para cada carro, otros miembros requieren el préstamo para poder comprar, barniz, pintura, arcilla, para elaborar artesanía, uno de ellos tiene el sueño de poder alquilar un día un local en la plaza central de Cusco y poder vender sus artesanías,  otras socias venden ropa que traen desde Bolivia, otra socia tiene un pequeño restaurante y solicitan el préstamo para poder implementar su negocio.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen en el pago de toda su deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The community bank "La Amistad", is formed by 14 members, from Cusco. The bank is located at the principal location of the organization of banks ARARIWA. The members work on different activities, most of them work on public transportation that cover all the city of Cusco, this is why they request the loan because they need to buy car insurance for each vehicle, other members need the loan to buy paint and clay to create handicrafts. One of them has a dream of some day be able to rent a place at the central market in Cusco to sell his handicrafts, other members sell clothes that they bring from Bolivia, another member has a small restaurant and request the loan for her business. The members value and are thankful for the loan and commit to pay their debt on the time determined.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Public Transportation, handicrafts, clothes and other activities

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 31 años, vive en casa de unos familiares con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en motocarro, ella posee dos de estos vehículos, y ha contratado a 2 personas para que conduzcan. Adicionalmente, Mery vende productos lácteos que lleva periódicamente en sus viajes a una ciudad cercana a la suya, de esas dos maneras genera los recursos que necesita para su familia. Cuando está en su localidad, reparte sus pedidos entre sus vecinos y otros clientes, y sigue controlando las ganancias de sus motocarros. Mery desea tener otra movilidad más e incrementar la cantidad de productos que vende. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal, y demostró puntualidad en sus pagos en el ciclo anterior, esta vez se compromete, una vez más, a seguir teniendo estas actitudes positivas. El dinero que viene solicitando es para invertirlo en la compra del seguro de uno de los motocarros, y para adquirir más productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Mery is 31 years old and lives in her family home with her husband and their three children. For four years, she has been running a taxi service; she has two vehicles and two hired drivers. Mery also sells dairy products whenever her vehicles travel to nearby towns. This allows her two sources of income for her family. When she's in town, she takes orders from neighbours and other customers, which contributes to the income from her vehicles. Mery wants to increase the mobility of her business and increase the number of dairy products she sells. This is her second loan with MFP and she is one of the most active members of her community bank. She has always made her payments in a timely fahsion, and promises to do the same this time around. Her loan money will go toward vehicle insurance and dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying another vehicle

loans.name: Ronald Alonso

texts.es: Ronald Alonso S. M. tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Ronal tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Don Ronald es una pulperia. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, los que ofrece en su vivienda donde esta ubicado y dirige de forma personal, por lo que nace con el deseo de trabajar ya que no poseía ninguna fuente de ingresos. Por lo que sus propósitos son de mejorar cada día en su negocio ya que ha sido un apoyo indispensable. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar los productos de uso diario que arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y otros. El deseo de Ronald es asegurar un buen futuro para sus hijos y ellos puedan seguir adelante con el negocio.
texts.en:
Ronald Alonso S. M. is 45 years old, married and has 3 children who attend school.

For over 11 years, Ronald has owned a grocery store that he runs from his home in a personal way. He started the business because he didn’t have any source of income and wanted to work. Everyday he strives to improve his business since it has been an indispensable support.

He will use the loan as working capital to purchase everyday products like rice, sugar, beans, oil and other items. Ronald wishes to secure a good future for his children and ensure that they can succeed with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en: Josephine N. is a smart, hard-working and devoted mother who is married with 5 children, and she cares for 6 orphans. She is the leader of Suubilyamukama women's group. When she tells you about the business she does, you realize that she is really fit for it. She sells new clothes for ladies, men and children. Some are already made but she sews most of the clothes herself. She makes clothes of various designs -- both bitenge (Nigerian wear) like the one she is putting on with a red cap, as well as traditional wear (gomesi). On top of this, she has a shelf where she sells the accessories like jewellery that go with the clothes she makes; hence her customers find a variety to choose from. Josephine needs another loan to be able to stock more clothing materials for sale and for sewing.

loans.use: Buying more clothes and clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la casa de su madre. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la compra y venta de animales, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres que siempre se han dedicado a este negocio y en la actualidad le sirve para su sostenimiento. Rosa está muy contenta por lo que ha logrado, ella compra los animales durante la semana para luego venderlos los días sábados y domingos en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad con ayuda de sus hijos y su esposo. Para Rosa, este negocio es rentable, y junto a su esposo tienen planes de seguir dedicándose a esta actividad e incrementar la cantidad de animales que venden. Esta es la primera vez que Rosa solicita un préstamo con MFP, ella esta muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal, a la que fue invitada porque vieron en ella a un buen ejemplo de trabajo responsable. Este dinero será invertido en la compra de ovejas y cabras que son los animales que más vende.
texts.en:
Rosa, 37, lives with her husband and children in her mother’s house. For 20 years she has been buying and selling animals. She learned this business from her parents, who always engaged in this business. They still rely on this activity for their sustenance. Rosa is very pleased with what she has achieved. She buys the animals during the week. She then sells them, with the help of her husband and children, on Saturdays and Sundays in the livestock fairs in her area. This business is profitable for Rosa. She and her husband have plans to continue this activity and increase the number of animals they sell. This is the first time that Rosa has asked for a loan from MFP. She is very happy to be part of her community bank. She was invited to join because they saw her as a good example of a responsible worker. The loan will be used to buy sheep and goats, which are the animals that she mostly sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa vive con su esposo y con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace un años tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, comenzó con poca mercadería, y en la actualidad está manejando muchos más productos con los que abastece las necesidades de sus vecinos y clientes. Este es un negocio familiar, ya que su esposo y sus hijos la apoyan cuando es necesario, y el trabajo en unión familiar la anima a seguir con este negocio que le permite estar con los suyos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte del banco comunal que actualmente integra, y por su parte estuvo investigado acerca de la dinámica de trabajo en este grupo, y con toda seguridad asume plenamente la responsabilidad de cumplir con las actividades convenidas. El dinero que viene solicitando es para comprar más mercadería en verduras y carnes, que son los productos que más solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teresa lives with her husband and two children in their own house. For a few years she has run a grocery store in her home. At first it had very little merchandise but currently it is stocked with many products needed by her neighbors and customers. The store is a family business, her husband and children help her when necessary, and this family effort encourages her to keep the business so that she can be with them while working. This is Teresa's first loan with MFP; she was invited to become part of the community bank after being evaluated in regards to the group dynamics, and she confidently and fully took on the responsibility of fulfilling the requirements that were agreed upon. The money that Teresa requests is to buy more vegetables and meat, which are the products her customers request the most.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase store merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa, es socie del banco Comunal Manuela Ramos,en el Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno;tiene 51 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 3 hijos y posee estudios, de primaria inconpleta(segundo grado).
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella es una de las fundadoras de su BBCC.è inicio con un prestamo de 300.00 Nuevos Soles lo cual invirtìo en la conpre de insumos.
En el momento, la sra. requiere de un prestamo de 3000.00 Nuevos Soles. lo cual le permitira ampliar su restaurante, para asi poder brindar mejor atenciòn a sus clientes, asi mismo se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.tenbien comenta que le gusta todo el manejo de su grupo y su mayor deceo es amplier su restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Manuela Ramos community bank in the MazoCruz district, Callao Province, Puno Department. She is 51, married, has 3 children, and has a second grade education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 12 years. She is one of the founders of her community bank. She started with a loan of 300 PEN to buy supplies. She now needs a loan of 300 PEN to expand her restaurant. This way she could offer better attention to her customers. She promises to make her payments on time. She says she likes the way the group runs, and her biggest desire is to expand her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of milk, bags of sugar, box of oil, etc.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: Yadira tiene 30 años, vive con sus hijos en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio, empezó vendiendo de manera ambulante, y actualmente se ha instalado en su misma casa donde vende su mercadería a sus clientes, que son en su mayoría, sus vecinos. Vende todos los días, solo descansa los domingos, y en ocasiones sus padres la ayudan en la atención de su establecimiento, pero la mayor cantidad del tiempo ella está presente para ofrecer una atención cálida a sus clientes. Sus ventas  han estado yendo muy bien, como en esta época de inicio de clases escolares que fue muy beneficioso para Yadira que incrementó sus ventas satisfactoriamente. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete, una vez más, a seguir trabajando con mucha responsabilidad para la devolución de su préstamo. Yadira está solicitando este dinero para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería en útiles de escritorio, regalos de ocasión, adornos y demás artículos para implementar su local y convertir su negocio en un bazar.
texts.en:
Yadira is 30 years old and lives with her children in her parents’ home.
She has sold stationery supplies for 2 years. She started as a street vendor, but currently sets up shop in her home, where most of her customers are her neighbours. She’s open every day, only resting on Sundays; sometimes her parents help, but most of the time she’s present to offer warmhearted service to customers.
Her sales have been going very well since the school year is just starting. This is the second time that she has requested a loan through MFP and she is once again committed to continue working responsibly to repay her loan. Yadira is requesting the money to purchase stationery supplies, occasional gifts, decorations and other items to stock her store and convert her business into a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia con sus tres hijos, los cuales son el motor de su vida y por quienes trabaja arduamente. Ella es natural de la ciudad del Cuzco, vino a la ciudad de Lima en busca de un mejor porvenir, trabajando en una diversidad de oficios, dedicándose actualmente a la venta de pollo frito con papas, platillo que vende a partir de las 5 de la tarde hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche en un mercado cercano a su casa. Este oficio le resulta muy rentable, ya que tiene una buena clientela, la cual concurre asiduamente a su pequeño puesto, pero aunque parezca fácil no lo es, ya que el preparado de este platillo le demanda su buena cantidad de tiempo para dejarlo apetecible. Cirila espera que con su esfuerzo e inversión en su negocio, éste salga adelante, para en un futuro cercano pueda tener un restaurante, y así brindarles a sus hijos mejores, oportunidades de educación y progreso. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita comprará un carrito sanguchero con el cual podrá realizar su trabajo con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Cirila is 30 years old, she lives in her own house with her three childrn who are the motor of her life and for whom she works arduously. She is from the town of Cuzco, and moved to the town of Lima in search of opportunities. She has had different occupations and at the present she is selling fried chicken with potatoes from 5 pm to 9 or 10 pm at a market close to her house. This job is going well as she has many clients who visit her small stand regularly, but even if is seems easy it is not, as it takes time to prepare this dish in order to make it tasty. Cirila hopes that with her effort and investment the business will get ahead so she can have a restaurant in the near future and thus offer better educational opportunities and progress to her children. This is her first loan with MFP and with the money she will buy a mobile food stand to be able to carry out her work more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mobile food stand.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo Fredy de 42 años y sus hijos; Carlos de 22, Susana de 20, Antony de 18, Marilyn de 11 y Sandra de 9. Se dedica a la venta  de productos por campaña, siendo un trabajo muy rentable, ya que asegura sus ventas según la demanda de determinados objetos según la temporada, en esta época por ejemplo se viene preparando para la campaña por el día de la madre, donde venderá determinados productos dedicados a este importante día. Su esposo (quien aparece en la foto) se ha venido dedicando al oficio de chofer desde hace 19 años, ya que viene de familia, su padre era dueño de carros con los que trabajaban él y sus hermanos, dedicándose al transporte de pasajeros, comenzando como cobrador de pasajes y pasando luego a ser chofer, actividad que realiza hasta hoy en día, comenzando a las 6y30 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Es por eso, que Clarisa viendo todo el esfuerzo de su esposo, quien ahora está algo enfermo del estómago, quiere apoyarlo, invirtiendo parte del préstamo que solicita para arreglar algunos desperfectos del carro que maneja y sabe que sólo trabajando y apoyándose juntos podrán salir adelante. Este es el primer préstamo que Clarisa tiene con Microfinanzas PRISMA, que por falta de tiempo su esposo Fredy ha realizado todos los trámites para el crédito, y ambos se comprometen a pagar puntual todos sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado, Clarisa comprará productos para la campaña por el día de la madre, y además refaccionarán el carro que maneja su esposo para que pueda brindar un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Clarisa is 43 years old. She lives with her husband who is 42 and their children: Carlos, 22, Susana, 20, Antony, 18, Marilyn, 11, and Sandra, 9. She sells products for campaigns, and she is doing well as she assures her sales in accordance with the demand of certain seasonal objects. For instance, at the moment she is preparing for the campaign for mother's day when she will be selling special products for this important celebration. Her husband (shown in the photo) has been a chauffeur for 19 years, as the rest of his family. He and his brother worked with vehicles owned by his father transporting passengers. He started as a conductor and later he became a chauffeur. He starts work at 6:30 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. Seeing the effort of her husband, who is now suffering from a stomach illness, Clarisa wishes to support him investing part of the loan requested in fixing flaws of the vehicle he drives, and she realizes that only by working and supporting each other can they get ahead. This is Clarisa's first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and due to lack of time her husband, Fredy, has made all the arrangements for the loan, and both are committed to repay punctually. With the money requested, Clarisa will buy products for the campaign for mother's day as well as spare parts for her husband's vehicle so he can provide good service.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for a vehicle and increase stock.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo construyó en el distrito D. Ventanilla. Se dedica a la venta D. verduras en el mercado 12 D. mayo, uno D. los más concurridos D. la Zona D. Mi Perú, que es como se llama su localidad. Epifania se ha dedicado a este negocio durante ya 15 años, tiempo en el cual ha ganado experiencia para desarrollar con mucha eficiencia su trabajo, ya que lo que más le gusta es la interacción con la gente, siendo una persona muy amable con el trato al cliente. Trabajar desD. las 7 D. la mañana hasta las 6 D. la tarD. le resulta muy cansado, en épocas D. verano el calor es insoportable y en épocas D. invierno el frió no la deja desempeñarse como quisiera, felizmente ha sabido lidiar con estos contratiempos, siendo una mujer muy fuerte y empeñosa, ahora quiere expandir su puesto, comprando mayor cantidad D. vegetales y adecuarlo para hacerlo más atractivo a la vista D. sus clientes. Epifanía es una cliente antigua y muy fiel a Microfinanzas PRISMA, siendo este su primer préstamo individual, ya que estuvo antes en bancos comunales. Con el dinero que solicita quiere abastecer su puesto D. mayor cantidad D. verduras, también contratará a un albañil para que arregle su puesto para se pueda ver mucho mejor y estar más cómoda cuando venda.
texts.en:
Epifania is 41 years old and lives with her husband and children in the house that, with a great deal of effort, she built in the district of Ventanilla. She sells vegetables in the May 12 market, which is one of the busiest in the zone of Mi Perú, where she lives. Epifania has been working in this business for 15 years, during which time she has gained a lot of experience with which she can conduct her work with a lot of efficiency. What she likes most about her work is the interaction she has with people, because she is very kind in her dealings with her clients. Because she works from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening, she gets very tired. In the summer, the heat is unbearable and in the winter, the cold doesn’t allow her to conduct her business as she would like to. Happily, she has learned to fight against these setbacks, because she is a very strong and hard-working woman. Now she wants to expand her stand, by buying more vegetables and renovate it to make it more attractive to her clients. Epifania is an old and very faithful client of Microfinanzas PRISMA, and this is her first individual loan, since before, she was involved in community banks. With the money that she requests, she wants to supply her stand with more vegetables. She will also hire a builder so that she can fix her stand so that it will look better and so that she will be more comfortable when she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mela Pela

texts.fr: Cette demoiselle a appris le métier de la coiffure, faute de moyens pour installer son atelier de coiffure, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des articles de friperie, elle s’approvisionne au marché local de hedrzanawoè. Elle est très dynamique et a une manière très attirance d’accueillir ses clients. Voulant agrandir son stock d’articles de friperie, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pou acheter 03 bals de vêtements et divers.
texts.en:
This is a young lady who learned the trade of hairdressing. Due to a lack of funds for establishing her own hair salon, she got started in the commerce of second-hand clothing and the like. She supplies herself at the local marketplace of Hedrzanawoè. She is very energetic and really has a way of attracting customers and accommodating them. Wanting to expand her stock of used clothing, she's requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy three bales of clothing and various other items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié avec une femme qui est ménagère, il a 02 enfants et réside avec sa famille dans le quartier de Tokoin WUITI, il a appris la maçonnerie, mais le revenu de ce métier étant insuffisant pour couvrir les charges de sa famille alors il fabrique à base du ciment des briques, des claustras, des paves, des balustres pour vendre. il a reçu de ses clients 02 commandes, pour les satisfaire, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de ciment, convoyer 02 camions de graviers, 01 camion de sable et divers autres matières.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married to a woman who is a housewife. He has two children and reside with his family in the Tokoin WUITI district. He learned masonry, but the revenues from this trade are insufficient for covering family expenses. So he makes cement blocks, screen-walls, paving blocks, and balusters for sale. He has received two orders from customers. To satisfy them, he's requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy ten sacks of cement, two truck-loads of gravel, one truck-load of sand, and various other materials.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, gravel, sand

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La Señora Maxima es Socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos, del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz,Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene 40 eños de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos, y posee estudios de primaria incompleta (cuarto grado).
Trebaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años, y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su primer prestamo fue de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió aumentar su capital.
Con este crédito de 600.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará abarrotes como fideos, azúcar, leche, etc. 
Desea anpliar su tiena vendiendo al por mayor.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, le gusta la forma de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maxima is a member of the Manuela Ramos Community Bank, in the district of Mazo Cruz, in the province of Collao, in Puno. She is 40 years old, is married, has 2 children, and has completed up to fourth grade of primary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 7 years and sells groceries. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which allowed her to increase her capital. With this loan of 600 nuevos soles, she will buy groceries, such as noodles, sugar, milk, etc. She wants to grow her store, selling wholesale. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos, because she likes the form of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, tuna, semolina, and oil

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de Mazo-Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 52 años de edad, está casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de segundo grado de educación primaria; ella vive en el Barrio Villa Esperanza.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ya varios años, es fundadora de dicho Banco Comunal.  Su primer préstamo fue  de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de fibra de Alpaca.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, podrá invertir en la compra de algunos productos artesanales como chompas, chalecos, guantes, etc.  Paralelamente se dedica a la preparación de desayunos en la ferias de su distrito, para el cual piensa invertir parte del préstamo en la compra de chocolate, azúcar, y combustible.  Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes.
Nos menciona que se siente muy agardecida por el apoyo que brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia is a member of the God is Love Community Bank, in the district of Mazo-Cruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 52 years old, is married, has 3 children and has completed second grade of primary school. She lives in the Villa Esperanza neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for a few years. She is the founder of her Community Bank. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in the purchase of Alpaca fibers. With this loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of some handicraft products such as sweaters, vests, gloves, etc. She also prepares breakfasts in the fairs in her district, so she will invest part of the loan in the purchase of chocolate, sugar, and fuel. Her biggest dream is to have a grocery store. She says that she is very thankful for the support that Manuela Ramos offers.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweaters, gloves, vests, chocolate, sugar, and fuel

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Señora Irma es Socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos, del Distrito de MazoCruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y tiene estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, se dedica ala venta de artìculos de primera naecesidad (Abarrotes).
Con este préstamo de 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará frutas como naranja, manzana y otros productos como cebollas, tomates, azúcar, arroz, etc. para así poder surtir mejor su negocio.  Ella anhela abrir su tienda comercial tipo minimarket.
Está muy agradecida por los préstamos recibidos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma is a member of the Manuela Ramos Community Bank, in the district of Mazo-Cruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 22 years old, is single, and has completed secondary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 5 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles. She sells groceries and other necessary products. With this loan of 3000 nuevos soles, she will buy fruits like oranges, apples, and other products like onions, tomatoes, sugar, rice, etc. so that she will be able to supply her business better. She wants to open a minimarket. She is very thankful for the loans that she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oranges, apples, onions, tomatoes, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La Señora Veronica es socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos, en el Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 3 hijos.  Tiene estudios secundarios solo hasta cuarto año.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su primer crédito fue de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitio aumentar su capital para mejorar su negocio de compra y venta de ganado menor (ovejas).
Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, podrá comprar ovejas para su comercializaciòn.

Su mayor deseo es comprar una casa y un carro para transportar su mercaderia.

Manifiesta que le agrada el tipo de trabajo que desarrolla Manuela Ramos y sobre todo está contenta con la metodología de ahorros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Veronica is a member of the Manuela Ramos Community Bank, in the district of Mazo-Cruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children. She has finished her fourth year of secondary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 4 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which allowed her to increase her capital so that she could improve her business of buying and selling young livestock (sheep). With this loan of 2500 nuevos soles, she will be able to buy sheep to sell them. Her biggest dream is to buy a house and a car so that she can transport her merchandise. She shows that she is thankful for the work that Manuela Ramos does and, above all, she is happy with the method of savings.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young livestock (sheeo)

loans.name: Juana Eliana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de Mazo-Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, ella es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Ella trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 09 años aproximadamente, su primer préstamo fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de fruta.
Ahora ella implemento su negocio ya que ya no se dedica solo a la venta de fruta sino también, tiene una panadería.  Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles, podrá ampliar su negocio.  Comprará chocolates, caramelos, Harina y levadura para el negocio de panadería.
Ella es una de las socias mas puntuales del Banco Comunal, su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio para ser una gran tienda.  Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de todo el grupo.  Se siente agradecida por los préstamos recibidos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana is a member of the God is Love Community Bank, in the district of Mazo-Cruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, lives with her partner, has 1 son, and has completed secondary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for about 9 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in the purchase of fruit. Now she stocks her store with not just fruit, but she also has a bakery. With this loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will be able to grow her business. She will buy chocolates, caramels, flour, and yeast for the bakery. She is one of the most punctual clients of the Community Bank. Her biggest dream is to grow her business so that she has a big store. What she like most about her Community Bank is the punctuality of the whole group. She is thankful for the loan she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chocolates, caramels, flour, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois en gros et en détail. Elle  vend à crédit à ses clients et récupère l’argent dans les 7 ou 8 jours. Actuellement son stock est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 22 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman earns an income in the commerce of sacks of charcoal, wholesale and retail. She accepts credit from her customers and collects the money in seven or eight days. Currently, her inventory is exhausted. She wants to resupply herself and is requesting her first loan to buy 22 sacks of charcoal. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: María Amparo

texts.es: María Amparo L. de 45 años de edad reside en Soyapango junto a su hija menor, de 18 años de edad; su esposo y su hijo mayor viven en Estados Unidos. A pesar que estos le brindan ayuda a María, ella posee su propio negocio el cual es una tienda en su propia casa. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su tienda comprando más productos perecederos como pan, pastas, golosinas, jugos enlatados entre otros más. María necesita mejorar sus ventas y verlas reflejadas en sus ganancias, ya que lo que su familia le envía del exterior no le da a bastos con todos los gastos del hogar es por ello que espera ampliar su negocio a través de dicho préstamo y así obtener más ganancias y mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María Amparo L. is 45 years old. She lives in Soyapango, together with her younger daughter, who is 18 years old. Her husband and older son live in the United States. Because they support María, she has her own business, which is a store in her own house. She requests a loan through which she will be able to invest more in her store, by buying more perishable products, such as bread, pastas, sweets, canned juices, among other things. María needs to improve her sales and see that reflected in her earnings, since what her family sends her from abroad is not enough to cover all of the household expenses. Because of this, she hopes to grow her business with this loan, have more earnings, and improve her financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable products

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Maria es Socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos, del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, de la Provincia del Collao, Departamento Puno;tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 8 hijos y posee  estudios primarios.
Trebaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 11 años. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz azucar, fideos, leche etc. etc.). Paralelamente a esta actividad, se dedica a la preparaciòn de comida, la misma que vende en las ferias de su pueblo.  Su primer prestamo fuè de 300.00 Nuevos Soles.
Con este prestamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos Soles, comprará diversos productos de abarrotes como aceite, leche, arroz, azúcar, fideos, ectre otros.  Esto le permitirá mejorar su servicio hacia sus clientes, afin de generar mejores ingresos para su familia.  Tanbien manifieta que le gusta todo el manejo de su Banco Comunal.  Su deseo es ampliar su tienda para poder generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Manuela Ramos Community Bank in the district of Mazo-Crus, Collao province, department of Puno, Peru. She is a 56-year-old married mother of eight with a primary education. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past 11 years. Maria makes a living selling groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.). Along with this activity, she also prepares food that she sells at her town's flea markets. Her first loan was for 300 soles and with the current loan of 3000 she is requesting she plans to purchase a wide variety of grocery products such as oil, milk, rice, sugar among other items. This will allow her to better serve her customers and earn more income for her family. She also adds that she enjoys all the management advice from her community bank. Her wish is to expand her store so she can generate more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, milk, rice, sugar, noodles and other grocery items

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Leonor  es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de Mazo- Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 32 años de edad, ella es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ya 03 años, su primer préstamo fue  de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en su puesto de golosinas (chocolates, galletas, dulces).

Con este préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual incrementará su capital y comprará calzado en diferentes tallas y modelos.  Ella manifiesta que tiene su tienda en la ciudad de Tacna, trabaja solo a pedidos entrega en Puno y en Juliaca, su mayor deseo es abrir más mercado a nivel nacional.
Manifiesta que le gusta mucholas reuniones de su Banco Comunal, donde también recibe capacitación en temas de género.
texts.en:
Leonor is a member of the "God is Love" Community Bank in the district of Mazo-Cruz, Collao provine, department of Puno, Peru. She is 32 years old, has one son, lives with her partner and has a high school education. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in her snack stand. She is currently requesting a loan of 3000 soles to increase her capital and to purchase footwear in different styles and models. She says that she has her store in the city of Tacna and she works only with orders delivered from Puno and Juliaca. Her biggest wish is to reach a market on the national level. She adds that she really enjoys meetings with her community bank, where she receives training.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase footwear in different styles and models

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de MazoCruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 34 años de edad, ella es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de secundaria completa; ella vive en el Barrio José Antonio.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 07 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles que le permitió aumentar el capital para su tienda de abarrotes con el cual compró arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles, comprará gaseosas al por mayor, arroz, fideos, azúcar, etc., ya que en ésta época tendrá mayor demanda por estar cerca a la fiesta patronal de la región.
Su sueño es poder poner un grifo.
manifiesta que le gusta las capacitaciones que recibe del Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the "God is Love" Community Bank in the district of Mazo-Cruz, province of Collao, department of Puno, Peru. She is 34 years old, lives with her partner, has one son and has a high school education. She lives in the José Antonio neighborhood. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past seven years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which allowed her to raise capital for her grocery store and purchase rice, sugar and oil. She is currently requesting a loan of 1,500 soles, which she will use to purchase soft drinks at wholesale, rice, noodles, sugar, and other items, since this time of year she has more demand by being close to the region's patron saint festival. Her dream is to set up a faucet for her store. She adds that she enjoys the training she receiver from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, noodles, sugar and soft drinks at wholesale

loans.name: Morena

texts.es: Morena M. de 23 años de edad reside en el municipio de El Rosario y vive junto a su madre. Ella posee una tienda la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa y se encuentra frente a una escuela por lo cual cuenta con varios clientes. A pesar de su corta edad y de ser soltera ella trabaja muy duro día con día para obtener el dinero necesario para ella y su madre, ya que en dicha tienda ella comercializa jugos enlatados, golosinas y también hace pupusas (platillo típico salvadoreño el cual esta hecho a base de masa de maíz o arroz, la cual se mezcla con chicharro, queso y frijoles y se le da la forma de una tortilla). Es su madre quien le ayuda en el negocio a Morena, ambas se esfuerzan mucho debido a que esta es la única entrada económica que ellas poseen. Debido a que sus ventas son bastante aceptables, ella solícita un presta para obtener el capital necesario para comprar los productos requeridos para la elaboración de las pupusas, ya que este es el producto que más se vende en su negocio, Morena desea mejorar sus ventas para poder obtener mayores ganancias y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Morena M. is 23 years old and lives in the municipality of El Rosario with his mother. She has a store located in her home in front of a school. Despite her young age and of being single, she works very hard day to day to earn the necessary money for her and her mother. At the store she sells bottled juices, snacks and also makes pupusas (a typical Salvadoran dish made with corn or rice and mixed with pork rind, cheese and beans in a tortilla). Her mother helps her with the business, and both give a lot of effort because it is the only source of income they have. Because the sales are quite acceptable, Morena is requesting a loan to have the necessary capital to purchase the ingredients to make pupusas since that is the best-selling product. Morena wishes to improve her sales to increase her earnings and have more economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make pupusas, a typical regional dish

location.town: Rosario de La Paz, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Eliana Epifania

texts.es:
La señora Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de Mazo- Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 21 años de edad, ella es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de segundo grado de educación secundaria; ella vive en el Barrio José Antonio.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue  de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra venta de DVD y otra parte para la compra de lana sintética para la elaboración de artesanía. Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías (tejidos) y DVD's.

Este préstamo de S/ 1700.00 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de combustible.
Su mayor deseo es poner un grifo para lo cual requiere una suma mas alta, pero iniciará con la compra de combustible para la venta al por menor.
Lo que mas le gusta son los ahorros de su Banco Comunal.  Está agradecida por la capacitación que recibe del Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eliana is part of the Banco Coumnal “Dios es Amor” society, in the Mazo-Cruz district of the Collao province of Puno. She is 21-years old and is married with one child who is studying in secondary school. She lives in the Jose Antonio borough. She has been working for the Manuela Ramos movement for the last year and her first loan was for S/300.00 nuevos soles that was invested in the sale of DVDs and other parts for crafting items from wool synthetics. She has dedicated herself to the sale of these crafts and to selling DVD’s. This loan is for S/1700.00 nuveos soles to invest in the purchase of fuel. She desires place a cap to contain the high pressure, but that starts with the purchase of fuel for retail sale. Eliana enjoys the savings she receives through her community bank. She is grateful for the training she receives from the Manuela Ramos movement.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase synthetic wool and DVDs

loans.name: Gasilda

texts.es:
La señora Gasilda  es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de Mazo- Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad, ella es casada, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el  Barrio José Antonio.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ya 2 años, su primer préstamo fue  de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en su tienda de abarrotes en la compra de arroz, azúcar, etc.….

Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, leche, sémola, etc.  La Señora Gasilda nos indica que necesita un monto mayor para invertir en la crianza de trucha en su comunidad de Chiliyapi, negocio en el que piensa ampliar más adelante.
Su mayor deseo es hacer crecer su criadero de truchas y lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es todo su manejo y sobre todo los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gasilda is a member of Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor,” en the Mazo-Cruz district, Collao province of Puno. She is 37-years old and is married with two children who have completed secondary school. She lives in the Jose Antonio borough. She has worked for the Manuela Ramos movement for the last 2-years and her first loan was for S/300.00 nuevos soles which was invested into her grocery store to purchase a stock of rise, sugar and etc… With this loan of S/1000.00 nuevos soles, she will buy rice, sugar, milk, grits and etc… Mrs. Gasilda tells us that she will need a larger loan to invest in the rearing of trout in her community of Chiliyapi and she believes her business will grow in leaps and bounds. Her desire is to have a fishery for trout and she is happy with the management of the community bank, especially for the savings she receives through it.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock items like milk, sugar, butter and grits

loans.name: Esperanza Janeth

texts.es:
Su esposo y ella pasaron por un momento muy duro economicamente, ella tenia que salir a trabajar fuera de la cuidad, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

pero descuidaba mucho a su hijos, asi que comenzo con el negocio en casa, ya tiene 6 años desde que empezo vendiendo sus tacos a personal de las fabricas , bodegas, talleres , oficinas y vecinos de su colonia.

ella pide el apoyo para ampliar su negocio, construir una techo, para la temporada de lluvias, una plancha mas grande, asi poder hacer mas tacos, todo para brindar un mejor servicio a sus fieles clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza’s husband and she are on hard times financially. She had to work outside the city limits, to help her husband with the household expenses. This caused her to neglect her children much, so she started a business from home and it has been 6-years since she started selling tacos at factories, corner stores, to tellers, offices and to residents of her colony.

She needs the assistance to grow her business, to construct a roof in time for the rainy season. She also needs a large grill to make more tacos and also to provide the best service to her loyal customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To extend the business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Señora Antonia es socia del Bonco Comunal Manuela Ramos Del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz Provincia del Collao. Departamento de Puno;tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 5 hijos estudio primer grado de primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde que se inició (hace muchos años atras), asi mismo comenta que fue una de las fundadoras è inicio con un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, monto que invirtió en su tienda de abarrotes.
Con este préstamo de 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará sombreros de damas y caballeros, en vista que se avecina las fietas patronales de su pueblo, las mismas que le dejara buenas ganancias.
Su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo en el negocio, es decir, ser mayorista.
Manifiesta que les gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y la puntualidad de los miembros del mismo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia is a member of the Manuela Ramos Community Bank of the Mazo-Cruz district, in the Collao province of Puno. She is 54-years old and is in a civil union. She has 5-children in the first grade in primary school.

She works with the Manuela Ramos movement since it began (many years ago.) She herself says she was a founder that started with a loan of S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles which was invested in a grocery store.

With this loan request of 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will purchase hats for both ladies and gentlemen given the patron’s festival is coming to town and anticipates that this will produces good profits.

Mrs. Antonia’s desire is to continue the growth of her business, i.e. to go wholesale. She really enjoys participating in the community bank meetings and appreciates the timeliness of its members.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hats for males and females.

loans.name: James

texts.en: Since 1979 James Dohkoe has worked as a shoemaker and knife sharpener at Shama Junction.  James gathers old machetes, recycles the metal and creates new knives out of the old products.  He is married with eight dependents and received an education through Junior High School. His wife works as a farmer.  James is responsible for paying water and light bills and also for providing housekeeping money for his family.  His loan will be used to trade in old machetes, which he will recycle into new knives, and also tires, which he will make into shoes.  He hopes to use the new profits from his business to help complete a home for his children.

loans.use: To trade in old machetes, recycle them into new knives, and also tires, which he will make into shoes.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Since 2004 Emmanuel S. has worked as a trader at Shama Junction, selling such goods as plastic bags and frozen fish. He is married with three children and received an education through Junior High School. His wife is also employed as a trader in the area. Emmanuel is responsible for paying for various family essentials, such as water and light bills, and also for providing housekeeping money. His loan will be used to increase his capital to buy more fresh fish for his cold store. He hopes to use his newly gained profits to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish for his cold store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary J. is divorced with four children. She received an education through Junior High School. Since 2008 Mary has worked as a trader at Shama Junction, operating a provision shop with such goods as sugar and Milo (a powdered chocolate malt mix).  She uses her income to help with the upkeep of her family and the household.  Mary will use the loan to purchase additional items such as sugar and milk for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to continue to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase items for resale in her shop.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama S. is married with 6 dependents and received an education through Junior High School. Since 2004, she has worked as a trader at Dwomo, near Shama Junction, selling items such as meat pies, drinking water, a cocoa drink (a chocolate flavoured drink that is served cold) and soft drinks.  While Ama works as a trader, her husband is employed as a mason.   Ama uses her income to assist her husband in paying various household expenses, primarily for the needs of the children.  She will use the loan to increase her capital base to buy more flour and other ingredients for the making of pie for sale. With her newly gained profits, Ama plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Ingredients for food production

loans.name: Daniel Isaías

texts.es: Daniel Isaías M. de 39 años de edad reside en Soyapango junto a su esposa y su hijo. Daniel posee una panadería, en la cual trabaja ya desde hace 15 años, el no posee empleados en dicho negocio únicamente la ayuda de su hermana a la cual le da un pago simbólico de $100 dólares mensuales. Daniel solicita un préstamo para comprar una vitrina para colocar el pan y un pick up para poder distribuirlo de manera más rápida y segura, es así como él espera mejorar su negocio, lo cual le ayudara mucho a poder percibir mayores ganancias
texts.en:
Daniel Isaias M. is 39-years old and resides in Soyapango with his wife and child. Daniel owns a bakery where he has worked for the last 15-years. He does not have any employees as his sister helps out with the business and he pays her a $100/monthly as a gesture. Daniel requests a loan to purchase a showcase to place the bread and a commercial paddle to distribute the bread efficiently and safely. This is how he hopes to improve the business, which will in turn give him higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a commerical paddle and a showcase.

loans.name: Kodjo Mawuli

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié avec une dame qui est opératrice de saisie, il est père de 02 enfants. Pour pouvoir subvenir aux charges de sa famille, il a commencé en 2008 la vente de produits d’alimentation générale. Il attire beaucoup de personnes par sa manière d’accueillir. Il veut agrandir son commerce et réaliser plus de profit pour pouvoir subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Pour réaliser cela il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 8 bidons d’huile, 100 sacs de riz, 02 cartons de savons, 02 cartons de macaroni, un carton de lait et des cartes de recharges
texts.en:
This gentleman is married to a lady who does data entry. He is the father of two children. To be able to provide for his family, he started selling grocery items in 2008. He draws in a lot of people by his accommodating manner. He wants to expand his business and to realize more profit in order to provide for his family. To do so, he's requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy eight drums of oil, 100 sacks of rice, two boxes of soap, two boxes of macaroni, a box of milk, and some mobile phone recharge cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Marya

texts.en:
Marya is married. She sells food at the market in the small city of Zhidachev. She has been in this business for 15 years. She always offers her clients good and fresh food products, providing them with what they need. Marya is a hard-working and enthusiastic person. She wants to continue her business to make a living for her family.

Marya would like to borrow 7,000 UAH to increase her inventory. There are many celebrations in April and May and demand for her products grows.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Amor Y Paz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Amor y Paz , son mujeres que se llevan bien, sociables, responsables con deseos de de superarse, son vecinas cercanas, Doña LUXY tiene 36 años, tiene tres años de tener su pulperia, esta ubicada en un sector estrategico donde tiene bastante demanda, sus clientes son sus vecinos y 
y personas que transitan el lugar, ella se levanta muy temprano a abrir su negocio y lo cierra a las diez de la noche , ella vende pañales, papel higienico, arroz, manteca,  café, azucar, maseca, margarina, salsa, la cliente invierte a la semana $ 300.00 Y gana $ 83.00. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas productos como ser refrescos, maseca, manteca, arroz, jugos espaguettis, frijoles, y asi tener mas surtida su pulperia ya que el sueño de la cliente es verla mas grande, y a la vez obtener mejores ganancias.
 DOÑA IRIS se dedica a la venta de golosinas, charamuscas y gelatinas desde hace seis años ella las va a vender a la escuela de la colonia ya que sus clientes son los alumnos y vecinos ella es una persona agradable, sociable, querida por los niños , ella les lleva a vender tacos, chilaquiles, tamalitos de frijoles paletas, la cliente compra a la semana $ 37.00 y  gana $ 73.00 de esta forma le ayuda a su esposo al sustento ya que tienen tres hijos, ella necesita nuestro apoyo para comprar zapatos nuevos, comesticos, ropa clasificada, ya que anteiormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de ropa su sueño es poner su negocio bien fuerte y hacer profesionales sus hijos.
 DOÑA GLADYS ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace cinco años, sus clientes son sus vecinos asi mismo tiene clientes fijos  y a la vez surte cafeterias y  casetas en Plaza Loarque, ya que desde niña le gustaba hacer tortillas, ella compra a la semana $ 45,00 gana  $ 75.00, la cliente le ayuda a su esposo ya que tiene  3 hijos en la escuela y de esta forma han podido salir adelante ,el sueño de ella es verlos profesionales, el credito lo necesita para comprar maiz leña,cal.
  WILFIDA tiene 26 años ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace tres años,ya que desde pequeña le ayudaba a su mama a vender tortillas,  sus clientes son sus vecinos, y tiene clientes fijos a los que les entrega a diario la cliente compra a la semana $ 50,00 gana $ 70,00 , el sueño de ella es vender mas ya que necesita credito para comprar materia prima (maiz, maseca, leña y cal)
texts.en:
The Amor & Paz Group are comprised of women who get along well, are sociable who are tasked with the desire to overcome obstacles and are close-by neighbors.

Ms. Luxy is 36-years old and has owned a shop for the last 3-years. This business is located in a strategic sector where there is great demand. She clients are her neighbors and passers-by. She’s open for busy very early in the morning and closes her doors at 10 PM. She sells napkins, toilet paper, rice, butter, coffee, sugar, Maseca (brand of corn), margarine, salsa. It costs $300.00 per week to maintain, yet she only earns $83. Lucy needs credit to purchase more items like refreshments, Maseca, butter, rice, spaghetti sauce, beans as she’d like to have a very diverse shop. She dreams to see her pool of clients grow and hopes to gain good profits.

Ms. Iris has been committed to the sale of candy, snacks and jellies for the last 6-years. She goes to the schools in her colony as well as to students and neighbors to sell her products. She is a very well liked, very sociable person who cares for the children. She starts by selling tacos, chilli’s and bean tamales which cost $37.00, but generate $73 of income. With this form of help she will be able to support her husband and three children. She needs our help to buy new shoes, cosmetics and a uniform to be presentable as she was engaged in the sale of clothing. Her dream is to have a thriving business and to have her children become professionals one day.

Ms. Gladys has been engaged in the sales of tortillas for the last 5-years. Her clients are her neighbors and she also has clients at her kiosk and sometimes finds luck by the cafés in the Loarque Plaza. The children love to have tortillas. She spends $45 a week on materials but earns $75 for her efforts. The customers help her support her husband and three children who are in school and will have the opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to see them become professionals and the loan is needed to purchase corn, wood and lime.

Ms. Wilfida is 26-years old and has been engaged to the sale of tortillas for the last 3-years. She will need a little assistance to help her mother sell tortillas. Her clients are her neighbors, as well, and she also has clients at the kiosks that she encounters daily. The materials cost $50.00, but she earns $70.00 per week. Her dream is to sell much and the much needed credit will allow her to buy premium material (corn, maseca, wood and lime).

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase various general store items.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: La  Sra. Erlinda tiene su negocio de Pulperia, el cual esta ubicado en una colonia muy poblada, ella inicio con una pequeña pulperia hace cuatro años y actualmente cuenta con un negocio bien surtido y mas amplio ella es muy conocida en la zona por su amabilidad y buena atencion con todos sus clientes, ella se levanta cada mañana a las 5:30 ya que aparte de su pulperia ella junto con su esposo tiene un molino para moler maiz y tiene muchas clientas que llegan a esa hora. Necesita El credito ya que muchos de sus vecinos le han encargado electrodomesticos como ser licuadoras, vajillas, ollas, cameras para la venta y no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprarlas. Su sueño es poder hacer mas grande su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos y con eso pagar los estudios a su hija cuando este grande, ella es muy activa, trabajadora y responsable, es graduada como Secretaria y trabajo algunos años pero le gusto mas tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Erlinda runs a store. This business is in a highly populated colony. She started with a tiny, humble shop four years ago and now the business has a sizeable stock and has grown so much so that it is well known in the area for the care and kindness shown to all customers.

She gets up at 5:30 AM each morning as she lives with her husband on the other side of the shop with her husband; they have a mill to grind the corn and have clients that come by at this early hour of the day. She needs this loan as there are many neighbors with electrical domestic needs like blenders, pots, pans, cameras for sale and she does have sufficient funds to buy these things.

Ms. Erlinda’s dream is to have her business grow and to obtain good profits and to give her children the best education. She very active, hardworking and responsible and is a seasoned secretary who has worked many years, but would like to have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase various electrical domestic products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Virginia Del Carmen

texts.es: Virginia del Carmen C. D. Martí resiD. en Cojutepeque junto a su hija D. 15 años y su esposo el cual trabaja como motorista. Virginia posee un negocio D. plásticos como vasos desechables, platos entre otros más. Dicho negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal D. Cojutepeque y ya cuenta con 7 años D. tenerlo. Virginia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos desechables, D. manera que pueda surtir más su negocio, ya que uno D. los mayores sueños D. Virginia es poder ver su negocio bastante surtido y establecido en el lugar D. manera que sea el preferido por los clientes que visitan el lugar, ya que esto contribuirá a que ella pueda colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y permitirá a que ella y su familia obtengan una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Virginia del Carmen C. D. Martí lives in Cojutepeque along with her 15 year old daughter and her husband who works as a driver. Virginia has a plastics business such as disposable cups and plates among other things. Said business is located in the municipal market of Cojutepeque and she has had the business for 7 years. Virginia is asking for a loan with which she will buy more disposable products, and in this way she can secure more business. One of Virginia's biggest dreams is to see her business better supplied and established in a space in the way that is preferred by the customers that visit the shops as this will help her to assist her husband with household expenses and to allow her and her family have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic products for resale

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Maura Gissela

texts.es: La  Sra. Maura tiene su negocio de venta de Variedades, como ser Ropa Usada, shampoo, cremas, desodorantes, perfumes, sandalias, ella sale a vender a los vecinos de su colonia Jose Angel Ulloa, desde hace cuatro años y dos veces al mes ella va a su pueblo Leptarique, en el Departamento de la Paz, donde vive su familia y lleva mercaderia para entregar ya que es por encargo y aprovecha el viaje para ofrecer sus productos a otras personas, ella empezo su negocio solo con la venta de ropa usada, pero debido a que su esposo esta muy enfermo y ya no trabaja, ella se encarga de sostener sus tres hijos, ha tenido que ofrecer mayor variedad de productos como ser cremas, shampoo, perfumes, rinse, glass y otros para poder aumentar sus ingresos, se siente muy contenta porque le ha dado muy buenos resultados, ella es muy carismatica, trabajadora y muy responsable, necesita el credito ya que quiere comprar mas productos. Su sueño es poder aprender a leer y ver a sus hijos graduados de la secundaria, por eso trabaja muy duro todos los dias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maura has a business in the sale of various items such as used clothing, shampoo, lotions, deodorant, perfume, and sandals, and she sells them in the area of her neighborhood, Jose Angel Ulloa. For 4 years, two times a month she has gone to her village, Lepatarique in the Department of la Paz, where she lives with her family, and brings merchandise to deliver which has been ordered and she takes the trip so as to offer her merchandise to other people. She started her business alone with the sale of used clothing, but, because her husband is very sick and cannot work and thus Maura is in charge of sustaining their three children, she has had to offer a greater variety of products such as lotions, shampoos, perfumes, glass, and other things to augment her earnings. She is very pleased because she has had much success. She is very charismatic, hardworking, and responsible. She needs this loan so she can buy more merchandise. Her dream it to learn how to read and to see her children graduate from secondary school. For this she works very hard every day.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy good for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Javier actualmente labora para un Punto de Taxis de la Colonia Jose Angel Ulloa, misma donde el vive, desempeñandose como Despachador y colaborador del punto desde hace dos años, el tenia una Pequeña pulperia pero durante el mes de Enero la lluvia ocasiono muchos problemas en la zona donde vive Javier y su casa se derrumbo y con esto perdio su negocio, El necesita que le apoyemos ya que actualmente el vive en la casa de un primo y quiere comenzar a frescos y frutas para lograr obtener otros ingresos, ya que sus niños estan en la escuela. Su esposa se dedica a la Elaboracion y venta de Tortillas, los dos han luchado fuerte por volver a construir su casa y a la espera que el Gobierno de la Republica tambien les ayuda. Se muestra una persona muy responsable y honesta.
texts.en:
