At 34 Shahlohon has already four children. Her husband works for a collective farm and is involved in different businesses in addition. Shahlohon is a stay-at-home mother but she also tends to the cattle. Since she has been tending to cattle since childhood, this is easy for her. The cattle grows fast and brings good profit. Shahlohon is applying for a loan in order to puchase a little bull calf.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf

loans.name: Marlene Beatriz

texts.es: Marlene Beatriz C. de 30 años de edad reside en Soyapango junto a su pequeña hija de tres años de edad y su compañero de vida. Ella posee una pupusería en la cual junto a su esposo trabajan arduamente para poder obtener una vida mejor para ellos y su hija. Marlene solicita un préstamo a través del cual obtenga el capital necesario para invertir en su negocio y comprar maíz y frijoles lo cual se utilizara para elaborar las pupusas, ella comercializa sus pupusas frente a su casa y logra vender una buena cantidad la cual les permite cubrir algunos gastos del hogar, es por ello que ella desea mejorar las ventas de su negocio, para lograr obtener más ganancias que le permitan tener una vida mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Marlene Beatriz C. is 30 years old and lives in Soyapango with her husband and 3 year old daughter. She has a food stand that she and her husband work very hard at in order to obtain a better life for them and their daughter. Marlene would like a loan in order to obtain the necessary capital to invest in her business and purchase corn and beans for "pupusas". She sells the pupusas in front of her house and sells a lot of them in order to cover the household bills. She would like to increase her sales, which would allow her and her family to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans and corn

loans.name: Reina Janeth

texts.es: Reina Janeth C. E. reside en Tonacatepeque junto a sus dos hijos ,el mayor de 14 años y la menor de 5 años. Como toda madre soltera trabaja muy duro día con día por el bienestar de sus hijos, es así como Reina trabaja arduamente en su salón de belleza el cual cuenta con dos años de poseerlo. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual obtenga el capital necesario para poder mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, esto con el fin de hacer más confortable la estancia de sus clientes de manera que pueda percibir más ganancias las cuales contribuyan a la economía familiar y le facilite el poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Reina Janeth C. E. lives in Tonacatepeque with her two sons, the oldest is 14 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. Like all single mothers, she works hard every day for the welfare of her children. This is why Reina works hard at her beauty shop which she has owned for two years. She is asking for a loan to obtain the necessary capital to improve the infrastructure of her business so that she can make her clients more comfortable in her shop. This will allow her to obtain greater profits which will contribute to the family economy and will allow her to provide her children with all the necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of her beauty shop.

loans.name: Savoba

texts.ru: Савоба арендует часть магазина в центре города. Занимается продажей детской одежды, детских гигиенических средств. Опыт в этой деятельности более 15 лет, так как она сама бывший работник торговли. Ей 42 года. Имеет 2 детей. Ее старшая дочь постоянно помогает ей торговать. За товаром Савоба ездит на оптовый рынок г. Худжанда и в соседний Кыргызстан. Савоба собирается закупить весенний ассортимент детской одежды и поэтому подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Savoba M. rents a section of a store in the city center. She has a business selling children's clothes and health products. She has 15 years of experience, having worked in retail in the past. Savoba is 42 years old. She has 2 children. Her older daughter helps in the store. To purchase goods Savoba travels to a wholesale market in a neighboring city Hudzhanda and to the neighboring country Kyrgyzstan. Savoba plans to purchase spring children's clothes, and therefore she is asking KIVA for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Azizahon

texts.ru: Азизахон стала заниматься предпринимательством совсем недавно. Ее мать которая торгует рядом обучила ее всем правилам данного бизнеса и постепенно Азизахон научилась и покупать зелень оптом. И продавать ее в розницу. Так как заработной платы по основной своей работе не хватает на жизнь, занятие бизнесом позволяет получать доход, и покрывает многие расходы семьи. Азизахон собирается расширить товарооборот и поэтому подала заявку на займ КИВА.
texts.en:
Azizahon has recently started her own business. Her mother, who works near her, has taught her all of the rules of business, and gradually Azizahon has learned to buy greens wholesale and sell retail. Though she does not make enough to support herself, working in business provides an income and defrays many of the family’s expenses. Azizahon is going to expand sales and consequently has applied for a loan from Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Mrs. Angelina H., 44 years old, is married to Celso H.. They are blessed with two children and presently reside at Kauswagan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. The couple are both members of Paglaum Coop. She is a member under the micro finance program and her husband is a regular member also. She has an existing Sari-sari store but she needs additional capital to have more stock. She requests a loan amounting to PHP 7,000.00 for additional stock. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. She dreams of making an extension to her store and repairing their house. She dreams also that someday her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy more items for her store

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion B. is 57 years old. She is married and has two children who are living separately with their own families. She resides at Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. Her loan is intended to buy fertilizer for corn production, plus vitamins and feed for hog raising. She admitted that with the help of PMPC-Micofinance, her business has grown in a way that she has a better income now than before. Her husband also does the corn planting and hog raising. Through the help of each other, they make their activities easier and more comfortable.

The family hopes to have a comfortable life someday and be able to send their children to school and have their own decent life in the future too.

loans.use: Feed for hog raising and fertilizer for planting corn

loans.name: Herma Fe

texts.en:
Herma Fe P., 19, presently resides in Pag-asa village, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She's engaged in a retail business she learned from her mother. Her business is located in the public market of Dumalinao, which is very accessible for customers.

She needs more capital in order to meet the demand of her customers, most of whom are teenagers. She has stock but still she needs additional capital to purchase the latest and different styles of hair clips, earrings, wallets for men and women, combs, beauty products and other items. So she applied for a loan with Paglaum Co-op worth PHP 5,000.00 to purchase the said stock. She plans to have a stable business with enough capital and to have a family and a concrete house.

loans.use: Additional capital for retail business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorna P. has been a member in good standing of Golden Star Center since April 2004. She is on her ninth loan cycle for additional capital of her rice-production business, which she operates with her husband. She is a very active member. In fact, she has never committed any default of her weekly obligation. She requested the loan amount of Php 5,000.00 for fertilizer, medicines and labor for farm cultivation. She believes she can have a good harvest, especially now that the rainy days are suited for farming.

Now she is very happy living together with her family and very thankful to our own cooperative that allowed them to borrow a little amount of money which is a very big help to them for their daily living. She aspires that they will be able to send their children to school and have a better life in a near future.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Mrs. Leonora D. is 57 years old, married and lives at Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with four children. Her husband is a farmer. Some of her children are in college already. She says "if we only depend on the income of my husband from farming, it is not enough to support our daily needs.” She felt the difficulty of sending their children to school. And so, Leonora thought of an economic project that would generate additional income.

Cooking is her favorite household chore.  That’s why she got the idea of selling viand or food in retail. Last October 2008, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for a chance to take a loan. She’s happy that the cooperative has extended their services to the needy ones. From then on, she gained more customers and generated daily income. Today, she applies for PHP 7,000 for additional capital for her food vending. Seeing all her children succeed in life is her greatest achievement.

loans.use: Additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Arlyn T., 48 years old, is married and lives at Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a carpenter and they are lucky to have one child. Her husband's income does not suffice for all their needs in their daily living and that is why, with her small store, Arlyn helped with added income.

To be able to buy additional commodities for the store, Mrs. T. applies to Paglaum for a loan in the amount of PHP 14,900. She is praying for the success of her store so that she will give all the best of life to her child, who is a student.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Maristela

texts.en:
Mrs. Maristela T. is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children. Her husband is a seaman. She joined Paglaum in order to have additional capital for her existing project which is hog raising.

Mrs. Maristela is using her 2nd loan cycle of Php 7,000.00 for feed for her hog raising project. She is happy having this kind of project as it helps her with her income in the future especially during harvest. She said she would take extra care in keeping her project at its best. She hopes that she'll be able to send her children to school in the future as it is their cherished ambition in life, too.

loans.use: Additional capital for feed for her existing project

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en: Mrs. Eleonor T. has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for 2 years. She is married and blessed with two kids; one of them is studying. She is engaged in raising pigs. Her husband's economic activity is in driving a motorcycle for hire. She has already availed of several loans in the co-op and now has also availed of another loan to purchase additional piglets to raise, hoping that through this activity, she can help her husband to provide for the financial needs of their kids.

loans.use: The purchase of piglets

loans.name: Brayan

texts.en: Mr. Brayan B., 23 years old, is married to Mrs. Lowela B., a fish vendor. They are blessed with two children and presently live in the town of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Bryan is a fisherman and a newly recognized member of Paglaum last March, and has availed of a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 in his first loan cycle, for the acquisition of a brand new machine. He is very happy with the loan assistance of Paglaum because he can acquire a machine on his own, as before, he went fishing by borrowing a pump boat from his father. He hopes that someday he can buy a bigger fishing boat so he can go fishing better.

loans.use: To pay for a brand new machine for fishing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is married to Nolie A., a farmer/tenant. Mrs. A. is in her 8th cycle, availing of PHP 5,500.00. Her loan is intended for additional capital for banana vending. Her customers are from their barangay and other neighboring places. She has 3 children and all are still studying at elementary level.

She dreams of a comfortable living, having enough income to sustain their daily needs and to also send their children to college education.

loans.use: Additional capital for banana vending

loans.name: Rheza

texts.en:
Rheza B. is 32 years old and married to Edgar B., who is a laborer. They have two children and presently reside in Baybay Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Hog raising is her project and Rheza would like a loan in the amount of 7,000 Php as starting capital to buy pigs, feed, and vitamins. She is thankful to Paglaum for their trust and assistance with her project. It helps them so much that Rheza can support the financial needs of the family and contribute by adding to her husband's income.

loans.use: To buy pigs, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Mrs. Estrella L. is married and lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is already on her second loan cycle for Php 3,000. Her husband is a tricycle driver who helps her in supporting their daily needs.

Her loan is intended as additional capital for hog raising. She's happy to have a loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. It will also help her to send her children to school. She is thankful that there is PMPC Micofinance, who help them to engage in such business for a better living. She is hoping that they can build a decent home someday.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nazya Group

texts.en:
Nazya is requesting a loan for her husband’s general store. Nazya is the leader of this four member group. Her husband needs to buy materials for his business.

The other members would also like to receive money for their businesses. Bibi Maryam is requesting a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy three new machines for her business. Norya will use the loan for her business of carpet weaving. She wants to buy carpet weaving materials. Weheda is requesting a loan for her brother’s general store. He wants to enlarge his shop.

This group is very happy with the loan process in Afghanistan and thanks all Kiva lenders and AFSG in Afghanistan for providing assistance to poor people.

loans.use: To buy materials for a general store

loans.name: Rosefina

texts.en:
An active member of Paglaum MPC for two years, Mrs. Rosefina D. is 45 years old and married with three children. Her husband previously worked as a carpenter. He also helped his wife raise pigs because this is their one way of earning an income. Both want to have a decent living in the future so they want to be secure, especially for the future of their children.

They have heard good views on the cooperative and they like the insurance and savings services. Now, they need additional capital to acquire piglets. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP. She wishes that this will be her stepping stone to become popular in the piggery business.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and additional piglets.

location.town: Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is 59 years old and married to Panfilo, a fisherman. They are blessed with only one child. The family presently resides at Baybay, Panalsalan, Misamis Occidental.

Gloria is a fish vendor, and at the same time she also has a hog raising business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 for food and vitamins for her pigs and also as additional capital for her fish vending. She is a good member and pays her loans promptly. The income derived from her hog raising helps her pay for the expenses of their house renovation.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and as additional capital for her fish vending.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
"Business-minded woman" describes Mrs. Charlita E.. She is 44 years old, married, and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City with her husband who is a tricycle driver. Their other source of income is from her business doing manual photo lamination. She learned this skill when she was in high school.

She started her business with Php 3,000 in capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Today, she is applying for a Php 7,000 loan. She will buy materials for photo lamination and “bugang” (Visayan term for a native grass used for broom making) for her new business. She aims to build a photo shop someday. She hopes and prays that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To buy photo-lamination and broom-making supplies

loans.name: Nada Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Nada M. is the group leader of the Nada M. group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for his/her business to purchase more materials for their businesses and make a good income for their families in future.

Nada M. wants to take a loan for his general store. He wants to expand and progress his business. Fazylah wants to take a loan for her son’s business of selling fruits and vegetables. Her son wants to make his shop larger. Faryda wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy new a machine for her business. Aqalah wants to take a loan for her husband’s retail food business. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop.

They are confident that with the money they receive they can have a good profit and can run their businesses in a good way. They all are happy about the process of obtaining a loan and want to say that it can support the entrepreneurs a lot.

loans.use: To make their businesses larger

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a fish and meat vendor in her village. Aside from that, she is also a dealer of beauty products for men, women and kids. For the continuous productivity of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000. She will use the loan to purchase more fish and meat and also additional items for her direct-selling business. She would be very glad if her requested loan is granted towards the development of her business.

Corazon and her family are living in Silauan Norte Echague, Isabela. Her four children are: Almer - 31 years old; Donato - 24 years old and Artem - 20 years old, they were all high school graduates and the youngest is Jaya Marie - 12 years old, an elementary student.

loans.use: To purchase meat, fish and items for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Purisima

texts.en:
Purisima is a vendor of different commodities in her village. She displays them in front of her house. Some of her products are vegetables, fruits, barbecue sticks and snacks. She is 50-years old and a resident of Barangay Estefania in Iguig, Cagayan. She has three children: Ricky - 28 years old; Jay-Pee - 20 years old and Rocky -16 years old. All of her children completed elementary school but have not been interested in pursuing further studies.

Aside from vending, she also raises hogs for extra income. She wants to further develop her farming business. She hopes to avail herself of a loan of 12,000 PHP that she can use to make her business grow. She believes that this loan will be of great help in maintaining her small businesses.

loans.use: To invest in vending and farming businesses

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana manages a tricycle-transport business in her village in Alibago, Enrile, Cagayan. She is married to Rizal who works as a security guard in Manila. They have three children: Rosalia, 10 years old, grade five; Remegio, 8 years old, grade three and Rina, 7 years old, grade one. Ana and her husband are working hard to send their children to school.

Aside from operating their tricycle, Ana is also engaged in the hog-raising business. This is another source of income that also supports the needs of their family, especially in sending her three children to school.

Ana is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. She plans to use the loan to buy piglets and also to repair their tricycle to ensure its continuous operation. She is hoping that somehow they may be able to surpass life’s difficulties and provide a better way of living for all of them.

loans.use: To buy piglets and to repair their tricycle

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma B. is 38 years old and lives in Barangay Alibago, Enrile, Cagayan. Her husband Victor is a jeepney driver, and they have a one-year-old daughter named Divine Asley.  

She is a meat vendor and store owner in their village. Her husband is very supportive of her endeavor, and her daughter serves as her inspiration to make it profitable.  

She is asking for a loan amount of PHP 25,000.00 to purchase different merchandise that she can stock in her store to meet the demands of her customers. She aims to improve her business and she is doing her best towards a successful life.

loans.use: To purchase different merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
“Patience is the key to success” says Nilda, a simple store owner in her village. According to Nilda, her business will pave the way to a progressive life if she can manage it well. To improve her business, she wants to request a loan of PHP 17,000.00 that will serve as her business capital.

She is 46 years old and married to Isidoro, a farmer in their village. According to Nilda, their sacrifices are for the future of their three children: Naydarie, 22 years old and a college graduate; Nolie, 21 years old and a criminology student; and Naiza, 11 years old and presently in grade school. She believes that the improvement of her business depends on hard work and perseverance. She dreams of having a comfortable house and also having a permanent stall in their public market.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hog raiser while his wife works as an employee in a non-governmental organization in Solano. Through his wife, he was able to learn about ASKI—the MFI providing the loan. Thus, he was motivated to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 that he needs for his piggery business. He plans to use the loan to buy additional piglets and feed supply. He believes that he can increase his income with the financial support of lenders and improve his business.

Julius and his wife Anna Leah have two children and live a happy life in the village of Manamtam Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. The couple strives hard for the future of their children and also to save enough to achieve their dream of having a progressive life.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed supply

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a responsible mother and a supportive wife to her husband. She helps her husband in maintaining their poultry business. She is 46 years old and they are living in Alibago in Enrile, Cagayan. Their 14 year old daughter, Marcely, is now in her third year of high school.

The couple works hard in order to provide for the needs of their daughter, especially her education. Lilia sells their raised broilers (chickens) in the market when they weigh a kilo. She wants to increase her income by improving her business and she can do this by obtaining a loan of PHP 5,000 that will serve as her capital. With this amount, they can have a better chance to develop her enterprise.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Juliebeth

texts.en:
Juliebeth, 22 years old and married at a young age to Jerry, is blessed with three children: Jerry Mark – 5 years old; Ermane – 3 years old and Christian Dale - 2 years old.

Juliebeth works as a vegetable vendor in the market and in their village, assisted by her husband, who plants a variety of vegetables. She is thankful that through the business, she is able to help Jerry with their financial and basic needs. She hopes to develop her enterprise into a more stable and sustainable source of income by means of hard work and perseverance. Thus, Juliebeth is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to be used as capital for the development of her business.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn N. and her family live in the mountainous area of Barangay Caronsi, Patagueleg, Penablanca, Cagayan. She is married to Manny and they are blessed with three children who are now in the primary level of education. With their small business, they are able to support the needs of their family.

Jonalyn sells snacks and cosmetic products in their village. She has been managing the business since 2000 and she purchases most of her products in the city market of Don Domingo, Tuguegarao City. Her business became their alternative source of income to support their family and she is still hoping for improvement to a better living.

Jonalyn operates the business in her little vending stall. She requests a loan of PHP 5,000. She will utilize the loan to buy flour, sugar, sweet potato (kamote), juice drinks (or so-called “camote” juice drinks) and other snacks that are needed by her customers.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, sweet potato (kamote), juice drinks and other snacks

loans.name: Cristopher

texts.en: Christopher, 26 years old and single, lives with his parents in Barangay Alibago, Enrile, Cagayan. A tricycle driver in their village, he uses his income to support the needs of his parents since they do not have a stable source of income. Christopher is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 for the repair of his motorcycle for the safety of his passengers.  He hopes that someday he will able to sustain his business for his future family.

loans.use: Tricycle Repair

loans.name: Rosefina

texts.en:
Rosefina is serves as the mother and father to her children. She is 46 years old and manages her vegetable vending and eatery business as their source of livelihood. She wants to improve her business and for this she would like to request a loan of 7,000 Philippine Pesos. She will use the loan to buy more vegetables and meat for her eatery.

She is grateful for having her two children: Jerome - 19 years old, a high school graduate and Haydee - 18 years old, a second year college student in criminology. She is doing her best so she can support the educational needs of her daughter. She believes that with deep faith and sacrifices, she will overcome every struggle that lies ahead.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and meat

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a simple person who resides in Barangay South Caronsi Patagueleg Peńablanca, Cagayan with his family. He is married to Corazon, a housewife, and they have two children: Chester Jhon - 1 year old and Cheska Isabel - 1 month. According to Jose, his family is striving to have a better way of living.

Jose wants to borrow a loan amounting to 7,000 Philippine Pesos for his snack vending business. He sells different snacks such as rice cakes and native delicacies in their village. He will use some of the loan for his business and some for the needs of his family. He hopes to maintain and develop his enterprise into a bigger one someday. He also aims to have a permanent vending stall someday, somehow create an opportunity for a better livelihood, and to save something for his family to have a more comfortable house.

loans.use: Business capital and personal use

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
In order to support her family with their necessities, Ester is doing her best in managing her vending business. She sells different vegetables, fruits and some snacks. She started this business in 1998 and it has been very helpful to her family. Her dream is to make her business grow for better profits. For this, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippines Pesos to buy additional products that she can sell. She believes that her dreams of having a successful business and of her children finishing their studies will become reality.

Ester N. is 48 years old, married, and has five children. She has also been one of the village councilors for two years. Her income from the business will be of great help in paying for her children's education.

loans.use: Food for resale

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a native of Cagayan province and she is now 58 years old. She is a widow with five children, four of them are already married and their youngest is 13 years old and living with her. Her youngest is in the elementary level in the public school in their village.

She operates a small store in their village. Her store is usually open from 6:00 in the morning until 9:00 in the evening. Her income is quite small to support her family's needs, thus, she wants to borrow a loan of 17,000 Philippine Pesos to improve her business and be able to save something for the high school and college education of her youngest child. The loan will be of great help for her store to become productive. She dreams of having a more convenient store someday. She is striving hard to send her child to school and have a better future.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina said, “Success is something to be work for; not to be waited for.” She took this as her inspiration in carrying out her plans and ambitions in life. She aims to become successful so she can provide the best education for her children. She is married to Alex and they live in Manamtam Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya.

Like most of the other residents, farming is their main source of livelihood. They plant rice and vegetables as their major crops which is very appropriate for the weather in Nueva Vizcaya. With their patience and sacrifices, they have been able to gain an average net income of 15,000 Philippine Pesos per harvest. They use it for their household’s needs and for the education of their two children. They want to increase their profit by maintaining their farming business. For this, Marina is requesting for a loan of 15,000 pesos from the Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to purchase farm supplies they need.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio, a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates corn, also works as a farm laborer in their village. To support his family, at the moment he is selling pork chicharon, his alternative income source after the harvest season, in his village and neighboring communities.   However, even though he is doing his best to earn a living, his income is still not enough to meet the family’s needs, so he has decided to request a loan of PHP 5,000.00 for the development of his chicharon business.  
	
Virgilio is married to Nanette and they have four children: Von Kaye -18; Ivy Alyanna Fatima – 16; Niel Genesis - 14, and Aldriane – 11. They are striving to someday uplift their family from their poor living conditions.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene S. is a vendor of different snacks such as rice cakes and also vegetables in their village. She also plants vegetables and morning glories which she also sells for extra income. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 for the development of her store.

Her husband Rex helps her gather vegetables that she can sell in the public market and in their village. They have four children who are all studying and who help them in their planting and selling, especially during school vacations.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 42-year-old store operator in her village. Her husband Ernesto is working as a farmer and sometimes accompanies her in her business when not busy on their farm. They have three children: Claire - 24 years old, a college graduate, as is Denver - 22 years old. The youngest is Cherry Ann - 18 years old, first year college. Evangeline prays for the success of their business and hopes that their youngest will finish her college education.

Aside from her sari-sari store (community-based store) that she has been managing for 17 years in Magsaysay, Quirino, Isabela, Evangeline is also managing an eatery for additional income. She is in need of financial assistance to improve her enterprise, thus, she would like to borrow PHP 7, 000 since her income is not enough to sustain her business and the immediate needs of her family. Evangeline is doing her best to become successful and somehow extend help to others because she believes that “it is better to give than to receive”.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a community-store owner. Her desire to help her husband provide the basic needs of their family and send their children to school motivated her to start her own business. To make her business grow, she is now requesting to access a loan of PHP 8, 000. She hopes that her loan request will be granted so that she can buy more stock to expand her business. Florencia says that patience and hard work is the best way to achieve their goals in life.

Florencia is married to Feliciano and they were blessed with four children: Analyn - 22 years old, a college undergraduate; Frederick - 18 years old; Jomar - 16 years old, a high school graduate, and the youngest is Jayson - 14 years old. She is hoping that someday her two younger children will finish their college education because they were not able to support the studies of their two older children due to lack of financial resources.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Lourie

texts.en:
Lourie D. J. is 46 years old and a tricycle (three-wheeled moto-taxi) operator in their village at Silauan Norte of Ecahgue, Isabela. He is married to Julieta and they have two children: Dexter - 21 years old, a high school graduate, and Diwata - 3 months old. Due to life difficulties, he was not able to pay for the college education of his son.

Lourie has worked as a tricycle operator for 20 years and he has also been a fish vendor in their village for two years. He is in need of financial assistance for the maintenance of his motorcycle that he also uses in fish vending. He is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 that will be of great help for the progress of his business.

Lourie is hoping that someday, they can send their younger child to school to earn a college degree.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: May

texts.en: Managing a mini-eatery is the chosen business of May T., a young businesswoman of 24.  She is married to Dennis and he is engaged in street food vending in their village.  They are working hard to earn a bigger income for the needs of their children and their family.  Her request of a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 will really assist them financially in improving their business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo, 50 years old and working as a tricycle operator in Santiago City, also cultivates his little rice field. He uses some of the income from his farm for the education of his two college-aged children, and is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000.00 for the registration and maintenance of his motorcycle. He is doing his best to sustain the needs of his two children and hopefully enable them to finish their college education.

Wifredo is happily living with his wife Ofelia and four children in Barangay Rizal of Santiago City. Their children are: Wilmer - 23 years old, college undergraduate; Rowel - 21 years old, a high school graduate; John - 17 years old, a senior high school student and Warren - 15 years old, high school freshman.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenace.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden, 34 and married to Dennis, has a three-year-old son named John Mark. Eden manages a grocery store located in the peaceful village of Magsaysay, Saguday, Quirino. She has been in this business for four years, and it really helps in providing for the needs of her family. She has an assistant and in this way is able to provide employment to others.

Eden is requesting a loan amount of PHP16,000 as additional business capital to help improve her store and meet the demands of her customers. “To have a successful life, there should be hard work and perseverance”, says Eden.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
“Diligent hands will rule, but laziness ends in slave labor,” this is the guiding principle of this hard-working farmer named Dionisio P. Sr., 52 years old. He raised his family in a rural community located at Barangay Manamtam in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya.

Dionisio cultivates his farm, planting rice, vegetables and onions that they also sell after they harvest them. He is also into the hog-raising business as their alternative source of income. His loan request of PHP 15,000 will be used to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and for the maintenance of their piggery. He is thankful that there are lenders who are willing to assist them financially to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilzer, pesticide and hog-raising needs

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila A. is 38-years old. Her husband, Nomer, is a farmer and they have an 11-year old daughter named Sharmaine who is in elementary school. Their family is living in Barangay Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They want to give their daughter a more comfortable and convenient life by providing her with a good education.

The couple helps each other in maintaining their rice field. Their main crops are rice and vegetables. But aside from farming, they also manage a hog raising business that assists them in meeting their needs. Precila would like to borrow 10,000 PHP that they can use in purchasing agricultural supplies and to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a farmer living in the rural community of Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Due to financial problems, he was not able to pursue his college education. He is married and they have three children who are in the tertiary and secondary level. His dream is to give and support the education of his children. He knows that he can do this through his hard work.

Reynaldo cultivates his farm and plants rice and vegetables twice a year. He is now applying for a loan of PHP 15,000 to finance needed farm inputs such fertilizer, seed and so on. Some of the loan will be used for the compensation of farm laborers during the tilling and cultivation process. Reynaldo hopes that his request loan be granted and also for future improvement of his business.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such fertilizer, seed and so on

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda D. is 35 years old. She is married to Manny and they have two children. They live in a rural community in Barangay Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Their eldest child is now in first year college while the youngest is a first year high school. They want them to finish their studies till college so that they will find a good job someday.

They were able to send their children to school through their income. They cultivate their rice field twice a year and their main crops are rice and vegetables. When Imelda learned about Kiva, she was encouraged to request a loan of PHP 11,000 hoping that it will be granted for it will be of great help in purchasing farm inputs like fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of their farm. She hopes that they may able to increase their production to improve their way of living.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda S. dreams to uplift the poor living conditions of her family. She is now 55-years old and married to Freddie. Their marriage has been blessed with three children. All of them are high school graduates but they could not finance their studies in college because of financial difficulties.

Farming is their source of income. They plant vegetables and corn twice a year. Leonarda is hoping to borrow 10,000 PHP as additional capital for their farm. She will use the loan to purchase needed agricultural supplies for the improvement of their crops. They also plan to engage in the hog raising business as an additional source of income. They hope that they can increase their yield with the assistance of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly and her family are living in the rural area of Barangay Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Farming is the main source of livelihood for most of the residents and they are among those. She and her husband plant rice and vegetables which they also sell as their source of income for providing for the needs of their family and paying for the education of their six children who are all in the elementary level

Beverly ventured into the vending business in order to help her husband earn an income to meet the needs of their family. She would like to borrow PHP 5,000 to be used as additional capital for the business that she just started. The loan will help her to achieve her goals for her family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita has farmed ever since her childhood and even since she got married, it is their major source of income. They plant rice and vegetables; however, their income is not enough to meet the needs of their family. Because of this, Nenita decided to engage in buying and selling charcoal. In this way, she can help her husband earn a living for their family. In line with this, she would like to borrow at least PHP 5,000 that she will use as business capital. She said that by working hard and being patient, she will be able to sustain her business for it to become progressive.

Nenita is a resident of Barangay Manamtam of Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Isidro and they were blessed with four children who are all in the elementary level. She hopes that they may send all their children to school and pay for their education through college.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en:
“Success is the fruit of sacrifice” says Fredelyn D., an electronic load retailer in the village of Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Michael and they have a three-year-old daughter named Regielyn Rose. Fredelyn believes that one must really experience pain and difficulties for life to become successful. The couple is trying to start saving something to send their child and future children to school.

The couple strives to provide a better life for their family. Engaging in the electronic load business is quite easy because Fredelyn can sell loads to her customers while taking care of their daughter and doing household chores. Her husband is planting vegetables and root crops. She started the business with a small capital and she generates a monthly income of PHP1,500. In this regard, she wants to improve and strengthen her enterprise. She now wants to borrow a loan of PHP 5,000 for her retailing business. She believes that through the financial assistance, she will become successful in her venture.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
“Success lies in our hands” shared Florence S., a hard-working mother and the wife of Jefferson S.. They live a happy and simple life in Barangay Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya with their four children. Their eldest is now in high school while three of the children are still in the elementary level.

Florence manages her buying and selling of vegetables in their village. She says she is earning an average net income of PHP 800 every week that she wisely budgets for the immediate needs and school allowances for her children. During vacation, her children also help her in the business. She hopes to increase her income to save for the education of their children. For this, she is asking for the loan amount of PHP 5,000 that will be used as business capital and for the improvement of her enterprise.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
“Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough”, says Julie S.. This is her guiding principle whenever she is in the middle of a problem or an economic crisis. She dreams of becoming successful and giving her children a better future. With the support of her husband, she has become more dedicated to her chosen business.

Charcoal production is her business. She sells it wholesale and retail to her customers. She and her husband are also engaged in farming. They plant rice and root crops. They have an average income of PHP 4,000 a month that they have to budget for the basic needs of their family and to pay for the education of their children. Julie then decided to ask for the loan amount of PHP 5,000 for her charcoal-making business. Her income from making charcoal is being used for the maintenance of their farm. Julie hopes to live a progressive life someday.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael S. is a high school graduate and he got married at the age of 19 when his wife was only 16 years old. They have a daughter named Princess. They are living in the rural village of Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. The young couple says that having a family is a lot of responsibility but they are doing their best, with the guidance of their parents.

Michael operates a passenger tricycle. With his patience and sacrifices, he is able to earn a monthly income of 2,350 PHP which is a big help to his family. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP for the maintenance of his tricycle. The money will also be used for their farming needs. He hopes that they can set up another business which will be managed by his wife for extra income.

loans.use: Tricycle Maintenance

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer M. has a sewing shop in Nablus city in Palestine. He is 39-years old, married and the father of three children. His wife looks after the household. Samer would be grateful for a loan of  $2000 US to buy a sewing machine and tailoring supplies.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Jan

texts.en:
Jan A. 30 years old, married, and lives with his own family. He is a very honest, hard working, and talented farmer. He works his own land in Jalalabad (Behsood) and has been working in the same area for more than 20 years. During this time, he has not been able to enlarge his business and make a good income for his family; they live in a rental house.

After trying his best, he bought land a month ago and needs some money to build on it. He applied for an individual loan of 30,000 Afghanis with a term of 27 months to start working on his land to build a house for his family. He hopes that after completing the house, he can be more successful in his life. He is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan and hopes that this can be a successful process in his country in the future.

loans.use: Material to build a house

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is 54 years old, married to Romeo B., a carpenter. They have six children, all married. She is a business-minded woman and aside for her snacks vending also has livestock like pigs, ducks, and chickens in her backyard.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos for livestock feed and capital for her snacks vending business. Her businesses help her add to the income of her husband and meet the financial needs of her family. She's thankful to Paglaum and Kiva partners for the assistance to her businesses.

loans.use: Livestock feed and capital for snack vending business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa lives in Nilabo, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is on her second cycle now on her loan request. Her husband is a coconut toddy gatherer and sometimes works odd jobs just to earn an income. Marissa has her own grocery store. She is requesting the loan amount of 4,500 Philippine Pesos for the purchase of additional stocks such as goodies, noodles, sacks of rice, and many other things.

She is hoping that someday they can augment their income and send all their children to college.

loans.use: Sari-sari (grocery) store inventory

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Mrs. Flordeliza T., is 42 years of age and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with four children. She has a store selling banana fruits both cooked and raw. She can gain more income from “Ginanggang” (the Visayan term for toasted banana).

She’s been a good member for years of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has already availed herself of several loans. Now, she is requesting a loan of 14,900 Philippine Pesos to buy additional bananas and other stuff to sell. She dreams that all her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy bananas and other items for resale

loans.name: Melpora

texts.en: Melpora  B. is a 4 year member of PMPC residing at Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is requesting a loan of 14,000 Philippine Pesos intended for use as additional capital for her sari-sari store. Mrs. Melpora B. is a traditional midwife, her patients are from her village and from other neighboring barangays. This is her activity aside from running the sari-sari store. She is struggling to earn more income just to make a living. This is her 7th loan cycle and she's praying to God that with the help of this loan she will make her business grow and it will become a grocery store someday.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled A. is 42 years old. He is married and the father of 5 children. He manages a grocery store where he sells bread, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods.  In order to expand the variety of goods that are sold in the store, Khaled is requesting a loan of US $1,200. Khaled is very grateful to everyone who will help him achieve business success with this loan.

loans.use: Increase variety of inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one child. She sells women's shoes at the central market in the city of Melitopol. Her profit is 3,000 UAH per month.

Svetlana has been in this business for 13 years and enjoys selling this type of goods. She chooses each model she sells individually and offers her clients only the best goods at reasonable prices. Her kiosk is located at a good place in the market, which also helps Svetlana to have many clients.

Svetlana would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She would spend additional income to purchase some home equipment for her family needs.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of women's shoes

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married. She sells men's clothing at Yulana market in Pavlograd city. She has been in this business for 15 years. Her average monthly profit is 3,000 UAH. Olga would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to purchase men's sweaters for the spring season. This would help her to have a better assortment and attract more clients.

Olga's husband had several surgeries recently and now needs time and money to recover. The loan would help Olga to make additional profit and cover at least part of the recovery expenses.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is divorced and lives with her son. She sells food at the market in the city of Stryi and has been in this business for nine years. Good prices and location help her to win her clients.

There are many various celebrations in the spring in Ukraine and people spend more money on food. Lubov needs to increase her inventory and to do this she would like to get a loan of 6,500 UAH.

Additional income would help Lubov to pay her winter utility bills. Lubov's goal in life is to help her son to start off in life.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of food

loans.name: Abduhakim

texts.ru: Бизнес Абдухакима продолжает свое развитие. Также как и раньше он приобретает товар на оптовых рынках, а затем продает. Абдухаким на прибыль, полученную от своего бизнеса приобрел телевизор для своего дома. Он считает что если хорошо поработать то можно всего добиться. Сейчас он планирует получить новый займ и собирается приобрести новый ассортимент товаров для своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Abduhakim's business continues to grow. Just as before, he purchases goods from wholesale markets for resale. With his profit Abduhakim was able to purchase a TV for his home. He believes that those who work hard can achieve everything. Now, he plans to receive a new loan and purchase a new range of goods for his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For Business Expansion

loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.en:
Anatoliy is married. He runs a small business - owns a little shop where he offers his services as a car electrician. He has been in this business for 20 years. He does his job well, so people come back when they have new problems. Thus Anatoliy has many repeat clients and a stable income source.

In his business, Anatoliy uses special equipment that helps him to do diagnostics and repair. Anatoliy would like to borrow 13,800 UAH to purchase additional equipment. This would allow him to increase the number of services that he offers to his clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment

loans.name: Shakhnoza

texts.ru: Вместе с матерью Шахноза продолжает заниматься предпринимательством. После получения прошлого займа она как и планировала приобрела довольно много товара и получила хорошую прибыль. Сейчас она подала новую заявку и планирует и дальше развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Together with her mother, Shakhnoza continues to do business. After receiving her last loan, she purchased a lot of goods, as was planned. She received good profit. Currently, she completed an application for a new loan and she plans to further develop her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ля расширения бизнеса

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one son. She sells food at a market that is located close to a railway station. She has been in this business for 12 years. Her income is 3,500 UAH per month.

Svetlana is a very open, enthusiastic and responsible person. She has used Hope loans several times and always paid them back on time. She says that the loans help her to generate additional income. Svetlana takes care of her elderly parents and helps them with what they need.

Svetlana would like to obtain a loan of 8,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to sell more and generate additional income.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of food items

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru:
Толиб работает преподавателем в средней школе. Ему 53 года, женат, трое детей. Так как со здоровьем у Толиба в последнее время стало хуже, он стал меньше преподавать. Его старший сын работает на заработках в России и присылает на содержание семьи денег. Но чтобы прожить нормально Толиб решил завести домашний скот и на деньги, вырученные от откорма скота содержать семью. Постепенно поголовье скота увеличивается, а вместе с ним и доход. С МикроИнвест он сотрудничает больше года и получил 2 раза кредит. Сейчас услышав о КИВА он решил подать заявку и планирует приобрести бычка и корм для него. 
(на фото дочь Толиба)
texts.en:
Tolib works as a high school teacher. He is 53 years old, married, and has three children. Tolib’s health has recently declined, and so he has been teaching less. His elder son works in Russia and sends the family money. In order to afford a normal life, Tolib has decided to buy livestock and support his family on the money he earns from fattening cattle. Gradually, as the herd increases, so will the income it brings in. He has been working with MicroInvest for more than a year and has received loans twice. Now that he’s heard about Кiva, he has decided to apply for another loan and plans to buy a calf and feed. (The photo is of Tolib’s daughter.)

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Khusrav

texts.ru:
Хусрав молодой парень 33 лет, женат и имеет 1 ребенка. Жена сидит дома и смотрит за ребенком. Хусрав имеет профессию строителя и поэтому постоянно работает. Так как жена дома имеет достаточно свободного времени Хусрав решил получить займ и приобрести домашний скот. Это и дополнительное питание для семьи, и доход дополнительный если скот перепродать с наценкой. Сейчас Хусрав планирует приобрести бычка и корм и поэтому подал заявку на займ на КИВА.
(на фото жена Хусрава).
texts.en:
Khusrav is a young, 33-year old man. He is married with one child. Khusrav's wife is a stay-at-home mom. Khusrav is a construction worker by training and he is constantly working. Since his wife is a homemaker, she has quite a lot of free time. This would help support the family. Khusrav decided to apply for a Kiva loan in order to purchase a bull calf and fodder. The photo features Khusrav's wife.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf and fodder

loans.name: Rieziddin

texts.ru:
Риезиддин работает в школе преподавателем. Он женат, ему 35 лет, имеет 3 детей. Семья большая и на заработок преподавателя нормально не прожить. У Риезиддина есть немного арендованной земли, где он каждый год сеет различные хозяйственные культуры. Это также приносит ему корм для скота, которого у него несколько голов. Содержание скота приносит в семью дополнительный доход. Риезиддин подал заявку на КИВА и планирует приобрести корову с теленком.
(на фото жена Риёзиддина)
texts.en:
Rieziddin is a school teacher. He is 35 years old and is married with three children. A teacher's salary is not enough to support his large family. Rieziddin rents a plot of land for farming. This helps him secure fodder for the cattle. Cattle breeding is another source of income. Rieziddin has applied for a Kiva loan because he would like to purchase a cow and a bull calf. The photo features Rieziddin's wife.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a bull calf

loans.name: Suduridin

texts.ru: Судуриддину 30 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. Работает в колхозе. Дополнительно к своему заработку в колхозе занимается откормом скота в этом ему помогает его жена. У Судуриддина дома несколько коров и баранов. Условия для содержания скота у Судуриддина имеются и поэтому он решил подать заявку на займ и прикупить еще 2 бычков.
texts.en:
Suduridin is thirty years old, married, and has four children. He works on a collective farm. To add to what he earns on the collective farm, he works fattening cattle. His wife (pictured) helps him in this. At Suduridin’s home, he has some cows and rams. Suduridin is able to maintain the cattle, and consequently he has decided apply for a loan to buy two more calves.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Sharof

texts.ru: Шароф несмотря на свои 66 лет все еще занимается бизнесом – он откармливает скот у себя дома. Сейчас у него несколько коров и баранов. Раз в неделю он  выходит на базар и покупает там скотину, а потом, откормив несколько недель, продает. Старшие сыновья шарофа также ему помогают.  Шароф кредитуется в МикроИнвест уже 2 года и сейчас решил получить новый займ и собирается купить корм.
texts.en:
Regardless of the fact that he is 66 years old, Sharof is still active in his business - buying, feeding livestock until it reaches optimum weight, and reselling it. Currently, he has a few sheep and cows. Once a week, he goes to the market, purchases livestock, and resells it several weeks later. Sharof's elder sons help him with his business. Sharof has been a client of MicroInvest for the last 2 years. He decided to obtain a new loan to purchase feed for his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for livestock

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Джуре 42 года, женат и имеет 5 детей. Джура нигде не работает и занимается предпринимательством. Он продает различные мелкие электротовары: розетки, выключатели, электропровода и тп. Кроме этого в его ассортименте запасные части для велосипедов. Все эти товары пользуются хорошим спросом и приносят хорошую прибыль. Дополнительно к этому Джура у себя дома занимается ремонтом велосипедов и электродвижков. Джура хочет получить займ и планирует закупить запасные части к велосипедам.
texts.en:
Jura is 42 years old. He is married with 5 children. Jura is officially unemployed but he works as an entrepreneur. He sells small electrical appliances: wires, switches, plugs, etc. In addition, he sells spare parts for bikes. All these goods are in demand and bring profit. Jura also repairs bikes and electic engines. Now he would like to obtain a loan and purchase more spare parts for bicycles.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо и ее муж нигде не работают и вот уже несколько лет занимаются выращиванием декоративных кустарников и саженцев елок и сосны. Свой приусадебный участок они превратили в своего рода питомник и каждый год весной продают готовые кустарники и саженцы и на это семья живет в течении года. Дополнительно выращивают скот. Мархабо 30 лет. имеет 3 детей. Мархабо подала заявку на КИВА и собирается купить корм для скота.
texts.en:
Marhabo and her husband are unemployed and for the past few years have grown decorative shrubs and pine and conifer saplings. They turned their land plot into a nursery and every spring sell ready-to-plant shrubs and saplings, which supports their family for the year. They also raise livestock. Marhabo is 39 years old and has three children. She applied for a loan from Kiva which she plans to use to buy feed for the animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For livestock feed purchase

loans.name: Olima

texts.ru: Олима и ее муж работают на Канибадамском асфальтном заводе. Хотя работа тяжелая и отнимает массу сил, оплачивается она по меркам региона очень хорошо. Рабочий день начинается рано утром и продолжается до вечера. Но чтобы покрыть все возрастающие расходы семьи Олиме и ее мужу приходится держать домашний скот. Это приносит хорошую прибыль. Олиме 42 года, имеет троих детей. Олима решила подать заявку на займ КИВА и планирует закупить корм для скота.
texts.en:
Olima and her husband work in the Kanibadam asphalt factory. The work day begins early in the morning and continues until evening. Still, to meet the growing needs of the family, Olima and her husband must keep domestic livestock. They bring a good profit. Olima is 42 years old and has three children. She decided to apply for a loan from Kiva to purchase livestock feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feed purchase

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Муж Мавчуды находится на заработках в России и присылает свой заработок на содержание семьи. чтобы не сидеть дома без дела Мавчуда шьет национальные таджикские одеяла – курпачи, а также по заказу национальные платья. У нее есть несколько швейных машинок и поэтому она дополнительно взяла к себе в ученицы двоих соседских девочек. Каждый день с утра до вечера Мавчуда и ее ученицы шьют, а потом по выходным выносят на базар и продают. Мавчуде 43 года. Сейчас она собирается приобрести немного ткани для своего бизнеса, и поэтому подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Mavchuda’s husband is working in Russia and sending home his earnings to support his family. To keep from sitting at home, Mavchuda sews national Tadjik blankets (called kurpachs) and, by special order, folk dresses. She has several sewing machines and, consequently, she has taken on two of the neighbor’s girls as apprentices. Every day from morning until evening Mavchuda and her apprentices sew, and then on weekends, they take their goods to the market to sell. Mavchuda is 43 years old. Now, she wants to buy some fabric for her business and therefore has applied to Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Adil

texts.ru: Бизнес Адила заключается в купле продаже и переработке сухофруктов. Он едет на рынки где закупает сухофрукты оптом. Потом привозит домой и с помощью семьи перерабатывает их, сортирует и затем выносит на следующий базар. Прибыль небольшая, но стабильная. Адилу 48 лет, он женат и имеет 5 детей. Для бизнеса Адила сейчас благоприятное время, так как цены на закупаемые им сухофрукты немного упали, и он собирается закупить их оптом. Для этого он подал заявку на займ КИВА.
texts.en:
Adil's business consists of the buying, selling, and reprocessing of dried fruit. He goes to the market to buy dried fruit wholesale, then takes it home where his family helps to sort it before he takes it to the next market. The profit is small but reliable. Adil is 48 years old, married, and has five children. This is a good time for the business, since prices of the dried fruit he buys have fallen a bit, and he plans to buy it wholesale. He applied to Kiva for a loan to help with the purchase.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dried fruit

loans.name: Kamol

texts.ru: Камол работает частным строителем. Недавно ему исполнилось 50 лет, он женат. По меркам региона, где он проживае,т он считается многодетным отцом, так как у него 5 детей. Старшие закончили школу и уже зарабатывают. Семья большая и поэтому дополнительно камол занимается куплей продажей скота на рынках. Ему помогает его старший сын. Если не получается продать скот на рынке Камол приводит его домой и в течении недели смотрит за ним. На следующем рынке он продает а прибыль тратит на семью. Камол подал заявку на КИВА и собирается немного расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Kamol is a private construction worker. He has recently turned fifty. Kamol is married with 5 children. By the standards of his region, he has many children. His elder children already finished school and earn their own living. To support his large family, Kamol sells cattle, and his eldest helps him do that. If Kamol does not manage to sell the cattle at the market, he brings it home and tends to it for about a week before he takes it to another market. The profit from cattle sales goes to support the family. Kamol applied for a Kiva loan in order to be able to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Азизахон уже несколько лет занимается предпринимательством. Постоянной торговой точки у нее нету и она ездит по разным базарам и там торгует. Азизахон 32 года, муж в России на заработках, имеет 4 детей. Ассортимент товаров Азизахон включает в себя парфюмерную продукцию и мелкую бижутерию. Капитал бизнеса небольшой но расходы семьи за счет прибыли покрывает. Азизахон планирует немного расширить ассортимент товаров и поэтому решила подать заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Azizahon has been an entrepreneur for several years. She does not have a permanent vending point, which makes her travel to different markets. Azizahon is 32 years old and is a mother of four. Her husband works in Russia. Azizahon sells perfumes and bijou, which helps cover the family's expenditures. Azizahon plans to expand the variety of goods she sells and is applying for a Kiva loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand the variety of goods

loans.name: Kotien B.

texts.fr: A. est une dame qui habite le quartier de hedzranawoè; elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle a pour activité la vente de céréales, elle exerce cette activité devant sa maison, actuellement son stock est épuisé, elle a déja obtenu un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit pour rehausser son stock et mieux vendre.
texts.en:
A. is a lady who lives in the Hedzranawoè district. She is married and the mother of four. Her business involves selling grains. She operates in front of her house. Currently, her inventory is exhausted. She has obtained a loan that she has repaid. She's requesting a second loan to replenish her inventory and to do better in her sales.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, millet, corn, and cassava flour

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: ce monsieur est un enseignant, il est marié et père d’un enfant, le revenu de sa profession ne lui permet pas de prendre en charge sa famille, il a alors commencé en 2005  la vente de produits congelés, actuellement ce commerce marche bien pour lui et il ne peut satisfaire ses clients avec le stock dont il dispose, raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 cartons de produits congelés.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a teacher. He is married and the father of a child. The income from his profession doesn't allow him to provide for his family. So he started selling frozen goods in 2005. Currently, this business is going well for him. But with the inventory he has, he can't satisfy his customers. This is why he's requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy twenty boxes of frozen goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy frozen goods

loans.name: Suma Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Suma Sartawi” forma parte de la familia de  Pro-Mujer, esta  se encuentra en la zona de Villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con doce miembros que  han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar. El comercio es la actividad principal de la asociación Suma Sartawi,  por ejemplo Asencia vende variedad de golosinas, Esperanza se dedica a la venta de mantas tejidas, Lidia vende abarrotes, todos en general adquieren productos de mayoristas para luego venderlos al detalle. Quieren invertir capital para realizar estas compras al por mayor para mejorar sus ganancias y cumplir con las obligaciones que todos tienen con sus familias
texts.en:
The group "Suma Sartawi" is part of the Pro-Mujer family. It is located in the Villa Exaltacion area in the city of El Alto. To date, it has twelve members who have proven to be an organized group in their credit assessments and their internal activities. Most members of the group are married with children, nearly all them school-age. The main activity of the association Sum Sartawi is trade. For example, Asencia sells a variety of sweets, Experanza is dedicated to the sale of woven blankets and Lidia sells groceries. All of them generally purchase products wholesale and then re-sell them. They want to invest capital for these wholesale purchases to improve their earnings and meet all the obligations they have to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase products wholesale

loans.name: Flor De Tani Tani Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Senkata, a este pertenece la asociación “Flor de Tani Tani”, formada por trece miembros.
Un grupo muy alegre que  junto  a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con mucha responsabilidad.
La mayoría en el grupo son casados y con familias numerosas. Diferentes son las actividades de este grupo; algunas venden comida, otras realizan tejidos a mano de chompas y mantas, también preparan  fibra de alpaca para luego venderla solamente a pedido. 
Solicitan mayores créditos con el fin de ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan comprar materia prima, con esto mejorarían sus ingresos, con el único de objetivo de mejorar el estilo de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Flor de Tani Tani" group is made up of thirteen members and is part of the focal center Senkata, located in the city of El Alto. This is a very happy group that together with its loan assistant, works with a lot of responsibility. Most members of the group are married with large families. The group members engage in different activities. Some sell food, others make hand-woven sweaters and blankets, others prepare alpaca fiber that is later sold only by order. The group is requesting more loans in order to expand their sales. In order to do this, they need to buy raw material. This will allow them to improve their income as their single goal is to improve the lifestyle of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for their various businesses.

loans.name: 01-Sơn Vạn Group

texts.en:
Chung N. Thị is a 44 years-old-woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Chung is the leader of a five member group accessing a loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 1 Son Van (16.05.001).




Chung is married and has two  school-age children. To make a living, Chung owns and operates a business venture in in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising livestock. Chung has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities




In 2004, Chung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (TCVM) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and her ability to engage in business activities. Chung has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,442,600 VND from TCVM. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from TCVM. Chung plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.





About the Other Borrowers in the Group:




1.  H. Thị Dung (48) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.




2.  T. Thị Lệ (49) is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.




3.  N. Thị Sáu (1) is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.




4.  N. Thị Hiếu (4) is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.




About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.




Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.




Chung N. Thị (30) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Chung là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 1 Sơn Vạn (16.05.01).




Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Chung thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Chung kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Chung đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Chung đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.442.600 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.079.800 VND.




Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.




Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:




1.  H. Thị Dụng (48) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.




2.  T. Thị Lệ (49) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.




3.  N. Thị Sáu (1) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.




4.  N. Thị Hiếu (4) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.




Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:


Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.




*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: 05-Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
"Lĩnh Vũ Thị (45) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Lĩnh is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 05-Đông Sơn (10.15.05).

Lĩnh is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lĩnh owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a business making mosquito nets. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and mosquito-net making services to local community members. Lĩnh has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lĩnh joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lĩnh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,626,900 VND which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.
