Lĩnh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Lê Thị H. Hạnh (46) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,900 VND loan to support her photocopying business.

2. Lê M. Hương (48) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. H. Thị Định (49) is a 61-year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. N. Thị V. Anh (51) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5. T. Thị Ngọc (47) is a 61-year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,900 VND loan to support her business in buying and reselling cell phones and sim cards.


About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


************************************************************

Lĩnh Vũ Thị (45) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Lĩnh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 05-Đông Sơn (10.15.05).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá màn ngủ thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Lĩnh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Lĩnh kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. Vào 2008, Lĩnh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Lĩnh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vải & vật liệu bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1.626.900 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Lê Thị H. Hạnh (46) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là đầu tư vào cửa hàng photocopy.

2. Lê M. Hương (48) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. H. Thị Định (49) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. N. Thị V. Anh (51) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5. T. Thị Ngọc (47) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ sim thẻ điện thoại.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva."

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta B. is a rice farmer. She is 42 years old and has two children. She dreams of having a bigger farm someday. She would like to grow her business to help keep her family together and meet all their needs. Her husband, Edgardo B., is planning to work in Manila, the capital city of the Philippines. She thinks that if her business flourishes, her husband would no longer need to leave to earn a living.

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will help her improve the fertility of her farm. This in turn will lead to a better harvest.

CEVI is helping Julieta and the rest of the farmers to sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides access to those who want to start a business. It provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. manages a small rice field. She is married and has three children. Aside from farming, Ofelia also supplements her income by making dresses. She is a seamstress and people come to her to have nice dresses made.

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and chemicals to be used on her farm. The loan will truly help her and the whole family have a better, bigger yield. Ofelia's harvests are intended for family consumption; the remainder is sold in the market for additional income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and the first Filipino MFI partner to go active with Kiva micro-funds. CEVI provides access to people who wants to start a business. CEVI offers not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora P. owns a small rice farm in their village. She is 43 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer since she was a child. She married a farmer, Abner P., and they have been together for 20 years already.

She seeks a loan from CEVI to buy good quality rice seeds and other farm necessities. The loan will truly help increase her yield. Hence, she could better support her children, especially in paying the tuition for school.

CEVI helps people start and have their own business. it offers not just loans to all its clients but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie A. has spent her whole life mostly on the farm. Her parents are farmers, and they taught her the whole process of how to farm. She is 53 years old, married and has six children. She doesn't want to just stay in the house. She wanted to contribute something for the family income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds. The loan will go a long way toward sustaining her farm business. She thinks that the loan will bring her good returns for her business.

CEVI is reaching out to more farmers to start and have their own livelihoods. It offers not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo M. has a small piggery in her backyard. She is a 48-year-old, hard-working mother of six children who has been married for 24 years already. She was a caretaker of a school canteen before and received only Php 1,000 salary for her service. She had in mind having her own business and started her piggery with two pigs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy additional piglets and pig feed. The loan will help grow her business even more. She believes that by having more pigs, she will earn more income.

She has been a CEVI client for a long time. She receives not just loans but also training and insurance-coverage services as well.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru:
Бахром уже несколько лет в сфере бизнеса. Раньше он занимался куплей продажей сухофруктов. Постепенно накопив денег он открыл свою мини столовую (так как он имеет также профессию повара), которая расположена в центральном рынке. Здесь у него имеются постоянные клиенты, которые торгуют на рынке. Кроме блюд, которые предлагаются у него в столовой, он также привозит различные кондитерские изделия: булочки, торты, пирожные, пряники и тп. Многие его клиенты кроме горячих блюд заказывают в качестве десерта эти кондитерские изделия. 
Бахрому исполнилось 38 лет, женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена его сидит дома и воспитывает ребенка. Дополнительно к своему основному бизнесу Бахром занимается откормом скота и в этом ему помогает его жена. Для этой цели год назад Бахром стал кредитоваться  МикроИнвест и показал себя ответственным и пунктуальным клиентом. Сейчас он подал заявку на займ и собирается приобрести одного бычка и немного корма для него.
texts.en:
Bahrom has been working in the business sphere for several years. He used to sell dried fruit but, having gradually saved money, he opened a mini-canteen, located at the central market. Bahrom is also a cook by training. He has regular customers among the local vendors. In addition to the dishes offered in his canteen, Bahrom sells pastry: buns, cakes, ginger cookies, etc. Many of his clients, in addition to hot dishes, order dessert. Bahrom is 38 years old and is married with one child. His wife is a stay-at-home mom. Besides his main business, with the help of his wife Bahrom raises cattle. A year ago Bahrom got a Microinvest loan for this purpose, and got a reputation of a responsible and punctual client. He has recently submitted an application for another loan, which he is going to use for the purchase of a bull calf and fodder.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf and fodder

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria P. is engaged in the hog-raising business. She likes pigs a lot. She enjoys having pigs in her backyard, which is why she raised three pigs. Later, she found out that the piggery is a very good business. She started doubling the size of her piggery. Now she wants to grow it even more to help her husband earn a living.

She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy feed for all her pigs. The loan will help increase her income and will enable her to pay for the needs of her three children.

CEVI is reaching out to more hog growers like Gloria to sustain their livelihood. CEVI offers not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Abdufozil

texts.ru: Абдуфозил работает в колхозе рядовым колхозником. Заработную плату там платят не деньгами а продуктами питания: пшеницей, рисом, растительным маслом и тп. Ему 32 года, женат и имеет 3 детей. Жена нигде не работает и поэтому, чтобы занять ее, Абдуфозил держит дома домашний скот. Раз в месяц он выводит на базар и продает одну голову скота и потом там же покупает нового бычка. Жена смотрит за ним и потом опять продают, на прибыль и живут. Абдуфозил кредитуется в МикроИнвест больше года, и сейчас подал заявку на получение займа и собирается купить бычка и корм.
texts.en:
Abdufozil is a regular employee of a collective farm. The salary is not paid in money but in groceries: wheat, rice, oil, etc. Abdufozil is 32 years olf and is married with 3 children. His wife does not work. Therefore, to find her an occupation, Abdufozil keeps cattle. Once a month he sells one bull and buys a bull calf. His wife tends to the cattle. The profit from this business helps them make ends meet. Abdufozil has been a MicroInvest client for over a year. He has submitted another application for a loan in order to buy a bull calf and fodder.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf and fodder

loans.name: Rozik

texts.ru: Розик имеет 5 детей, женат. Работает в дехканском хозяйстве, жена нигде не работает. Кроме основной работы, заработок с которой не большой Розик занимается откормом скота. Так как у него очень хорошие условия для содержания скота. За скотиной смотрит его жена и старшие дети. Розик собирается увеличить поголовье скота, и поэтому подал заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Rozik is married with five children. He is a farmer and his wife is unemployed. In addition to his regular job, which does not pay much, Rozik raises cattle. He has good conditions for this kind of work. His wife and elder children tend to the cattle. Rozik is applying for a loan in order to increase the number of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim V., 39, has been a local farmer for years. Besides his farm work, he catches fishes in and around Tunle Sap Lake for his wife to sell at the market. V. is married with six children, one of whom is married and lives separately. To help meet with the family's daily expenses, one of V.'s sons works as a construction worker.

Mr. V. is looking for a loan to buy a pump to irrigate his crops and proposes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase a boat machine for his fishing business.

loans.use: To buy a pump to irrigate his crops

loans.name: Siroch

texts.ru: Сироч имеет 2 группу инвалидности по состоянию здоровья – у него больное сердце. Уже несколько лет нигде не работает и получает пенсию по инвалидности 40 сомони ($10). Жена тоже нигде не работает и сидит дома. Чтобы прокормить семью супруги занимаются откормом скота. Сирочу 42 года, имеет 4 детей. Сироч выходит на рынки и если попадается дешевый скот, то покупает и приводит домой. В течении нескольких недель откармливают, а затем продают. Сироч собирается увеличить поголовье скота, и поэтому подал заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Siroch has a second degree disability due to his health - he has heart problems. He does not work anywhere for several years and receives a pension for disability of 40 somoni ($10). His wife also does not work anywhere and stays at home. To support the family they feed cattle. Siroch is 42 years old, he has four children. He goes out to the markets and if he finds cheap cattle he buys it and bring it home. Then they feed it for several weeks and resell it. Siroch wants to increase the head count of cattle and this is why he applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en:
Chhen S. was born in 1973 and is married with three children: one is married and lives independently and the others are single. One of her daughters is a sewing worker in a garment factory.

Mrs. S. and her husband make their daily income by selling fish in the local market. They normally sell fish that they buy from a wholesale market far from their house. Because the family's business is profitable and is growing, S. is requesting a loan of $600 to use as capital in the business operation and to decorate her house.

loans.use: To use as capital in the business operation

loans.name: Hatima

texts.ru: Хатима– женщина 57 лет. Замужем, имеет одного ребёнка. Занимается откормом и купля-продажей скота. У нее небольшое помещение, где она держит двух телят и несколько овец.Её муж таксист. Он тоже зарабатывает неплохо. Но все равно они хотели бы расширить свой бизнес и получать больше прибыли для того чтобы обучать своих детей в Университете.На полученный кредит она хочет купить дойную корову.
texts.en:
Hatima is 57 years and is married with one child. She works in cattle farming. She has a small room where she keeps two bull calves and several sheep. Her husband is a taxi driver. He also has a good income but they would still like to expand their business and have more profit, so that their children can go to college. For now, they would like to use the loan for the purchase of a milk cow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle farming

loans.name: Hasanjon

texts.ru: Хасанжон - мужчина 44 лет. Женат, имеет пятерых детей. Хасанжон занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота. Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена занимается переработкой молока, сметаны и продает ее на рынке, и еще помогает по хозяйству дома. Этим она помогает мужу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Хасанжон в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота и рад, что кредитуется у нас.
texts.en:
Hasanjon is a 44-year-old man. He is married and has five children. Hasanjon raises and sells large- and small-horned cattle. He purchases cattle at the market and, after feeding them for two to three months, sells them at the same market. His wife processes the milk and cream, and sells them at the market. She also helps out at home on the farm, assisting her husband so that their financial situation might improve. Hasanjon, in turn, wants to increase the size of his herd and is pleased to be a loan customer of MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and trading cattle

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
This medium-size shop located in Phnom Penh City belongs to Mrs. S., who provides a beauty-salon service to the neighbors. In the business, she can make an income of approximately of $4 a day to manage her family's daily needs. She is a widowed mother who cares for three children, who are all single and attend school.

S.'s investment has been running for a long time but the business still needs equipment. S. would like a $500 loan to purchase additional hairdressing tools for her beauty-salon service.

loans.use: To purchase additional hairdressing tools

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna T. manages a small piggery business. She is 36 years old, married and has four children. Her husband abandoned them when her children were still small. She is the one working to feed and clothe her family well.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. The loan will help her family grow its business even more. Raising more pigs will make her earn a lot of pesos to support their needs.

CEVI is reaching out to more women to help them start and have their own businesses. CEVI offers not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To piurchase feed for pigs

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: Рахмон- мужчина 51 лет. Женат и имеет 3-х детей. Рахмон занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Рахмон кредитуется уже больше 1 года. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было очень малое количество скота. Сейчас у него большое количество мелко рогатого скота. Сейчас у его жены только одна дойная корова. Рахмон планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Rahmon is 51 years old. He is married with 3 children. Rahmon rears and sells livestock and his wife processes and sells milk. Rahmon has been receiving loans for over 1 year. When he came to ask for his first loan, he had very few animals. Currently, he has several small cattle. His wife has only 1 milking cow. Rahmon plans to buy another milking cow with a calf for his wife. He is thankful to those providing loans for making his dreams come true.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing and sale of cattle

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Leilila G. manages 2 hectare of land. She is a 58-year-old, hard-working mother of six children. Her husband, Dionito G., is helping her manage the farm to feed and clothe their family well. She dreams of having more land to farm someday. She also wants to send all her children to school.

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to increase her yield. In addition to that, she is also interested in venturing into another line of business to augment their income.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to start and have their own livelihoods. CEVI offers not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Faroghat

texts.ru: Фарогат Алиева – женщина 38 лет. Замужем, имеет  2-х детей. Занимается продажей мужской одежды на вещевом рынке Спитаменского района. Фарогат закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан.  Она хотела бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента.Её муж и дети помогают ей по бизнесу.
texts.en:
Faroghat A. is 38 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She sells men's clothing at a market located in Spitamensky district. Faroghat purchases goods wholesale at the Istarvshan city market. She would like to expand the assortment of her goods, because a large assortment attracts more customers. She would like to receive a loan to expand her business. Her husband and children help in her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of winter clothes

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia A. manages a piggery business. She raises six pigs and two sows in the back of her house. At first she faced a lot of challenges to sustain her business. Thanks to CEVI, who partnered with her in managing the finances of her piggery, she has.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. The loan will help Ofelia grow her business.

CEVI is reaching out to more people to start and have their own businesses. It provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feeds

loans.name: Badriah

texts.en:
Badriah is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Badriah has been selling clothes from her house since 1999. Badriah requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase merchandise for her work. Badriah has been a micro-credit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

Her previous loans helped her improve her work by diversifying her merchandise as well as improving her financial situation. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulty. Badriah decided on doing her business because of her financial need. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: Badriah will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her work

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Ali has owned a grocery store since 1996. He requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him diversify his merchandise.

Ali is special in his work because he has a big variety of products. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Achraf

texts.en:
Achraf is a 27-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Achraf owns a grocery store. He requested a loan of 3000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store like ice cream and a refrigerator for it, especially since summer is coming. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

Achraf's previous loan helped him diversify his merchandise. Achraf is special in his work because he has a big variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store and a refridgerator

loans.name: Abed Allah

texts.en:
Abed Allah is a 43-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Abed Allah has been selling used furniture since 1992. Abed Allah requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. Abed Allah has been a micro-credit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Abed Allah decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his shop.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 38-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Abdallah has owned a bakery since 2003. He makes “mankoucheh.” A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza and the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Abdallah requested a loan of $1,300 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. Abdallah has been a micro-credit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Abdallah decided on doing his business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his shop.

loans.use: Abdallah will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 19 year old man who lives with his wife in Borj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Ali has been working as a fisherman since 2006. He also sells his fish.

Ali requested a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulty. He decided on starting his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work

loans.name: Shelah Group

texts.en:
Shelah is the group leader of Shelah group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for her/his business. The total of their group loan is 40000 Afghani.

Kamalah wants to take a loan for her sewing business. She wants a new machine for her business. Shelah wants to take a loan for her business of embroidery. She wants to buy necessary materials for her business. And Hasena wants to take a loan for bead work. She wants buy necessary materials for her business. Amena wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to expand her business. 

 With this loan they can make their businesses bigger and support their families and make a better future for themselves and for their families in future.

loans.use: expand their businesses and buy necesssary materials

loans.name: Shahpary

texts.en: Shahpary is the daughter of A. R.. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan,  and she has four children. And she has got a business tailoring and doing embroidery and she wants to make her business bigger. So she requested an individual loan of 42000 Afghani for a term of 18 months. She would like to say that the loan process is the best because it can support those who really need money for business expansion and want to have a good future.

loans.use: for expanding business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. S. and her family live in a small wooden house located in a rural area of Phnom Penh City. S., 33, helps provide for her two children by working as a garment worker. Two of her children are still single and live in the family home. She is married to Phally, 44, who earns a living as a motor-taxi driver.

The entire family's living conditions are not comfortable because their house too old and small for them. Because of this obstacle, S. has decided to requests a loan on Kiva to be used to repair her old house. (Mrs. S.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Anefa Group

texts.en: Anefa is the group leader of Anefa group. There are two members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for the progress of their business. Anefa wants to take a loan for her bakery. Mashda wants to take a loan for her brother who has a general store and Mashda's brother wants to expand his business and buy more materials, especially the things that are most in demand. They want to take a loan of about 28000 Afghani for a term of 10 months. They thank AFS and Kiva who can support all the world.

loans.use: to improve their businesses

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Mgeni has been a fish and bites seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm.  


She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish, wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and other food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Mgeni is 45 years old, married, and has three children. They are 20, 15 and 9 years old. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Zainab and Sauda. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more fish, wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and other food items.

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers, all of whom live in Khmounh Commune in Phnom Penh City. The group leader, Mrs. P. N., 35, has been a sewing worker in the garment factory for years. For that, she can earn a specific salary of $90 a month. The income she receives helps feed the family a little food and makes sure her two teenage children receive the highest education. To help the family's expenses more sufficiently, her husband drives a motorcycle taxi for income. Recently, the existing motorbike frequently has broken. That means Mrs. N.'s husband can't earn as much income as before. To solve the problem, N. is applying for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one. The others two borrowers are:
V., 40, who is a local tailor, requesting a loan to buy a motor for her family's riding needs.
C. is looking for a loan to purchase a sewing machine to support the tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Khouder

texts.en:
Khouder is a 19-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon. Khouder owns a barber shop. Khouder requested a loan of 700 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his salon. This is the first time that Khouder has requested a loan.

Khouder is speciA. in his work because he does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Khouder decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his salon.

loans.use: purchase tools for his salon

loans.name: 5 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en: Chuyền

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Raeed

texts.en:
Raeed is a 39-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon, with his wife. Raeed owns a barber shop. Raeed requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his salon. Raeed has been a micro-credit client for nine years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work as well as his financiA. situation. Raeed is speciA. in his work because he does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Raeed decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his salon.

loans.use: purchase tools for his salon

loans.name: Kalina

texts.en:
Kalina D. sells designed bedsheets and requests a loan to open up a shop. Kalina is 39 years old and is married to a business man who sells electronic goods at Konyokonyo market. She has 3 children who all attend school. In the future, Kalina wants to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 34 years old and lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He owns a barber's shop where he serves friends, neighbours and others. He is successful in his work because he does a good job and has experience. In the future, he plans on improving his salon.

Ali requested a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools and a new seat for his salon. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase tools and a new seat for his salon

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 50-year-old man who lives in Tripoli in northern Lebanon. Rabih has owned a coffee shop for two years. He requested a loan of $1,500 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and a coffee machine for his shop. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work and change the décor of his salon. Rabih is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his shop. Rabih decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his income. In the future, he plans on expanding his coffee shop.

loans.use: Rabih will use the loan to purchase merchandise and a coffee machine for his shop

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 35-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, a city in northern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Houssam has owned an electricA. shop for nineteen years. He is requesting a loan of $1000 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business. Houssam has been a microcredit client for eight years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his shop by diversifying his merchandise. His clients can be anybody from his region. Houssam decided on starting his business because he wanted to work independently, and he opened it without difficulty. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Houssam will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has been a clothes seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to the Shukrani group loan (Group code 2025). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day, she works at her business from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bedsheets, khanga and other types of clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fatma is 35 years old, married, and has three children: ages 16, 15 and 12.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets, khanga and other type of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida has owned a small charcoal and firewood store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to the Salmina group loan (Group code 2019). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day, she works at her business from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Saida is 35 years old, married, and has three children: ages 12, 11 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Roque C. raises pigs for a living. He is 50 years old and has four children. He started his business in 1999. Now he has eleven sows and eleven other pigs for fattening. Roque has regular buyers, so he doesn't worry about where to sell her pigs. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI (a KIVA partner in the Philippines). He will use the loan to buy pig feed. He is also planning to invest in other lines of business to augment his income. 

CEVI is reaching out so that more people can have their own business. CEVI offers more than just loans to all their clients, they offer trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with her husband and their child. Najah has been working as a hairdresser for fifteen years. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to change the décor of her salon. This is the first time that Najah has requested a loan. Najah is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients are her friends, neighbors, and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capital. She decided on starting her business because she wanted to improve her financial situation. In the future, she plans on expanding her salon.

loans.use: Najah will use the loan to change the décor of her salon.

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en: Rajaa is a 40-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Rajaa has owned a snack business for a year. He makes sandwiches. He requested a loan of $2,000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and a machine for his sandwiches. This is the first time that Rajaa has requested a loan. Rajaa is special in his work because he does it well and he is known for his good sandwiches. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty networking. Rajaa decided on starting his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his snack business.

loans.use: Rajaa will use the loan to purchase merchandise and a machine for his sandwiches.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 37-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Fadi has owned a roastery shop for 18 years. He requested a loan of $1,000 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and a coffee machine for his work. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him expand his stock. Fadi is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he faced competition. Fadi decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his shop.

loans.use: Fadi will use the loan to purchase merchandise and a coffee machine for his work

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is formed by two borrowers and Mr. Sem V., aged 30, is the group leader. V. owns a motorbike and uses it to pick up passengers for income. His wife's name is Phally, 29, who sells a few groceries out of their home. The modest couple has two children who are going to the local public school.

Recently, the grocery store ran out of stock. Because the business is profitable, and to earn more income, Mr. V. and his wife have decided to ask for a loan to increase the stock of groceries for sale.

The other borrower is Mrs. S., 39, who sells breakfast foods in the market, and who is looking for a loan to purchase a used motor for her family's requirements.

loans.use: To increase the stock of grocery items for sale

loans.name: Jenan

texts.en:
Jenan is a 33-year-old woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Jenan has owned a grocery store for a year. She requested a loan of $1,000 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Jenan has requested a loan.

Jenan is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the start-up capital. Jenan decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income, as well as she wanted to have independent work. In the future, she plans on expanding her store.

loans.use: Jenan will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 43-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Ziad has owned a grocery store for four years. He requested a loan of $1,000 from Kiva's partner A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his store by diversifying his merchandise. Ziad is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networking. Ziad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his store.

loans.use: Ziad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima has been a clothes seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to the Mwanzo Mgumu group loan (Group code 2019). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bedsheets, khanga and other types of clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Halima is married, and has three children: ages 17, 15 and 12.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets, khanga and other types of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Makelina

texts.en:
Makelina D. is currently selling perfumes and is requesting a loan to set up a shop for a selling point. Makelina is 43 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. Makelina has five children who all go to school at Buluk basic primary school where her husband teaches. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase necessary items for the shop

loans.name: Moufid

texts.en:
Moufid is a 54-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Moufid has owned a barber shop for 30 years. He requested a loan of $1,000 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his salon. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work. Moufid is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networking. Ziad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his store.

loans.use: Moufid will use the loan to purchase tools for his salon

loans.name: Latefa Group

texts.en:
Latefa is the group leader of Latefa group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for their own business.

Latefa and Sorya want to take a loan for their businesses, a general store. They want to expand the business and complete the stock. Sofya wants to take a loan for her carpet weaving business and buy necessary materials for her business. Afghani wants to take a loan for her fruit cart business because she wants to expand and progress the business.

With this loan they can expand their businesses and support their families, become stronger in their businesses and make a better future for themselves and their families. They are really very happy with this loan process in this poor country.

loans.use: to expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 49-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife. Fadi has been working as a blacksmith for 29 years. He requested a loan of $3,000 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and iron for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work. Fadi is special in his work because of his experience. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. Fadi decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: Fadi will use the loan to purchase tools and iron for his work

loans.name: Alena

texts.en:
Alena is married and has one daughter who is 18 years old. She rents a space in a store and sells work clothing. This is a unique business. She provides work clothing for construction workers and various repair workers. Her profit is about 3,000 UAH per month.

Alena would like to develop her business and have even more clients. She wants to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase her inventory. This would allow Alena to provide clothing for an even bigger number of workers and receive additional income.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Chheng's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by two borrowers, both of whom live in SvayPak Commune in the City of Phnom Penh. The group leader, Mr. V., is 37-year-old. He owns and uses a motorbike to run a taxi service around his community. Almost all of his customers are neighbors who need him to take them somewhere. His wife is Sopheak, 31, who works as a garment worker, and who is also a good mother of two teenage children, who are attending school.

The family is facing difficulty with water since the water system is far from their house. Therefore, the family would like a loan in order to pay for linking to the water system.

The other borrower is Mrs. M. who sells all kinds of fruit in the market. She requests a loan to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To pay for linking to the water system

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen J. sells dresses and beer at home and is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine for her business.  Thirty-two years old and married to a businessman,  Hellen has two children who attend Juba Day Secondary School.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to establish a supermarket at Konyokonya market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married. She sells clothing at a market located close to the city bus station. Ludmila has been in this business for four years and is a hardworking person. She has been able to develop the business well and it has become a stable source of income for her family.

Ludmila would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to increase her assortment. She hopes to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy M. currently sells water and soda and is requesting a loan to set up a shop. A thirty-two-year-old widow whose husband died in the two-decade war of southern Sudan, Nancy has two children attending Nyokuron primary school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a house for rental purposes.  

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To set up a shop.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is married. She sells underwear for men and women. Galina invested 10,000 UAH (~ 1200 USD) in her business. She has been in this business for 2 years and wants to develop it further. To do so, she needs to have a larger assortment of underwear. Galina is a very entrepreneurial and hard working person. She would like to borrow 5,000 UAH (USD 625) to purchase more inventory. Galina hopes that the loan will help her to increase the sales and to develop her business.

loans.use: Increase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Lusajo

texts.en:
Lusajo runs a tailoring business and is also a clothes seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She makes different types of dresses and sells them. She belongs to the Maendeleo A2 group loan (Group code 2014). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tailoring items and clothes. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Lusajo is 27 years old, married, and has two children: ages 9 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items and clothes.

loans.name: Loeb

texts.en: Mrs. Loeb K., 56, has been a local cultivator for more than two years. She plants potatoes and then sells them to a buyer every three months. She is widowed and has three children. One of her children is married and lives away from the family home. The other two are single and are working in different jobs. Her two single children also assists her in the business of growing crops when they are not working elsewhere. The potato crop is the main source of income for the family. The family is lacking in capital to invest in their business so Mrs. K. has decided to seek a $600 loan to pay for plowing the potatoes. (Mrs. K.'s daughters are pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: To pay for plowing potato crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Wilium

texts.en:
Wilium G. runs two businesses, a pub and poultry keeping, in Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam.  He is a
microentreprenuer, married with a family to support. He sells varieties of drinks, both soft and alcoholic drinks. He sells also varieties of food and also keeps both broilers and layers poultry. Business income is used to meet his daily family needs and paying school fees. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to boost up the business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Enestina

texts.en:
Enestina owns a small grocery store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the Maendeleo A2 group loan (Group code 2014). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.  


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items to add to her current stock for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Enestina is 40 years old, married, and has four children: ages 18, 15, 13 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Shermahmat

texts.en:
Shermahmat is married and the father of 4 children. He is a farmer. He and his wife grow tomatoes, cucumber and wheat. He is hopeful of making progress and to provide what is necessary for his family with this work. For that reason he wants to invest in his production, to expand his crop fields and to improve the quality of his products. Shermahmat knows that if he takes care of his land and works diligently he will reap excellent products that will have a better reception in the marketplace. The request Shermahmat makes is to purchase seeds, fertilizers, fuels and lubricants necessary for his land. Support this hardworking father so his effort is worthwhile. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for farming business.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia K. sells charcoal from her home. She is requesting a loan to open up a shop. She is 38 years old and is married. Her husband works in the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology with the Government of Southern Sudan as a Director for peace and capacity building. Cicilia has four children. Two of her children are in primary level school and another two are in secondary level. With the extra profits from her business she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes.   

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a charcoal shop

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Zuwena M. is a married Tanzanian businesswoman. She runs a restaurant at Yombo Kiwani in Dar es Salaam. In her restaurant, she sells varieties of food and drinks, including soft drinks, to her customers. She has employed three workers to assist her in her restaurant. The income generated by the business is used to meet her family's daily needs.

Zuwena needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to expand her restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy essential items needed to expand her restaurant business.

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.en:
D. Takhmina is an enterprising woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver and, as his salary has not been stable, sometimes they have accumulated debts. To help her husband, Takhmina decided to start her own business designing and making national dresses for women. She began her business after her first child was born and started with a small machine that she already owned. Now, she has a small workshop and two employees that help her cover the demands of her clients. The good service and fine quality she offers has made her business grow into a small company. Takhmina wants a loan of US$ 1500 to buy a sewing machine and material to help fill her customers’ orders. She promises to return the loan in 12 months. The loan will help her business grow and improve the quality of life for this family. Takhmina sincerely thanks you for your help.

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine with computer-based embroidery for dressmaking business.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clemence M. K. is a married Tanzanian man engaged in a small business. He runs a shop at Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam. He sells different types of goods in his shop, including serial crops such as maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar. He purchases the business goods from the wholesale shops and sometimes directly from the producers and he sells them to his customers in retail.

Clemence is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more goods to sell in his shop.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Bariniso

texts.en:
Bariniso A. is a 55 year old divorced woman with two adult children. She assumed full responsibility of financing her children’s education when she was divorced by her husband. Bariniso has owned and operated a seamstress shop for the past nine years. She sews all forms of women's national dresses in various styles that suit the tastes of her customers. Bariniso wants to use this loan to buy additional supplies in order to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to raise a good income to provide her grandchildren with a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Ally

texts.en: Ally M. is a Tanzanian small-business owner. He is married. He runs a phone-accessory shop in Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the business items from the wholesale shops at the Kariakoo business center and sells on a retail basis to his customers. He has been in the business for only one year. His business plan is to run a mobile-phone shop but funds are the most limiting factor. He needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Barfinisso

texts.en:
Barfinisso is a married mother of three children. Her fabric sales business has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past four years that she’s been in business. In a typical month, Barfinisso makes about $200-$300 in profit from the business. Barfinisso is hard-working, polite, and communicative entrepreneur. She has an attitude of service and loves being able to help women with their clothing needs. Barfinisso has requested a loan of $1500 to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam S. bakes and sells bread to customers. She is 38 years old and married to a peasant. Mariam has no children at all. In order to enhance her business, she requests a loan to purchase necessary materials for baking bread. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she will be able to purchase a bus that will she will use for her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. loans.use: To purchase baking bread materials.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en: Emanuel N. is a Tanzanian small-business owner. He is married and runs a business selling soft drinks in his grocery in the  Yombo Vituka ward of Dar es Salaam. His sells a variety of soft drinks, including Coca-Cola products, Pepsi products, sterilized drinking water and juices. He purchases the business items from wholesale shops and from Coca-Cola and Pepsi agents. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Istoda

texts.en:
Istoda J. is married and her husband is an entrepreneur. She has a son, who is the source of her inspiration and drive as she wants to give him a better life so that he can study and do well for himself. She started her grocery store six years ago to help her husband out financially. She started off with few products, but her business has grown as she has many frequent clients. Istoda would like a loan of $800 to buy merchandise so that she can offer a wider variety of products and so that her business can grow. Her clients are always asking her for new things. She will repay the loan over a period of 12 months. Istoda and her family thank you very much for your support, which means that her business can grow and she can fulfill her goal of providing for her family.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff for her store to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Rebeca has a bean shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns very little monthly profit. Each day, she works at her business for twelve hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more beans for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Rebeca is a 45 year old widow with two children, who are ages 19 and 17. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Nibonisye, who owns her own small business selling rice in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more beans for resale.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Bertha has been animal keeper in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns very minimal monthly profit. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can increase the number of her animals and buy more food and medicine for them. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Bertha is 45 years old, widowed, and has seven children: ages 25, 22, 18, 17, 15, 12 and 10. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Quen, who has her own small business in Mbeya selling bananas.

loans.use: To increase the number of her animals and to buy more food and medicine for them

loans.name: Abduhakim

texts.en:
B. Abduhakim is a 33-year-old cattleman who is married with three children. Owing to his father, who is a farmer, Abduhakim has been associated with this business since he was young. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he breeds and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day, Abduhakim gets up early in the morning in order to feed his animals. And all day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle.

Abduhakim says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with a proper education. Now, Abduhakim would like to expand his business and purchase two cows. For this purpose, he has applied for $800 and with your help he hopes to reach his aim. Be an important part of the growth of Abduhakim’s business.

loans.use: To purchase two cows to expand his business

loans.name: Sharifmo

texts.en:
D. Sharifmo is a hard worker and a person that takes charge. She is married and has three children. Her husband receives a very low wage and they could not handle all the expenses of their family. For that reason, she saw it necessary to also enter the family business. Sharifmo began to sell foodstuff in her grocery store. This has been a fundamental piece in the growth of the business and, together, they have managed to advance it.

At this moment Sharifmo is asking for a loan of $1000 that she will use in the extension of her business to be able to offer a better service to her clients and to improve the aspect of her store. She promises to repay this amount in 12 months. Sharifmo says thanks very much for the aid and the confidence that you show in her.

loans.use: To extend her business and improve her store

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en: Fatina R. is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur and businesswoman. She runs a food shop in the Makangarawe ward of Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of crop products, including cereal crop products. She purchases the business goods from the Kariakoo city market and sometimes direct from the producers wholesale and sells to customers on a retail basis. She has been in the business for four years. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Djantoyerela (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Noumousso un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo une préfecture de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les trois prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente des fruits et légumes,  des condiments alimentaires, de la pâte d’arachide et du gombo.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 5 colis de condiments alimentaires, 15 paniers de fruits et légumes, 2 sacs de 100 kg de graine d’arachide (pour en faire  de la pâte d’arachide) et 4sacs de poudre de gombo. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Kadiolo ville et souvent en famille à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes au comptant  en détail et à crédit.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins quotidiens, et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Djantoyerela ambitionnent de devenir des grossistes et d’aménager leur point de vente.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Djantoyerela are all married and average 29 years of age and 3 children each. They live in monogamous families in Noumousso, a district of Kadiolo City, Sikasso Prefecture (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their fourth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The three preceding loans have been settled.

The group members do a diversity of work, including selling fruit and vegetables, condiments, peanut butter, and okra. With this new loan, they intend to buy five packages of condiments, fifteen baskets of fruit and vegetables, two 100-kg sacks of peanuts (to make into peanut butter), and four sacks of okra powder. Supplies are gotten at the grand market of Kadiolo City and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold at the market of Kadiolo City and often within the family. The customers are composed essentially of women, who buy at the retail level in cash or credit transactions.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 18,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for day-to-day needs, and the other portion will be invested in the business. The women of the group have the ambition to become wholesalers and to fix up their sales outlet.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en:
K. Nurali is 29 years old and is married with three children. Nurali sells confectionery and other foodstuffs in the market. He has been in this business already for ten years. This activity generates the main income for Nurali’s family.

As long as Nurali is very popular in the market selling the fresh and tasty pastry, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Nurali requests $750 for the term of 12 months for purchasing more confectionery to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more confectionary to sell

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata K.  est âgée de 29 ans,  mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari dans une famille monogame avec leurs deux enfants et plusieurs autres ménages dans le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle a commencé le commerce depuis étant élève. C’est son oncle chez qui elle passait ses grandes vacances qui l’a initiée au petit commerce à travers la vente  d’habits  pour enfants. Petit à  petit elle a acquis des  expériences auprès de ce dernier. Ses propres constats sur l’insuffisance de bois de chauffe  dans leur quartier l’ont amené à opter pour la vente du charbon de bois et  du bois de chauffe cela depuis 5 ans. Elle est connue dans cette activité et jouit d’une grande clientèle et renommée dans son quartier de résidence qu’est Bagadadji. Parallèlement à la  vente de bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois, elle vend aussi des  fruits et de la glace.  
 Le besoin d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et le souci de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle l’ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elle est en relation  depuis 42 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel pour un montant de 225.000 FCFA. Elle compte l’utiliser pour acheter 10 chargements de bois de chauffe et 60 sacs de charbon de bois. Elle s’approvisionne à Sakoïba (chef lieu d’une commune rurale).
Madame Fatoumata K.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de faire face à ses échéances avec Soro Yiriwaso et subvenir à ses propres besoins. 
Elle ambitionne  construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata K., age 29, is married and the mother of two. She lives with her husband in a monogamous family with their two children and several other families in the Bagadadji district of Ségou City (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She began in commerce when she was a student. She used to spend her major vacations at her uncle's. There, he introduced her to small-scale commerce through the sale of children's clothing. Little by little, Fatoumata acquired experience from him.

Five years ago, Fatoumata's own observations of the insufficient amounts of firewood in their area has lead her to opt for selling charcoal and firewood. She is recognized in this business and enjoys a large customer base and renown in the district where she lives, which is Bagadadji. Along with selling firewood and charcoal, she also sells fruit and ice cream.

Needing to augment her capital and being concerned about satisfying the demands of her customers, she turned toward Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for 42 months. After three solidarity loans and two individual loans, all correctly repaid, she is now on her third individual loan in the amount of 225,000 francs CFA. She intends to use it to buy ten loads of firewood and sixty sacks of charcoal. Supplies are gotten in Sakoïba (the seat of a rural community), and sales are made to diverse and varied customers, cash or credit accepted.

She plans to realize a monthly profit of 60,000 francs that will enable her to make Soro Yiriwaso loan payments and to support herself. Her ambition is to build a house in which to live.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Shamsullo

texts.en:
Shamsullo is 46 years old and the father of four children. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. He is a hardworking person and he has been providing taxi services for 12 years. The most important thing to him is that his children in future enter university and successfully finish it, so that they will become professionals and have a better tomorrow.

Shamsullo wishes to keep his taxi business growing and, for this, he needs to have his working tools in good working order. He needs to buy spare parts to improve their condition and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to this work he has been able to stabilize his quality of life.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his car

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara W. currently sells alcohol at home and is requesting a loan to open up a bar at Buluk market. Forty-two years old and married to a peasant, Sara has six children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.  
	
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bar.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
M. Nigora is a hardworking young woman who actively contributes to the well-being of her family by selling cottonseed oil in the market. She is married, but has not yet any children. She spends many hours at her small stand in the market waiting for her customers. In the traditional Tajik cuisine the majority of the meals are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil, especially our national dish “Pilaw” which needs much cottonseed oil in order it to be delicious. So the goods that Nigora is selling are in popular demand among the population.

Nigora realizes that, with the excellent quality and customer service she gives, she can grow her business. Today Nigora is planning to increase her business. For this reason she requests $800 for the term of 12 months. Nigora is counting on your help and thanks you for your support.
