loans.use: To purchase more cottonseed oil for her business

loans.name: Sabah Group

texts.en:
The name of this group of borrowers is Sabah. The group is made up of three ladies who live in the Bekaa region of Lebanon.

Sabah, who lends her name to the group, is a 29-year-old woman. Sabah has been working in agriculture for 15 years. She has requested a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Sabah has requested a loan. Sabah decided to start her business in order to supplement her family's income. Her clients are people from her own region. In the future, she plans on expanding the scope of her work.

Saada is a 40-year-old married woman. Saada has been working in agriculture for 10 years. She has requested a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Saada has requested a loan. Saada enjoys what she does. Her clients are people from her own region. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Nazha is a 33-year-old married woman. Nazha has been working in agriculture for 17 years. She has requested a loan of $300 dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Nazha has requested a loan. Her clients are people from her own region. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: The Sabah group will use their loan to purchase tools for their agricultural work.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Tamali, 30 years old and married with two children, ages seven and three, is a fish seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. Working daily at her business, she currently earns very little profit. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more fish for resale, hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Tamali will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mery, who has her own small business selling bananas in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Fatuma has been an animal keeper and has owned a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for five years. She belongs to Maendeleo A2 group loan (Group code 2014). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more eggs for resale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fatuma is 38 years old, married, and has three children: ages 14, 12 and 4. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Rukia who also owns a small shop in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for resale

loans.name: Turabek

texts.en:
M. Turabek, 44 and married with three children, sells confections such as candies, cookies, pastries, and fruit jelly. In business for three years, Turabek sells the goods from the market in Dushanbe, and the generated income allows him to support his family, for whom he is the sole income earner. Today, he is requesting $800 for the term of 12 months to enlarge the range of goods he carries. Turabek thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

loans.use: To enlarge the range of goods carried.

loans.name: Fadwa Group

texts.en:
The name of this group of borrowers is Fadwa. It is made up of five ladies living in the Bekaa region of Lebanon.

Badrah is a 53-year-old woman with nine children. Badrah has been working in agriculture for 20 years. She sells to people in her region. She has requested a loan of $300 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Badrah has requested a loan. Badrah decided on engaging in this business to meet specific demand in her region. In the future, she plans on expanding the scope of her work.

Amina, 40 years old, has been working in agriculture for 10 years. She has requested a loan of $300 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Amina has requested a loan. Amina sells to people in her region and she enjoys what she does. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Fadwa, who lends her name to the group, is a 38-year-old married woman with six children. Fadwa has been working in agriculture for 17 years and sells to people in her region. She has requested a loan of $300 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Fadwa has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Diba M. A. M. is a 29-year-old married woman with four children. Diba has been working in agriculture for ten years. She owns livestock. She has requested a loan of $300 from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Diba has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her livestock.

Zainab, 46 years old, is married with six children. Zainab has been working in agriculture for fifteen years and has owned livestock for 10 years. Her clients are people from her region. She has requested a loan of $300 from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Zainab has requested a loan. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on engaging in this business to meet specific demand in her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: The Fadwa group will use the loan to purchase tools for their work.

loans.name: Nurbibi

texts.en:
S. Nurbibi is 30-years-old and is married with three children. Nurbibi runs a family business, a grocery store, and she has an important variety of merchandise which she hopes to strengthen during this warm season with a variety of drinks like juice and soft drinks. With the support of her husband, they have picked their business back up, and it has been the source of income that educates the entire family.

Currently Nurbibi requests $800 for 12 months. The money requested will go towards the purchase of merchandise like soft drinks, juice, ice cream, sweets, detergents and other products.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Benardetha

texts.en:
Bernadetha S. is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur and married businesswoman. She runs a poultry-keeping business in the Yombo Makangarawe ward of Dar es Salaam. She keeps both broilers and laying chickens in poultry cages. Broilers take only three months to sell while layers take six months to get the first lay out, thus they are more expensive to keep than broilers but generate a lot of income and are less expensive once they start laying eggs.

She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to expand the business by constructing more poultry cages and buying more chicks.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Khadra Group

texts.en:
This group's name is Khadra and it is made up of five ladies who are living in the Bekaa region of Lebanon.

Khadra is a 36-year-old married woman with five children. Khadra has owned livestock for 10 years. She requested a loan of $300 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Khadra has requested a loan. Khadra is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulties. Khadra decided on doing her business because it is in demand in her region. In the future, she plans on expanding her livestock.

Badrah is a 56-year-old married woman with four children. Badrah has been working in agriculture for 25 years. She owns livestock. She requested a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to increase her herd of livestock. This is the first time that Badrah has requested a loan. Badrah is special in her work because she likes what she does. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulties. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Najah is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. Najah has been working in agriculture for 15 years. She owns livestock. She requested a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to increase her herd of livestock. This is the first time that Najah has requested a loan. Najah is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anyone from her region. Najah decided on doing her business because she likes animals. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Bahaa is a 27-year-old woman. Bahaa has been working in agriculture for 10 years. She owns livestock. She requested a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to increase her herd of livestock. This is the first time that Bahaa has requested a loan. Bahaa is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anyone from her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her herd of livestock.

Safwat is 38 and married. Safwat has been working in agriculture for 15 years. She has owned livestock for 15 years. She requested a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to increase her herd of livestock. This is the first time that Safwat has requested a loan. Safwat is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anyone from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulties. She decided on doing her business because that was the demand in her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: The Khadra group will use the loan to increase their herds of livestock

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
S. Khanifa is a hardworking woman and, since 1993, has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Rudaki district. Khanifa characterizes herself as happy and humble. She started her business with her savings which she had accumulated over a long period of time. She is the mother of four children that she would like to offer an education.

Her biggest dream is to arrange the wedding of her elder son for which she works hard every day. To realize this dream, Khanifa now requests $1200 for the term of 12 months. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings. With your collaboration she’ll be able to crystallize her dream in a short time.

loans.name: Faizidin

texts.en:
S. Faizidin is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work on his farm and to look after his cattle.

Faizidin wishes to expand his business by purchasing young cattle and fodder for them. That is the reason that he is asking for a loan. Faizidin will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his request.

loans.name: Jumbe

texts.en: Jumbe  H. is a microbusiness entrepreneur in Tanzania. He runs a stationery shop in the Tabata Kimanga ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases his business items from the wholesale stationers in the Kariakoo shopping city center. He manages to meet his family's daily needs from his business income. He has been in this business for three years. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more goods for sale in his business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale in his stationery business.

loans.name: Al Naenaiya Group

texts.en:
The group name is Al Naenaiya; it is made of five ladies who live in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon.

loans.name: Ilhomiddin

texts.en:
A livestock breeder for three years, Z. Ilhomiddin was born in 1973 in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and responsible for four people including his wife and three children.

Very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his flock and repair his enclosure, so as to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and its neighborhood, who buy animals from more than 20 km from his village.

With this goal in mind, Ilhomiddin is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and also to make some investments.

loans.use: To expand his flock and repair his enclosure

loans.name: Awetu

texts.en: Awetu B. is a Tanzanian small business woman with three school age children. She runs a business selling traditional clothes (Khanga and Vitenge) at Mbagala and nearby regions in Tanzanian. She purchases the business items from Mnazi Mmoja wholesale and retail traditional clothes shopping center. She sometimes purchases direct from the producers and sells to retail customers. She has been in the business for five years and her business plan is to run a wholesale shop. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia K. sells clothes and is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell in order to expand her business. She is 31 years old and is married to an accountant in the Ministry of Regional Co-operation, Government of Southern Sudan. Cicilia has no children. And with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land to rent.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anor

texts.en:
O. Anor is 44 years old and is married with five children. Anor is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife (pictured) and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.

Today Anor is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional $650 in his business. In order to receive this amount, Anor has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Salima Said

texts.en: Salima Said M. is a Tanzanian micro business woman. She runs a business selling natural clothes (Khanga and Vitenge), Shoes and Lotion at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business items from the wholesale and retail shops at Kariakoo and Mmnazi mmoja Traditional clothes shopping center and sells to retail customers at Mbagala. She has been in the business for three years. The business income generated is used to meet her family's daily demands. She is in need of a loan of Tshs 800,000 to extend the business

loans.use: To extend the business

loans.name: Mubina

texts.en:
U. Mubina runs a small grocery store. She sells a wide variety of foodstuffs, including canned foods, soft drinks, juices, sweets, tea, coffee, etc. Mubina has been in this business for about 11 years. She is also married and has three kids. One of Mubina’s goals is to be able to remodel her apartment and improve her living conditions. Mubina has requested a loan of $600 USD to buy additional foodstuffs, in order to increase the range of her goods. The loan will help Mubina increase her income and continue to operate a stable, sustainable business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Omary

texts.en:
Omari Debagula is a Tanzanian teacher. He runs a kindergarten school in the Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. There are 50 schoolchildren in his school. He also teaches some primary-school classes. He has employed two teachers who assist him in his school.

He plans to purchase plots of land where he intends to construct his own classrooms. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 toward this end.

loans.use: To buy sites for building school facilities.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is 36 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. She says all her children are pursuing education in primary and junior high schools. She lives with her family in their own house at Oda, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. Akosua works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables.

Akosua sells foodstuffs. She sells plantain, cassava, yam, etc. on a table in the community market. She buys her goods from the farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for two years. She also distributes the cassava and plantain to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators.

Akosua wants a loan to buy the foodstuffs on a larger scale so that she can cut down on cost, as in frequent trips to procure the goods, and also to maximize profit.

Akosua is a member of the community group called "Kroye" (translated as “Unity”). Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk for her business

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina A. sells beans and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. With the extra profits from her loan, Celina hopes to be able to buy a lorry (truck) to hire.

Celina is 30 years old and married a nurse who works at Juba Teaching Hospital. They have two children who are studying for diplomas at Supiri Institute Of Management And Information Technology. One takes a human resource management course and the other one takes computer science.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 24-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Hasan has owned an accessory shop. He has requested a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Hasan has requested a loan. 

Hasan considers himself special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had financial issues. Hasan decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hasan will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy E. is a married Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a charcoal-selling business in the Tandika ward of the Temeke district in Dar es Salaam. Charcoal is the main source of power in Africa and other developing countries, due to high charge and unstable electrical power. Lucy purchases her charcoal directly from the producers in wholesale and sells in retail to her customers. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis S. is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. They are currently pursuing education in primary school and junior high schools. Mavis’ husband works as a tailor with a specialization in school uniforms. She lives with the family at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are into farming activities.

Mavis trades in textiles fabrics and second-hand clothes. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second-hand clothes, most especially, skirts, blouses and ladies' slippers and shoes, from Accra, a nearby city, and sells in the market square of her community. She says she has a small shed in which she sells.

She has been in this business for three years and wants a loan to increase her working capital to be able to procure bales of textiles and shoes. She believes the loan assistance would enable her to upgrade her inventory and eventually, make very good profits. She is a member of a trust group called Mawuli.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles and fabrics

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat M. sells tea, cakes and bread at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more tables and chairs for the restaurant to run smoothly. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land for rent.

Hayat is 27 years old and married to a Southern Sudan television reporter who’s name is James Jadda. She has one child who goes to school at Buluk "A" primary school.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. loans.use: To purchase more tables and chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is forty-four years old. She is married and blessed with five children. Currently, they are all pursuing education in primary school. She lives, together with her family, in a family house in a town called Akim Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works with all zeal as a resourceful mother to support her family and provide for the children’s schooling.

Akua is a fishmonger and sells all kinds of fresh and smoked fish as well as maize. She sells in a shed in the local market square. She procures her stock of fish from big-time fish mongers, who sell at wholesale prices in the town of Mankessim. She has been in business for fifteen years. According to Akua, most of her customers are food vendors and individual households in her community.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fish in bulk to serve a larger market and, eventually, help improve her family finances.

She is a member of a Trust Bank group called “Mawuli” (translated, “God is with us”) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish and tilapia to sell

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura A. runs a beautiful salon at Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is married with three school-aged children. She purchases the items needed for her salon from the wholesale shops in Kariakoo. She has been in the business for six years. The income generated from her business is used to meet the daily demands of her family as well as to pay school fees.

She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to expand her salon business.

loans.use: To expand her salon business.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 29-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. Husein has been doing cladding work for fourteen years. Husein requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase cladding for his work. This is the first time that Husein has requested a loan. 
Husien is special because of his experience. Husein decided on doing his businesses because he wants the best for his family. In the future, he plans on improving his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his work.

loans.name: Fida

texts.en:
Fida is a 40-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa region of Lebanon with her husband and their six children. Fida has been working as a chocolatier since 2006. Fida has requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and accessories for her work. This is the first time that Fida has requested a loan.

Fida considers herself special because she does her work well and knows how to satisfy her clients’ needs. She decided on starting her businesses because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: Fida will use the loan to purchase chocolate-designing merchandise and accessories.

loans.name: Vicy

texts.en:
Vicy S. sells charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to build a charcoal store at the market for the possibility of meeting many customers. She is 30 years old and married to a husband who is a peasant. Vicy has three children and all of them attend school at Mobil Parent Primary School. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family's settlement.

loans.use: To open up a charcoal store

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 29-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region with his wife and their two children. Rami has been working in home construction, specifically cladding, since 2004. Rami has requested a loan of $1,600 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase cladding supplies for his work. This is the first time that Rami has requested a loan.

Rami is engaged in his business because he wants the best for his family. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase cladding supplies for his work.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Shop businesses are very common in Tanzania and the rest of the African cities due to their accessibility and the availability and inexpensiveness of the business goods involved. Sofia C. runs a shop business in the Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of goods, including cereal crop products. She purchases her goods from the wholesale shops and sometimes directly from the producers. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to boost up the business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Charifa

texts.en:
Charifa is a 55-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa region with her husband and their four children. Charifa has owned a grocery store for forty years. She has requested a loan of $1,000 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Charifa has requested a loan.

Charifa feels that she is speciA. in her business because she knows how to treat her clients. Charifa began her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region. He is engaged to be married. Ahmad has been working as a car repairman for two years. He has requested a loan of $1,500 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad considers himself speciA. in his business because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He began his business because he wanted to improve his financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his garage.

loans.name: Mahida

texts.en:
Mahida is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa region with her husband and their eight children. Mahida has been selling clothes from her house since 2002. Mahida has requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her business. This is her third loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

Mahida feels that she is special in her business because she knows how to treat her clients and because she sells nice clothes. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Mahida decided on beginning her business because she wants to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by purchasing a shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her clothes business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region. Ahmad has owned a barber shop for a year. Ahmad has requested a loan of $1,500 from A. Majmoua so as to decorate his salon. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad sees himself as speciA. in his business because he knows how to treat his clients and because he is aware of new hairstyles. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ahmad began his business because he had prior experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To decorate his salon.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 30-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region with his wife and their child. Fadi has been working as an electrician for 16 years. He has requested a loan of $2,300 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Fadi has requested a loan.

Fadi believes he is special in his business because of his many years of experience. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He started the business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora A. is a small business woman in Tanzania. She runs a business of selling bites at Kiwalani ward in Dar es Salaam. She make and sells varieties of bites to her customers. Her business plan is to open and run a café but finds funding the business a limiting element. She has been running the business for three years. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 28-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa area with his wife and their two children. Elias has been selling aluminum for 16 years. He has requested a loan of $2,000 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase aluminum for sale. This is the first time that Elias has requested a loan.

Elias sees himself as speciA. in his business because if his many years of experience. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Elias had significant financiA. difficulties when he first began his business, and he wanted to improve his financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase aluminum for his work.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 42-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa area with his wife and their four children. Omar has been working as a carpenter for four years. Omar requested a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase wood for his work. This is the first time that Omar has requested a loan.

Omar considers himself special in his business because he does good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and the public. Omar decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Omar will use the loan to purchase wood for his carpentry work.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 26-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa area. Khoder has owned a grocery store since 2007. He has requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Khoder has requested a loan.

Khoder feels that he is special in his business because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Khoder decided to open his grocery store because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Husain

texts.en:
Husain is a 44-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region with his wife and their five children. Husain has owned a grocery store since 2007. He has requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Husain has requested a loan.

Husain sees himself as special in his business because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Husain decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region. Ali has owned a grocery store since 2000. Ali has requested a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali considers himself special because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ali decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
As well as being an entrepreneur, Abena S., 35, takes care of her four kids: two boys and two girls. Currently, all of her children are pursuing their education at the junior high and primary school levels. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to achieve the highest degree of education possible. She lives with her family in a family house at Oda, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. Abena is a restaurant operator. 

In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local foods like "fufu" and "banku." Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain. It is taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Abena says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly. She needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production costs. She expects to make higher profits if she receives her loan. She wants to invest the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

She is a member of a group called Gold Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies and firewood for restaurant business.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda O. is thirty-seven year old married woman with a one child who is still breastfeeding. Matilda’s husband works as Disc Jockey in a radio station. She lives with her family at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are actively involved in farming. 

Matilda is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts like speakers, transistors, transformers, screwdrivers, wire, television cords, antennas etc. She buys her supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices. She expects to increase her profits if she receives her loan, She wants to invest the loan in higher inventory of electrical and electronic parts. She hopes to increase her savings so that she can expand her shop and include refrigerators and parts. She is a member of a group called “Adehyee Mma” (Translated, Royals) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna W. is forty-five years old. She is married and has six children who are pursuing education in primary and junior high schools. Mamuna lives with her husband and children in a community called Oda, a town located in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number of the women are involved in palm oil production. Mamuna is one of such women who actively produce palm oil. She has been in this business for five years. Her husband is a food crop farmer.

She buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community, processes it in her house to produce the oil and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local favorite vegetable oil. It is produced from the food of the palm fruit which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and boiled an additional time to expel water content. She desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply to more customers. She also trades in kenkey, which is one the favorite local dishes, to supplement her income. 

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and eventually, help to improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called “Agui Allah” (Translated as God exists) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruits in bulk for palm oil production and sales.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick A. is a 45 year old man. He is married and the father of six children who are currently pursuing education in senior and junior high schools. He trades in agricultural chemicals and sells various kinds like herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers.

Oda, the town where Patrick lives with his family, is a farming community and many local farmers patronize his products because of the current farming season where most farmers are actively preparing their farm lands and planting their crops.

Patrick is expecting higher profits if he receives the loan and wants to invest the loan to procure an increased stock of assorted agro-chemicals. He hopes to raise enough income to sponsor his children’s education.

He is a member of a group called “Papaye” (translated as “Goodness”) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan. He is very appreciative for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel G. is forty-eight years old. He is married and has three children who are currently in the basic school. Samuel lives with his family in a community called Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number of the women are engaged in palm oil production. Samuel identified this as a business opportunity and bought three sets of palm nut milling and processing machines to run a commercial palm nut processing business in his community. 

He has one set of machines that pounds the cooked palm nuts and another one that extracts the oil from the palm nut fibre. His services have greatly reduced the drudgery that was previously associated with palm oil extraction and processing.

Since palm oil production is assuming a greater scale in his community, he seeks loan assistance to enable him to buy additional milling and processing machines and accessories to provide satisfactory, timely production service to his clients. He believes the loan assistance would enable him to scale up production to serve a larger market and eventually, to help improve his family’s finances. He is a member of a Trust Bank group called Zion Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee one another as social collateral to access the loan and to support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure milling machines and parts for palm oil production.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena A. is forty-two years old. She is married and blessed with three children.  Currently, her children are all pursuing education in junior and primary schools. She lives, with her family, in a family house in a town called Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works with zeal as a resourceful parent to support her family and to provide for the children’s schooling. She is a fishmonger and sells all kinds of fresh and smoked fish. She sells through “hawking” (Door-to-door sales). She buys her goods from big time fish mongers in Yeji and Mankessim towns, who sell at wholesale prices. She has been in business for five years. According to Helena, most of her customers are food vendors in her community. 

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fish in bulk to serve a larger market and to improve her family’s finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Rock of Ages Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another, as social collateral, to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy wholesale smoked fish and tilapia to sell to vendors.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet D. is 50 years old. She is married and mother to two daughters and a son who are all independent. Janet lives with her husband and two grandchildren at Oda, a town located in the Eastern region of Ghana. Janet’s husband is food crop farmer. She runs a grocery shop and charcoal sales to help her husband provide for the family. It was through this business that Janet sponsored all her children to graduate from school. They are all now working. She has been in business for twenty-five years. She sells items such as tins of milo (milk beverage), milk, sugar, bread, tinned fish, etc. Janet buys her goods from wholesalers in the big cities around such as Accra. She also purchases charcoal from the neighboring villages in bulk. She seeks a loan to expand the size of her shop and also to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her to save more to support her family, especially her grandchildren’s education.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina has been managing her village store business for almost two years.  Her husband, Eduardo, is an electrician in their village.  The couple is working hard to further the education of their seven children: Valeny, Rosette, Janette, Edison, Norbert, Tio and Mariel. Some of her children are already married, while the others are still in the high school level. Her desire to improve her business leads her to ask for a loan of PHP 7,000 ($US 150). She believes that this amount will assist her in making her store become more profitable.

loans.use: Business Capital - village store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
“God provides everything for you immediately, when you ask for help”. This is the guiding principle of Marilyn C., a village store owner in Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela.  She is married to Donato. They have a son named Michael, 29 years old, who works as a tricycle driver in their village. 

The couple is doing their best to benefit their family. She has been operating her store for almost eight months and it serves as their daily source of income. She wants to improve her store and has asked for a loan of PHP 10, 000 ( USD 225 ) to buy additional grocery items and hopefully for her business to become profitable.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for store.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is already 45 years old. Her husband Ramon is working as a driver in a rice mill in their village. They are blessed with five children: Romel - 25 years old; Arcelie - 23 years old; Ramon Jr. - 17 years old; Monette - 15 years old, high school student, and Maria Angelica - 1 year old. They are living harmoniously at Barangay Centro 2, Angadanan, Isabela.

Nenita has been engaged in a fish-vending business for almost a year in their village. Through her business, she was able to help her husband in providing the needs of their family. Nenita is doing her best to improve her vending business to support the education of their two children who are still in school.

She is now hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 8,000 as business capital. This will assist her in maintaining her enterprise.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn T. has been engaged in the direct selling business for four years.  She is now generating a monthly net income of PHP 4,000.00.  She is glad that through patience she was able to improve her small enterprise.  She wanted to borrow at least PHP 17,000.00 as additional capital.  With this amount, she can sell more products, hopefully save some of her income for the education of their daughter and have their dream house someday. 

Marilyn is 32 years old.  She is married to Antonio and they have an eight-year-old daughter named Lyra Lovelle, a grade school student.  Her family is happily residing at Barangay Centro 2 in Angadanan, Isabela.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 53 years old and a vendor of dry goods such as combs, washing utensils, door mats and so on. She is married to Virdiano and their children are: Bernardo, 26 years old; Virdialyn, 24 years old; Jordan, 19 years old and a  high school graduate; Dianna, 14 years old, who works as a sales lady; Jadelyn,12 years old, and still in the elementary level; and Adelyn, 8 years old, in grade school. They reside at Baranggay Sipat, Cauayan City. Their business is situated in the public market of Cauayan. 

She has been in the business for three years and is still doing better.  She is now requesting a loan amount of PHP10,000 to increase her working capital. She will use the loan to purchase more items and hopefully generate more income.  She hopes to have her own stall in the market in order to be safe from heat and rain. Now she just displays her products on the sidewalk, which is not cemented.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 42 years old and has been operating a mini eatery in her village for three months.  Her husband is working as a driver in Saudi Arabia.  They have three children: Jemardan - 15 years old, third year high school; Daniel - 11 years old, grade six and their youngest, Micah, 5 years old.  They are currently residing in Baranggay Centro 2 Angadanan, Isabela.

She wants a loan of PHP 5,000.00 that she can use as business capital.  Maribel hopes to make her business grow to help her husband support the growing needs of their family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Frema

texts.en:
Frema helps her husband on the farm. They cultivate rice and corn to support the daily needs of their family. For them to have an alternative source of income, she is planning to engage in the hog-raising business. Through her proposed business, she will then be able to assist her husband financially and they can avoid asking for credit from capitalists with big interest rates.

She is also hoping that by having her own enterprise, she can send her child to school in the future. For the realization of her plans, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000.00 that she will use for her hog-raising business. She believes that time is gold thus, as soon as possible she will invest her money in every business opportunity to grow and become successful someday.

Frema is 25 years old and married to Reymund, who works as a farmer in their community. They live in the rural place of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela, and are blessed with a child named Rainier, 3. She always prays that her family will always be in good health and be free from any kind of sickness.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is engaged in the hog-raising business. She raises hogs for four months before selling them to her customers. One hog costs PHP4,000 to PHP6,000, depending on its size and weight. She wants to purchase additional piglets, so she is requesting a loan of 5,000.00. She will also allot some of the loan to buy a supply of feed.

She is hoping that she could continue to make her business grow, for it really helps her in sustaining the needs of her family and supporting the education of her youngest child. She believes that being patient and diligent in her business is the key to becoming successful in life.

Siony is 38 years old. She is married to Herminigildo, a farmer. They have five children: Heny-Anne, a 21-year-old elementary graduate; Hemaculada, a 20-year-old high-school graduate; Jilbert, a 19-year-old high-school undergraduate; Juan, a 17-year-old elementary graduate; and Jeneva, a 15 year old who is presently studying in high school and hoping that she can pursue her college education. She is hoping that someday, they will able to improve their poor living conditions by means of hard work and patience.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a responsible wife and mother. She and her husband were gifted with six children: Rosita - 27 years old; Romulo Jr. - 25 years old; Hazel - 21 years old; Romnick - 18 years old, college student; Joyce - 13 years old, high school student and their youngest is Jay Lord - 3 years old. Three of them are already married.

She and her husband are managing a welding shop. With their need for financial assistance she is now requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos for the maintenance of their shop. This amount will assist her husband in developing their business, making it more productive able to meet the needs of their family and provide for the education of their children.

loans.use: Maintenance of welding shop

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda A. is 42 years old and vending has always been a good source of income for her. She was married to Cresencio who is 5 years younger than she. They were blessed with three children: Michelle Joy - 22 years old, Kenneth Mark - 19 years old and a third year high school student, and Atasha Mae - 4 years old, and a pre-school student. They are happy living in Luna, Isabela.

She is engaged in wholesale and retail sales. She sells fresh eggs and dried fish in the market. Her weekly net income is around 3,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $61) which they budget to support the basic needs of their family. However, it is not sufficient to satisfy their needs; she and her husband are working hard to sustain their business for their future. For this she decided to request a loan amounting to 16,000 pesos. She believes that strong determination and patience are the keys to success.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan P. is 39 years old. She operates a typical village store in their place at Barangay Centro 2 in Angadanan, Isabel. Her husband Moises is working as an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). They have four children and they are: Suzie Mae - 16 years old, first year college; Monica - 14 years old, third year high school; Mitchie - 11 years old, grade school and Charity - 10 years old, also in grade school.

Her weekly income is being use as rolling capital for her business. Her loan request of 20,000 Philippine Pesos will be used for further development of her store and to purchase more stock. She hopes to expand her store and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Store inventory

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina has been a fish vendor for 21 years already in the public market in Cauayan City.  Her husband Rodrigo assists her in managing the business.  They have two children: Jennica - 14 years old, a high school student and Jero Israel - 7 years old, an elementary school student.  Her income of 2,500 Philippine Pesos (about US $51) a week is being used for the needs of their family and the education of their children.  She wants a loan of 10,000 pesos from the lenders.  The loan will be of great help in her business and also for her family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a market collector in the public market of Cauayan City. AsiD. from that, she also sells chicken meat and sometimes she also offers vegetables. Her weekly net income of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $41) is quite enough to support their needs. She wants to pursue her vending business and for this she would like a loan of 10,000 pesos as additional capital.

She is married to Carlos and they have three children: Charles Daryl - 21 years old, a college undergraduate; Randal Roy - 19 years old, a third year college student, and John Carlo - 11 years old, a graD. school student. She hopes that her business will become more productive to further help her husband improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga and her husband have two children: King Anthony - 19 years old and Janine - 17 years old. Both of them are already in college. Her husband is working in a distant place to support their family.

Her sari-sari store (community based store) has been operating for five years. Her weekly net income of 700 Philippine Pesos (about US $14) is being use for the allowance of their children. She hopes that her business will continue to grow so they can save something for the needs of her family. She therefore requests a loan of 13,000 pesos to buy additional merchandise for her store. She said that her determination to succeed drives her to work hard.

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
“Prayer is the strongest armor when problem comes” said Teresita. She is a food vendor in their village. She used to roam around their community using her tribike (bicycle with three wheels). She is 47 years old and married to Francisco, a driver. They have three children: Jezrelle - 19 years old, a high school graduate working in a rice grain company; Jay Ruiz - 16 years old, and Jaizer Joy - 14 years old, who are both high school students.

She has managed to sell cooked foods for almost 11 years. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 as additional capital for her business which is in demand from her customers. Her loan request will help her in sending her children to school through her enterprise.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros and Ernesto are blessed with six children: their eldest is Jomel - 15 years old, a fourth year high school student; Mary Grace - 13 years old, a third year high school student; Mary – Ann - 12 years old, a first year high school student; April Joy - 10 years old and Aries - 8 years old, both in grade school, and Anthony - 5 years old. They live a simple and happy life in Barangay Del Pilar, Cabatuan Isabela.

She is 44 years old. Her husband is working in the municipal health office as a utility worker. She has been engaged in the vending business for almost five years. She sells different vegetables and snacks in their village using her tribike (a bike with three wheels). She wants to expand her business and for her to do that, she would like a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos. This amount will be of great help in her business for its continuing growth.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 45 years old. Her husband Rolando is working as a security guard in a Rural Bank located in their place. The couple is blessed with five children: Arlene - 23 years old; the twins Arvilyn and Angelyn - 22 years old; Abegail - 19 years old and a college student, and Mark - 15 years old and a high school student. Since they do not have their own house, the family is living in her sister-in-law’s house.

Rosemarie is engaged in the buying and selling of charcoal. Aside from that, she also sells frozen foods thrice a week to her regular customers. Rosemarie hopes to get a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos for the growth of her business. She was thankful that her children were very supportive and this makes Rosemarie inspired to continue with her business.

loans.use: Bsuiness Capital

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is married to Edgar M.. She is 55 years old and manages a general store in their village. She sells different types of merchandise at retail. She also wants to expand her business by selling other commodities and cooked food. She loves her business thus wants to further develop it. She hopes to borrow 12,000 Philippine Pesos to pursue her plans and gain more income for her family.

They have five children: Legarda - 36 years old; Maria Victorina - 34 years old; Dulce - 31 years old; Lisette - 28 years old and Joanne - 25 years old. Her husband accompanies her in the business. The couple loves to cook different dishes so they are planning to put up a small eatery when they have enough capital. They are looking forward to the progress of their business through the financial support from the lenders accompanied by patience and hard work.

loans.use: To expand the variety of goods sold

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M., 43, is a meat vendor in the public market of Cauayn City, and her husband Benjamin is a tricycle operator. They are blessed with four children: Joanna, 21, Bernadeth, 19, Jonabel,17 years old, all being educated at the college level, and the youngest, Benny Jay, 12 years old, a high school student.

When she learned from her neighbors about the Kiva lenders, Josephine was encouraged to request a loan because of her need for capital. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000.00 which will be of much assistance in the development of her business and the welfare of their family. She says, “Productivity gains by working patiently”

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Truly

texts.en:
Truly M. is a good father to his children and a good husband to his wife, Mirasol. They have four children: Sherwel - 25 years old, a graduating college student; Truly Jr. - 23 years old; Jancel - 21 years old, a third year college student and Manilyn - 18 years old, a high school graduate.

Truly is a food vendor. He has sold ready-to-eat snacks in their village for two years. He now wants to borrow PHP 5,000 for the improvement of his vending business. He hopes that lenders will assist him financially for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: The improvement of his food-vending business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old and married to Vicente, a farmer, and blessed with five children: Jo Vincent, 37 years old, a policeman; Joel, 34 years old, a teacher; Jovelyn , 32 years old, also a teacher; Jennifer, 28 years old and their youngest is Jeffrey - 19 years old, still a college student. Some of them are already married. They are residing in Barangay Centro 2 of Angadanan, Isabela.

Evelyn has operated a typical village store in their place for almost 20 years. She utilizes her weekly net income of PHP 700 for the school allowance of her son and for some of their basic needs at home.

Evelyn wants to borrow PHP 6,000 that will serve as additional capital for her store. She believes that through patience and hard work, she can become successful in the future.

loans.use: To use as business capital for her store

loans.name: Lauriana

texts.en:
Lauriana and her husband are striving hard to improve their way of living. She manages a sari-sari store (community based store) in their village. She has managed her store for almost two years and she is thankful that it is doing well. Lauriana wants to grab the chance to improve her store by asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 (USD 150) as additional capital. She plans to use the loan to buy more grocery items that she can offer to her customers. She hopes that lenders will give her the opportunity to develop her business.

Lauriana is 57 years old, married to Francisco and blessed with five children: Homer - 36 years old, a security guard in Laguna; Joel - 34 years old; Joey - 31 years old; Jennifer - 26 years old, and Jerry - 22 years old.  Her children were not able to pursue their college education due to financial difficulties.

loans.use: Business Capital - village grocery store.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.en:
A hard working and responsible father, as described by his children, Gaspar T. is 36 years old and has three children. They are: Junell - 14 years old, fourth year high school student, currently stays in St. Mary’s (boys town) in Silan, Cavite; Rennie, Boy - 12 years old, second year high school and Kate Ann - 8 years old, grade school student. Gaspar lives in Barangay Centro 2 in the simple town of Angadanan, Isabela. His wife, Elsa, helps him in his business.

Gaspar has been delivering bread in his village for almost ten years using his tricycle. He is generating a weekly income of PHP 2,500 (~USD 30) that they budget to support the needs of his family. He is now seeking for financial assistance amounting to PHP 8,000.00 (USD 175). This amount will be used for the development of his current business and he hopes to eventually open a bakeshop.

loans.use: Business Capital - bread delivery and bakeshop.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 51 years old. She and her husband are separated. Their three children are already married. Her children are Minerva – 34 yrs. old, Mary Joy – 32 yrs. old and Jomar - 29 yrs. old.  

Mary Rose manages a vending business in her village to support her daily needs and to support the needs of her grandchildren.  She lives in the rural village of Del Pilar in Cabatuan, Isabela.  She sells different commodities like snacks and she also sells rice.  Since it is summer, she has decided to sell halo-halo which is in demand during this time of the year. She wants to take a loan of PHP 8, 000 (USD 175) for further development of her business and to save some of her income to provide for the educational needs of her grandchildren for the next school year.  Vending has been her sole source of income and she is patiently improving it.

loans.use: Business development & school fees.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita manages a sari-sari store (community-based store) in their village. She converted a small portion of their house into a small store. However, due to financial difficulties, she was not able to improve her store for she used some of the capital for the education of her children. But still, she was thankful because, even though her store was closed for some time, it did not prevent her from sending her children to school.

For this reason, Juanita is seeking financial support for the re-opening of her store. She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 as business capital. She said that she will be very grateful if she will be given the chance to obtain a loan because it will really help her family in reaching their dreams.

Juanita was born in the province of Cagayan in Barangay San Roque, Centro Enrile. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children: Eudato, 19 years old, a college undergraduate but working as a soldier; Jay-Ar, 17 years old, a college student and Janice, 15 years old, a sophomore high school student. Juanita is hoping that they will be able to continue their studies through her hard work and patience.

loans.use: As business capital to re-open her sari-sari store

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar es socia del bancomunal Grandioso Milagro.
Pilar es conviviente tiene 44 años, tres hijos el mayor  de 17 años esta preparándose para ingresar a la universidad y el de 15 y  13 años están estudiando  en la escuela estatal. 
El papa de Pilar trabajo haciendo instalaciones eléctricas, hasta que se jubilo, le dejo el negocio a ella y a su hermano, también  una cartera de clientes, empezó a trabajar con su hermano, pero hace ocho años ella se independizo, aprendió mas del negocio, ha contratado personal que trabaja para ella, se dedica a dar servicio de  cableados a casas y  edificios.  
Pilar necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de cables eléctricos, interruptores y luminarias. 
Desde que esta en Finca, gracias a los prestamos puede cumplir con los contratos que hace con sus clientes.
El sueño de Pilar es crear una empresa que de servicios  eléctricos.
texts.en:
Pilar is a member of the community bank Grandioso Milagro. Pilar lives with her partner and is 44 years old. She has three children, the oldest is 17 years old is preparing to start college, the 15 and 13 year olds are studying in public school. Pilar's father worked doing electrical work until he retired. He left the business to her and her brother and also left them the client portfolio. She began working with her brother but eight years ago she became independent and learned more about the business. She hired employees that work for her and she is dedicated to providing cable services to homes and businesses. Pillar needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy electrical cables, switches and lights. Since she has been in FINCA, thanks to the loans, she can fulfill contracts she makes with her clients. Pilar's dream is to establish an electrical services company.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical cables, switches and lights.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Máxima es socia del bancomunal Grandioso Milagro.
Máxima es casada tiene 71 años, diez hijos, los cuales cuatro han muerto y seis quedan vivos, ellos están casados.  
El yerno de Máxima se dedica hacer bolsas de papel, ella mirándolo un día vio que era fácil y  le pidió que le enseñaran, fue así que máxima se puso hacer bolsas de  papel para  empacar menestras.
Máxima hace 100 bolsas de papel al día desde la seis de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, ella trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Máxima necesita un préstamo de  1000 soles, para la compra de papel para hacer bolsas.
Desde que esta en Finca, se distrae tiene mas amigas, le gusta el compañerismo en el Bancomunal. 
El sueño de máxima es  seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Maxima is a member of the Grandioso Milagro community bank. She is 71 years old, she is married and has ten children. Four have died and six are alive, they are married. Maxima's son-in-law dedicates himself to making paper bags. She saw one day that it was easy and asked him to teach her. This is how she started making paper bags to pack a variety of things. Maxima makes 100 paper bags per day from six o'clock in the morning until six in the evening, she works Monday through Saturday. Maxima needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy paper to make bags. Since she has been in FINCA, she keeps herself busy and she has more friends. She likes the camaraderie of the bank. Maxima's dream is to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paper to make bags.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del bancomunal Grandiosos Milagro.
T. es casada tiene 64 años, cuatro hijos que ya son mayores y están casados.
Juana empezó vendiendo en el mercado como ambulante, pero la competencia era mucha, vendía poco y tenia que llevar dinero a su casa tuvo la idea de viajar a provincia llevando su mercadería allí vio un nuevo mercado, ella ahora viaja a  Cerro de Pazco a la Orolla, vende en el  centro minero, una  vez al mes.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 3600 soles, para la compra de mercadería calzado, por docenas zapatillas sandalias, pantuflas por el día de la madre.
Desde que esta en Finca, su economía ha  mejorado, su negocio se ha levantado, puede comprar más mercadería, es más responsable con los préstamos que Finca le da.  
El sueño de  Juana es seguir luchando por su negocio, aunque sus hijos ya no quieren que trabajen, ella tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Grandioso Milagro community bank. She is married, is 64 years old, and has four children who are older and married. Juana began selling in the market as an itinerant but the competition was great, she sold little but still had to bring money home. She had the idea of traveling to the province and taking her goods and saw that there was a new market. She now travels to Cerro de Pazco a la Orolla where she sells in the mining center once a month. Juana needs a loan of 3600 soles to buy shoes, sandals and slippers for Mother's Day. Since she has been in FINCA, her income has improved, her business has increased and she can buy more merchandise. She is more responsible with the loans that FINCA provides her. Juana's dream is to continue fighting for her business. Although her children no longer want her to work, she wants to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes, sandals and slippers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth  es socia del bancomunal Grandioso  Milagro.
Elizabet es casada tiene 45 años, seis hijos de 28, 26, 21, 19, 12 y 10 años, estos dos últimos están estudiando  en la escuela estatal.  
Elizabeth  trabajaba cocinando pero la despidieron, se quedo sin trabajo, tenía que aportar a su casa, entonces tuvo la idea de vender en su casa cerveza y gaseosa, ella vende a puerta cerrada, su esposo es albañil, y no siempre tiene trabajo, solo por temporadas.    
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de 20 cajas de cerveza y 10 cajas de  gaseosa. 
Desde que esta en Finca, su economía ha mejorado, puede invertir en su negocio y sus hijos pueden estudiar en un instituto superior.  
El sueño de Elizabeth es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Grandioso Milagro community bank. Elizabeth is married, is 45 years old and has six children ages 28, 26, 21, 19, 12 and 10. The latter two are studying at public school. Elizabeth worked as a cook but was left without work. She had to support her household so she had the idea of selling beer and soft drinks from her home. She sells behind a closed door. Elizabeth's husband is a mason and doesn't always have work, only seasonally. Elizabeth needs a loan of 800 soles to buy 20 boxes of beer and 10 boxes of soft drinks. Since she has been with FINCA, her income has improved, she can invest in her business and her children can study at a better school. Elizabeth's dream is that her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 boxes of beer and 10 boxes of soft drinks.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny  es socio del bancomunal Grandioso Milagro.
Jhonny  se dedica a pintar casas, edificios, cuando hay obras, pero su vida no continuar así por que tiene una familia que mantener, se compro un carro de segunda y se puso a dar servicio de taxi trabaja todos los días de 7am hasta las  10 p.m. 
Jhonny necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para compra de piezas para su carro y arreglo de la caja. 
Desde que esta en Finca, le gusta las reuniones por que ve que las señoras son solidarias, se apoyan entre ellas cuando lo necesitan, son compañeras, y ayudan al prójimo. Su economía ha mejorado antes estaba muy apretado tenia que trabajar hasta  mas de la media noche, ahora trabaja hasta las 10pm tiene tiempo para pasar con su familia.   
El sueño de Jhonny es compra un carro mas, y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Jhonny is a member of the Grandioso Milagro communal bank. He paints houses and buildings when there is work, but his life cannot continue like this because the has a family to support. He bought a used car and began working as a taxi driver. He works everyday from 7am to 10pm. Jhonny needs a loan of 1200 PEN to buy parts for his car and to fix the gearbox. Since he has been in Finca, he has liked the meetings because he sees that the women are together in solidarity, they support each other when they need it, they are friends, and they help out those in need. His economic situation has improved. Before, things were very tight and he sometimes had to work until after midnight. Now he works until 10pm and he has time to spend with his family. Jhonny's dream is to buy one more car and to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jhonny needs a loan of 1200 PEN to buy parts for his car and to fix the gearbox.

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es:
Gaby es socia del bancomunal Grandioso Milagro.
Gaby es casada tiene 60 años, tres hijos de 37, 36 y 29, que están casados.
Gaby  es arequipeña, le gusta trabajar y empezó su negocio con el préstamo de Finca empezó comprando  y vendiendo  cerveza, gaseosa y con el tiempo empezó a dar almuerzo los fines de semana, viernes, sábado y domingo, así ella se mantiene para pagar los gastos de su casa.
Gaby necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para la compra de mercadería de zapatos por docenas.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a la importancia de ser unidad, colaboradora entre las socias se apoyan mutuamente comparten ideas de negocio.  
El sueño de gaby es tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Gaby is a member of the Grandioso Milagro communal bank. She is married and is 60 years old. She has three children, who are 37, 36, and 29 years old and are married. Gaby is from Arequipa. She likes to work and she started her own business with the loan from Finca. She began by buying and selling beer and soft drinks. After a while, she began offering lunches on the weekends: Friday, Saturday, and Domingo. With this business she is able to pay her household expenses. Gaby needs a loan of 2,400 PEN to buy shoes by the dozen. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned the importance of being supportive and collaborative with the other members, who mutually support each other and share business ideas. Gaby's dream is to have a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer
